loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen, 36, lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has six children.

For the last 8 years, Hen has been growing cassava and rice. To better support the family, she also works as a paid worker. She can earn about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Hen has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles and now she is applying for a loan to pay for buying fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase posts and mesh to put up a fence, and to purchase sheet metal and headers to change the roof over the patio.

loans.name: Fraternel Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Tumaini est une commerçante d’une expérience de 11 ans, âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est présidente et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Fraternel». Elle est vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une pharmacie sur la route principale de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter des boites de médicaments modernes(Antibiotiques, anti-inflammatoires etc.). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  achever sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The borrower, Tumaini, is a retailer with 11 years of experience in her field of work.  She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of seven children who all attend school.  She is also a member and the president of the "Fraternel" business group.  She sells pharmaceutical products, which she displays inside a pharmacy located along the side of her city's main road.

Tumaini is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to boost her business.  She plans to use this loan to buy boxes of medications such as antibiotics and anti-inflammatory drugs.  She started in this business with some money received from her husband who also works in retail.

In the future, Tumaini would like to finish building her house.  She also wants to be able to contribute to her family's food expenses and continue to send her children to school.  She thanks Hekima for the support it provides, in the form of microcredit, to female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this post-conflict period in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy boxes of medications such as antibiotics, anti-inflammatory drugs etc.

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Leonor es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, casada madre de dos hijos mayores, junto a su esposo ha puesto todo su empeño en ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y mejorar su vivienda, ella labora como enfermera en un hospital de la capital, su esposo por su parte en encargado de una bodega en una ferretería, solicita el crédito para la compra de Materiales como Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Piedrin, ella realizara un cuarto anexo en su vivienda para tener así mejor comodidad. Muy agradecida se muestra doña Leonor por este financiamiento que Kiva y Afodenic le están brindando.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonor lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is married and has two adult children. Together with her husband Leonor has put all her efforts into improving their standard of living and their home. She is a nurse in a hospital in the capital city; her husband is manager of a hardware store.

Leonor is seeking a loan to buy construction material such as cement blocks, cement, sand, steel rods, and gravel to build another room on to their house to make it more comfortable. She is very grateful for this loan that Kiva and Afodenic are providing.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
Luego de trabajar mucho años como empleada lo cual lo tuvo que hacer para generar recursos para su familia pues de ella dependía en absoluto su familia la señora Nancy se le da la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio de venta y distribución de comidas para ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de varios implementos para renovar su equipos y comprar unos más avanzados para minimizar tiempos de producción , Nancy ha sido una persona muy pobre y de pocas oportunidades por dicha razón este crédito significa mucho para ella pues es la oportunidad de crecer y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Con el crédito comprara licuadora, ollas en acero inoxidable y varios implementos como cucharones etc.
texts.en: After working for many years as a maid, which she had to do to earn a living for her family that depended on her, Nancy now has the opportunity to start her own business selling and distributing food.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase various kitchen instruments to upgrade her equipment, and purchase more advanced equipment to reduce production times.  Nancy has been a very poor person with few opportunities, which is why this loan means a lot to her because it is an opportunity to grow and improve her family's living conditions.  With the loan, she will purchase a blender, stainless steel pots and various kitchen instruments like ladles.

loans.use: purchase kitchen equipment and an industrial blender.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es el dueño de un lavado de carros hace dos años actividad que inicio empíricamente por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sus dos hijos y esposa pues no contaba con un empleo para mantenerlos, brinda el servicio desde su hogar y agradece mucho a dios por permitirle trabajar y llevar a su casa un bocado de comida.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos que le hacen falta para su normal operación como lo son cera, champo, esponjas y una manguera para operar, también quiere contar con capital de trabajo para su desplazamiento. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá mejorar sus servicios y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is the owner of a carwash. He began this business two years ago. He learned the business empirically because he needed to earn money for his wife and two children, but did not have a job to support them. He provides the service from his home and thanks God for allowing him to work and bring home food for his family.

He requests a loan to purchase supplies that he needs to operate his business normally, like a hose, soap, sponges, and wax. He also needs working capital to move. 

With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve the services he provides and continue to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a hose, sponge, soap, and wax, and for capital for his move.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Aged 58 years, Ren is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children.

She earns a living through growing rice and working as a construction worker.  To give better support, she also works as a garment worker. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the needs of the family.

This is the fourth loan for Ren with VisionFund. She has used the loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Mao is aged 46 years and married with five children.

For more than 28 years, she has been farming rice to make a living while her husband is a garment worker. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is the first loan for Mao with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland, to increase her rice farming production and to make more cassava, all to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Hoy is 45 years old. She is a farmer in the local area where she grows cassava for a living. Having been in the business for 27 years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 27,000 KHR and after expenses is able to save about 10,000 KHR per day for future needs.

This is the second loan for Hoy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yuthor's Group

texts.en:
Yuthor, 52, lives with her husband in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have struggled to make a living by planting tobacco and raising chickens. In addition to that, she also sells Khmer noodles in the village. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day for the future.

Yuthor has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is going to lead her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials to support her sales of Khmer noodles. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy materials to support her sales of Khmer noodles

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe  Dushirukumwete et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 39 ans et est marie à  Elias, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  dont 1  étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes, maïs et haricot depuis 25 ans.  

Elle est à son quinzième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande quantité de bananes, de maïs et  de haricot,   à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Dushirukumwete group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 39 years old and married to Elias, who works in retail.  Jacqueline and Elias have three children, one of who attends school.
 
Jacqueline has been selling bananas, maize and beans for the past 25 years.  This is her fifteenth loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, maize and beans, which she will resell in order to increase her income.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of bananas, maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Nicolas Alfonso

texts.es:
A sus 53 años de edad Nicolás desempeña una profesión poco común la cual es la reparación compra y venta de pasa-cintas, actividad que ha ejercido durante muchos años, es una profesión ya poco vista pero él dice que alguien la tiene que prestar por eso esta incondicionalmente en su negocio en buenas y malos tiempos y en verdad ama su profesión.
Quiere mejorar el aspecto de su negocio por ello solicita un crédito para la adecuación y mejora de su local y también quiere invertir en surtido que puede generar buenas ganancias.
Nicolás es padre de 2 hijos por los cuales luchara hasta el día de su muerte.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 53 years old and has an uncommon job, which is the repair, sale, and purchase of seatbelt holders. He has had this job for many years. It is a little-known job but he says that someone has to provide the service, so he is unconditionally dedicated to his business in good and bad times and really loves his job.

He would like to improve certain aspects of his business, which is why he requests the loan. He would like to improve his location and invest in stock so that he can generate more income.

Nicolas is the father of two children, for whom he will fight until the day he dies.

loans.use: to improve his commercial shop, increase publicity, and purchase more seatbelt buckles.

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Savon lives in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 38 years old and married with five children.

To support her family, she has been faming rice and selling second-hand clothes in the local area for more than several years. The current business earns her about 33,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
Savon has just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Savon will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to make more rice crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hoern's Group

texts.en:
Hoern, 62, is a married mother living with her six children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and raising pigs and she has been in this business for 30 years, earning about KHR 33,000 per day and after expenses is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Hoern has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is a 54-year-old mother of five children and earns a living through farming rice while her husband works for others for a fee. One of her children is still in school.

She has been in this business for 30 years and the current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to feed the family.

Mach is a third-loan-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Mach will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es:
33 años ha sido el tiempo que ha durado Jaime en su punto de venta de jugos naturales y comidas siendo la principal ventaja su tiempo de operación pues lo conoce mucha gente y ha logrado fidelizar mucha clientela.
Jaime ha tenido que sufrir y pasar innumerables adversidades para mantener su negocio pero a pesar de ello siempre está en pie y sale todos los días a trabajar desde la madrugada.
Su principal sueño es montar varios puestos de comidas con la cual complementar sus servicios y para ello sabe que tiene que vender más por dicha razón solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en general como frutas, leche, milo e insumos para sándwich
texts.en:
For 33 years Jaime has run his stall selling natural juices and food. The length of time he's been in business is his main advantage as he knows many people and has created a loyal following. He has had to overcome numerous problems to keep his business going, but despite them he is always keen to set off for work early every morning.  

Jaime's greatest dream is to run several food stalls so he knows that he has to sell more. For this reason he is seeking a loan so he can buy more stock such as fruit, milk, Milo, and sandwich ingredients.

loans.use: Buy fruit, Milo, milk and ingredients for sandwiches

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, 41, lives with her husband and two children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as paid workes. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Srey’s group consists of two members who have just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Now Srey is leading this group to seek a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Houn is now 52 years old and married. She has four children.

Houn and her husband are farmers who grow rice as their main business to support the family. To better support her family, she also works as a paid worker. Having been in the business for 20 years, they are able to make daily earnings of 28,000 KHR and manage to save about 18,000 KHR each day.

This is the fourth loan for Houn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her cassava plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy stock for his grocery store

loans.name: Générosité B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbuyato est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Générosité B », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un magasin de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 180 pièces  de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, accroitre son activité, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The borrower, Mbuyato, works in retail and she is a member of the «Générosité B » business group.  She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of six children who all attend school.  Mbuyato is also a dynamic entrepreneur who sells "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics).  She displays her goods in a shop, in town, and she has been involved in this activity for the past five years.  Mbuyato has already taken loans with the micro-finance institution Hekima. Her husband is a teacher.  Thanks to this new loan, she will be able to buy 180 pieces of "pagnes".  In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land, boost her business, feed her children and continue to send them to school.  She is very thankful to Hekima for empowering women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 180 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics).

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 33, is from a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has two kids. One is still too young for school while the other is in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing mushrooms. The current business earns her about 14,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sreymom has been with VisionFund for four cycles and fully repaid the loans. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: Doña Mariana gracias a su primer financiamiento el cual fue utilizado para terminar de dar una magnifica asistencia a sus cultivos de café teniendo la oportunidad de plantar un vivero que tenía el cual fue elaborado el año anterior. Doña Mariana Relata que antes de trabajar con la cooperativa COMIXMUL con otra institución financiera que anteriormente trabajaba los interese eran muy altos por la misma cantidad que fue solicitada por lo tanto es más difícil de pagar. Con dicho financiamiento ella logro comprar abono, urea, alto 100 y fertilizantes para combatir las plagas que asechan las plantas de café ya que muchos de los cultivadores perdieron por completo sus plantaciones. En esta nueva ocasión ella solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de nuevos insumos que podrá aplicar a sus cultivos de café en esta nueva temporada logrando protegerlos a tiempo de plagas y enfermedades las cuales quiere evitar pues el año pasado se vio afectada por estas y en esta ocasión quiere evitar lo sucedido esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA.
texts.en:
Doña Mariana, thanks to her first loan that she used to complete the fine care that she gave to her coffee crops, had the opportunity to plant the nursery that she created the year before.

Doña Mariana describes that, before working with the COMIXMUL cooperative, at another financial institution that she formerly worked with, the interest rates were very high for the same amount requested, therefore more difficult to pay.  With such loan she was able to buy manure, urea, Alto 100 fungicide, and fertilizers to control the pests that target the coffee plants, since many of the farmers completely lost their plantations.

In this new occasion, she requests a new loan to buy new inputs, which she will be able to apply to her coffee crops in this new season, getting to protect them in time from plagues and diseases that she wants to avoid, as last year she was affected by these, and in this occasion she wants to avoid what happened, hoping to be supported by the different lenders in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to tend her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La mejor expresión de belleza de todo ser humano es su sonrisa y el calor humano con el que trata a otras personas, estos son valores que tiene la señora Gladys muy definidos y muy marcados en su personalidad pues su gran carisma hace que otras personas le cojan afecto rápidamente.
Gladys trabajo durante muchos años en una empresa reconocida fabricando postres y tortas y ya a su avanzada edad es una mujer pensionada.
Gladys no le gusta estar inactiva disfruta realizar su profesión y por ello siguió fabricando postres y vendiéndolos clandestinamente al mejorar sus ventas pues cada día se hace conocer en el mercado Gladys demanda herramienta de trabajo y es por ello que solicita un crédito para la compra de una batidora, moldes y materia prima.
El gran sueño de Gladys es tener salud para seguir ejerciendo la profesión que ama
texts.en:
The best expression of all human beings is their smile and the human warmth that they treat other people with. These are values that Gladys has defined and marked very well in her personality. Her great charisma makes other people like her quickly. 

Gladys worked for many years in a well known business making desserts and cakes. At her advanced age, she is a retired woman now. Gladys doesn't like to be inactive and she enjoys her profession. That is why she continued making desserts and selling in secret. Her sales improved because she gets to know the market every day. Gladys needs work tools and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy a mixer, molds and raw materials. Gladys' big dream is to be healthy enough to keep practicing the profession she loves.

loans.use: to buy a mixer, molds, and raw materials to make her desserts.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak is a 57-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Srey Snom district in Cambodia.

To earn a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 19 years.

Lak has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. She proudly states that she successfully repaid the prior loans. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to generate more income from her current business as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming business by purchasing fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr:
Madame Maty, âgée de la quarantaine, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a ouvert une mercerie dans le marché, où elle vend de la garniture utilisée pour la confection. Sa cantine n’étant pas aussi bien fournie, elle aimerait renforcer son fond pour acheter les produits qui sont le plus demandés par la clientèle : boutons, fermetures, renfort, popeline, fil…Maty travaille de 9h à 14h et l’après-midi, elle s’occupe de son foyer. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et appuie son époux dans les charges de la maison.
Elle a comme projet futur, d’agrandir son espace commercial, d’augmenter ses marchandises et d’y associer même la vente de tissus dans la boutique même.
texts.en:
Maty is about forty years old.  She has been actively involved in retail for the past five years.  She is married and a mother.  She has opened a small haberdashery shop at the market and she sells dress-making supplies.  Since she currently has a very small stock of merchandise in her retail outlet, she would like to increase her capital and buy the goods for which she receives the highest demand from her customers: buttons, zippers, lining, poplin, threads etc..

Maty works from 9AM until 2PM.  After 2PM she takes care of her household.  She contributes to the family's day-to-day expenses and helps her husband to provide for the family.

In the future, she is planning to increase the size of her retail outlet.  She would also like to diversify her inventory and sell fabrics in her shop.

loans.use: to buy various sewing supplies.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a 30-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member, Bashir is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bashir can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare--double the national average of 14.

However, Bashir is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 45 bags of maize per hectare this season. Bashir is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as the result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Abu and Abdu. Bashir’s dreams do not end there: “Ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family,” he expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Malami Lawal

texts.en:
Malami Lawal is a farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Malami Lawal is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Malami Lawal can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize--more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, which is double the national average of 14. 

However, Malami Lawal is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 90 bags of maize per hectare this season. Malami Lawal is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Jamie and Bashir. Malami Lawal’s dreams do not end there: “Ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family,” he expressed.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rabiu can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize--more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, which is double the national average of 14. 

However, Rabiu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 50 bags of maize per hectare this season. Rabiu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children, Yusuf, Samaila, and Nazira. Rabiu’s dreams do not end here: “Ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family,” he said.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi. Bello said that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Bello to join Babban Gona. 

Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bello can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. 

However, Bello is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Bello will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Bello will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet, aged 49, is living in a rural village of the Choeng Prey district and has seven children.

She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and watermelon for a living. They have been in this business for 29 years, earning about 80,000 KHR per day to support her family's needs.

This is a micro loan for Yet from Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Aliou, s’active dans le commerce depuis 7 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il est actif de 7h du matin à 19h du soir et possède un étalage dans le marché. Son commerce consiste à vendre de la vaisselle, des ustensiles de cuisine comme on voit sur la photo : des bols, des assiettes, des carafes, des verres en caoutchouc… 
Aliou gère sa famille grâce à son activité car il peut descendre avec une recette journalière de 3500 voire 4 500 F après déduction des charges.
Aliou occupe un petit espace qu’il aimerait agrandir pour augmenter la quantité de ses produits.
texts.en: Aliou has been active in commerce for seven years. He is a married father of a family. He is active from 7 AM to 7 PM and owns a display at the market. His business involves selling dishes and kitchen utensils, as seen in the photo: bowls, plates, carafes, rubber cups…  Aliou manages his family, thanks to his business, since he can make a daily income of 3,500 francs, even 4,500 francs, after deducting expenses. He occupies a small space that he would like to expand in order to increase the quantity of his products.

loans.use: to purchase plates, bowls, carafes, rubber cups, etc. to resell

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet is a 43-year-old, married mother of four children residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province.

She is a farmer who grows rice as her main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for seven years.

This would be Yet's first loan through VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of two people to seek this loan. As the group leader, she would like to use her portion of the loan proceeds to buy kitchen and other household supplies for her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen and other household supplies

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
Soun is a 51-year-old, married woman with three children. She and her family reside in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Seim Reap province in Cambodia.

To support the family, she has been farming rice for several years. As a family, they earn approximately 94,000 KHR per day and save approximately 40,000 KHR per day for future needs.

Soun has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. She is now applying for another loan. As the group leader, she plans on using her portion of the loan proceeds to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice to increase her family’s income in order to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to increase her crop yield by purchasing fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kimleng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Kimleng is now 42 years old and married. She has three children. 

Kimleng and her husband are farmers who have been growing cassava for 22 years. To give better support, they also work as paid workers. Their current business earns them about 40,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs, and are able to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

Kimleng is a first-loan-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to seek a loan. Kimleng will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava. She hopes the loan from VisionFund will enable her to make more healthy rice to make more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sule Nadanko

texts.en:
Sule Nadanko is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Sule Nadanko expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Sule Nadanko to join Babban Gona. 

Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sule Nadanko can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize--more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize per hectare, which is double the national average of 14. 

However, Sule Nadanko is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Sule Nadanko will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Sule Nadanko will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Johnathan is a 30-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Johnathan is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Johnathan can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize--more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, which is double the national average of 14. 

However, Johnathan is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 60 bags of maize per hectare this season. Johnathan is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children. Johnathan’s dreams do not end there: “Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” he said.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama est un jeune « al poular » comme on appelle l’ethnie à laquelle il appartient. Il est marié, mais sa femme est resté au village, lui par contre est venu chercher fortune. Il a investit dans le commerce et gère une boutique de vente de divers produits, et en même temps une gargote qui vend le petit déjeuner. Adama a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine et vient pour la première fois solliciter l’appui de IMCEC pour acheter de la marchandise : sucre, savon, lait en poudre, thé…
Adama envoie à la fin de chaque mois, une somme à sa femme et à ses parents restés au village pour leur nourriture.
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un grand magasin et y stocker beaucoup de marchandises demandées par sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Adama is a young “al poular”, the name of the ethnicity to which he belongs. He is married, but his wife remains back in the village. He himself has come to seek his fortune. He has invested in commerce and manages a shop selling a variety of products. At the same time, he has a stall selling breakfasts. Adama has over five years of experience in this domain and is here for the first time to request support form IMCEC to purchase some merchandise: sugar, soap, powdered milk, tea, …

At the end of every month, Adama sends some money for food to his wife and parents back in the village. His ambition is to open a large store and to stock a lot of merchandise in demand by his customers.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items:  soap, milk, sugar to resell

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a 35-year-old farmer from Gwanki.

As a Babban Gona member, Salisu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salisu can earn up to 2,000 NGN this season by growing maize, which constitutes more than three times the typical Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, which is over two times the national average of 14.

However, Salisu is ambitious and is hoping that, with the benefit of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds to enable him to harvest at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season. Salisu is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that, with the expected increase in income as a result of this loan and a higher crop yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children (Zahardini, Musa, and Fa'Iza). Salisu’s dreams do not end here: ultimately, he wants to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To increase his crop yield and to expand his farming operations by purchasing fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Chhoun's Group

texts.en:
Chhoun is a 32-year-old, married woman with three children. She and her family reside in a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province in Cambodia.

She and her husband farm rice to earn a living. With her farming operations, she is able to earn approximately 34,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Chhoun is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is leading her group in seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and to be able to plow her field. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner and to provide a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to improve her farming operations by purchasing fertilizers and plowing her field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to aid her coffee crops for this new season

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven emprendedor, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Administración porque quiere convertirse en un gran profesional y brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia.
Desde hace dos años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte por todas las zonas de la ciudad en una mototaxi que tiene, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta, siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus clientes y respeta las señales de tránsito.
Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un televisor, para que de esta manera su familia pueda disfrutar de sus momentos libres viendo sus programas preferidos. Con esto estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para poder culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Miguel is a young entrepreneur, he is 27 years old, single and lives in Ica with his family. He is a person eager to get ahead. At the moment he is studying an administration major because he wants to become a great professional and give his family a better future.  

It has been two years since he has a made a living providing transportation services for all areas of the city on a motorcycle taxi he has. He does very well because he is a very responsible person, hardworking, honest, he always worries about the wellbeing of his customers, and he respects the transit signals. 

Miguel is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him, he will be able to purchase a television so that his family can enjoy their free time watching some of their favorite shows. This way, he will be improving the quality of life of his family, and he will keep making an effort to finish his college education.

loans.use: to purchase a television

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now Amadu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Amadu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Amadu. With this loan, Amadu is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Joaninha to improve her business.  She will buy some additional supplies such as gasoline and diesel.  She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day.    

Joaninha has been involving herself in business activities since 2011.  She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.  Running a business has made Joaninha independent because she can be responsible for herself and can also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like fabric, needles, and thread.

Edelyn has been in this business for 8 years now.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Esperanza works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher meat business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Esperanza is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat like pork, beef, and chicken to sell for her butcher meat business.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 33 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pork, beef, and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Francisca has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as bread, charcoal, salt, shampoo, soap, sugar, milk, groceries, etc.

Gina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as bread, charcoal, salt, shampoo, soap, sugar, milo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Joaguina

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Joaguina to improve her business.  She opened her secondhand store in 2009 with her own efforts. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, and short sleeves.  She is generating a good income from sales.

Joaguina has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself with doing this business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeves, and short sleeves.

loans.name: Belia Dalia

texts.es:
Belia es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 33 años de edad y vive en Irazola junto a su familia.
Tiene 4 hijos por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 13 años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el cacao el principal producto cultivado en sus terrenos debido a las buenas condiciones del ambiente. Le va muy bien, es una próspera empresaria porque es muy responsable, emprendedora y siempre se preocupa por brindar productos de calidad.
Belia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá cubrir los gastos de mantenimiento, y abonamiento de los cultivos, de esta manera su producción mejorará y tendrá mayores ingresos con los que podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sacarlos adelante. Así ella seguirá luchando para poder convertirse en la mejor productora de la zona.
texts.en:
Belia is a hardworking woman. She is 33 years old and lives in Irazola together with her family. She has four children for whom she fights day by day to be able to provide them a better future. 

For over 13 years she has worked in agriculture, cacao being the main product cultivated on her lands due to the good conditions of the environment. It goes very well for her. She is a prosperous entrepreneur because she is very responsible, enterprising, and she is always concerned with providing quality products. 

Belia is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided her, she will be able to cover the expenses of maintaining and fertilizing her crops. In this manner, her production will improve and she will have greater income with which she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family and get them ahead. In this way, she will continue fighting to make herself the best producer of the zone.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and fertilization of her crops.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Imelda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jumdah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming coconut.  Jumdah is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jumdah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 29 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming bananas and buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Jean is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers for her farm.

Jean has been farming bananas and buying and selling banana for 8 years, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with four children.  With two of her children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Josie is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josie has been farming vegetables for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Lucia is 30 years, and she is married. She has a small shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is now applying for her second loan of $800. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as shirts (long sleeve and short sleeve), trousers, shorts, as well as children's clothing. She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin), which offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: To buy shirts with long sleeves and short sleeves, trousers, shorts, as well as children's clothing

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
From the past several loans cycles, Made feels the benefit from her business. All of her plans and dreams are becoming a reality. She can sell all of the piglets with a satisfying price, and she obtains the profit. Now, she can carry out her dream to improve the kitchen, save money and fulfill the needs of her family. Currently, sows that she already owned have given birth to 20 piglets, and Made also bought a new sow from her last loan's profit. Now she has 9 sows.

But she is plagued with the waste generated by the pigs in large quantities. For that, she joined the biogas program from MUK. In addition to their funding, she will build a biogas reactor to maximize waste from the pig manure. In addition, she will receive an organic fertilizer that will be very useful for soil fertility in her garden. Made gets a 25.000.000 IDR loan. 10.000.000 IDR will be used to build the reactor and 15.000.000 IDR will be used to buy superior quality piglets and feed and make a new cage. She hopes the plan will be successful so that she gets maximum results and can reduce the costs in the kitchen and overcome the pollution of the environment.

loans.use: to build a biogas reactor, purchase superior piglets and feed and make a new cage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as cement, wood, nails and carpentry tools

loans.name: Saratu Anthoni

texts.en: Saratu Anthoni is a 38-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Saratu Anthoni is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu Anthoni can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu Anthoni is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Saratu Anthoni said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Bitrus, Apodia,and Hauwa, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Lalina

texts.en:
Lalina is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lalina is 57 years old and has children who are in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lalina requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fabrics, threads, needles and a sewing machine.

Lalina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Lalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics, threads, needles and a sewing machine

loans.name: Irma Marlene

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí se encuentra la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el maravilloso teleférico que existe en este Cantón, 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Irma una mujer luchadora de 25  ella mantiene una larga relación de casada de la cual tienen 3 hijos el mayor de 9 años y el ultimo de 2 años, el esposo trabaja en el consejo Provincial de Pichincha como jornalero. 
La señora Irma se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas aprendió de este negocio junto con la hermana al mismo le dedica un promedio de 12 horas diarias solo los fines de semana, viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo continuar con sus estudios, hoy en día ella lucha muy duro para darle a sus hijos un buen futuro y se preparen para que no tengan que sufrir como lo hizo ella. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio para arreglarlo y ampliarlo para ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes, con esta nueva inversión mejorará sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de la familia.
La señora Irma agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, better known as Cantón del Amor, is full of kind and hardworking people. It is a very touristy place because of its various waterfalls, lodging options, and the marvelous climate. Here is the waterfall of love, which can be reached very quickly by the marvelous cable car in Cantón. 

In this Cantón, the 25-year-old fighter Señora Irma lives and has a business. She maintains a longtime relationship with her husband and together they have three children, the oldest of whom is 9 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Her husband works in the provincial government of Pinchincha as a day laborer. 

Irma makes a lives selling fast food. She learned the business along with her sister and she dedicates an average of 12 hours to her work each day and weekend. She comes from a family of few financial resources and she could not continue with her studies. Today, she fights very hard to give her children a good future and to prepare them so that they will not have to suffer like she has. 

Irma is requesting this loan to invest in her business to fix it up and to expand it so she can offer a better service to her customers. With this new investment, she will increase her income and the quality of life of her family. 

Irma is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunities they offer.

loans.use: to fix up and to expand her fast food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gilma Emperatriz

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Gilma, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores  de edad que aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Gilma se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  aves de corral, los cuales los cría de dos a tres meses que es el tiempo que  están listos para la venta, ella entrega en algunas tiendas en la localidad y también vende por libras a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa.  Tiene muchos años dedicada a esta labor con la cual le ayuda a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es la forma como  puede financiarse y salir adelante, con sus ganancias ella pudo construir otro galpón con el cual espera aumentar sus ingresos. Este  crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the "Estancia Vieja" communal bank meet every fortnight in the area called Estancia Vieja in Colon Parish, in the city of Portoviejo. The locals are humble people that work in agriculture and commerce. 

In this place lives Gilma, who is 57 years old and married. From this relationship she has three children of legal age, who are still living at her house. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Gilma raises pigs and poultry for two to three months. When they are ready for sale, she sells them in some local stores, and also sells by the pound to the buyers that go to her house. She has done this activity for a lot of years, and it allows her to help her husband to sustain their home.

She is asking for a loan again, since it is the way in which she can help herself financially and get ahead. With her earnings she was able to build another shed, and she hopes to increase her incomes. She will use this loan to buy chickens, feed and medicines for chickens and pigs. 

She is founder of the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans are of great help. Her dream is to continue working.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Ledevina

texts.en:
Ledevina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell. Ledevina has been in this business for 15 years. Ledevina earns more income from pig fattening and as a rice mill operator.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Chanboriththida

texts.en:
Chanborithida is 27 years old, a Korean interpreter in Phnom Penh. She can earn approximately $3 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $200 to pay her tuition fee for a Bachelor Degree. This loan will help her to graduate and achieve her future plans. 

In the future, she wants to work in any organization or Korean company.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 39-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Deborah is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Deborah can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Deborah is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Deborah said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my daughter Jennifer, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Husaini

When asked, Husaini said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” 

With this loan, Husaini is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Luz

Luz has been pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy ingredients for her food production business. Benita has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Nelfa has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Ishaya is a maize farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 50 years old and has three children.  She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ana Mae requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Mae has been fattening pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Berline

texts.en:
Berline is 44 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of fattening pigs in the Philippines. Berline requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens.

Berline has been fattening pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens.

loans.name: Jane Lilet

texts.en:
Jane Lilet is 24 years old and married to Patrick. They are blessed with two kids. Jane Lilet is a very loving person and she is involved in business at a welding shop in the community. Her business has run for more than four years. To serve her customers well, she is asking for a loan amounting to 13,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy rods, welding rods, and metal for her business.

Jane Lilet hopes that her business expands so that she can give her family all of their needs.

loans.use: to buy rods, welding rods, and metal for her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, soft drinks, sugar, spices, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as can goods, soft drinks, sugar and spices

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase more stocks to sell at her business.

Katherine has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from selling rice. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many sandals, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emily has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid loads).

Emily aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 50 years old and married with ten children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fely is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Fely has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling peanut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 44 years old and married with seven children.  With one child in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Annie works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Annie is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Annie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en: Medina, is aged 58, a mother of 5 children, and widowed. Medina has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 9,000 every month. Due to insufficient funds from her business, she is asking for Php 10,000 loan from KIVA lenders for the tuition fee of her daughter who is a 2nd year student of BS Entrepreneurship. Medina believes that this loan will help her daughter to have a successful career.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Anabella works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anabella is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Anabella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ronalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Ronalyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to purchase more footwear, toys, clothing, and home products.

Ronalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear, toys, clothing, and home products.

loans.name: Mariche

texts.en:

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy more stocks to sell.

Mariche has been in this business for two years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en: Remy is 46 years of age, married to a farmer and blessed with four children. Aside from being a mother to her four children, Remy also sells pork meat to have an additional income. As a mother, she wants her children to finish their college educations. Because of that, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to pay for the tuition fees, allowance, books, and uniforms of her daughter Joy. Joy wants to take up a B.S. of Criminology because she want to serve her country. Also, she wants to help her parents to improve their status of living.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, allowance, books, and uniforms of her daughter Joy.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years of age. She is married to a farmer, and blessed with four children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost 18 years now. However, her income is not enough to support all their daily needs as well as the educational needs of her children. 

Because of that, Nancy is asking for a 12,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan from Kiva lenders for the tuition fees of her son, Ricarte, who is a second year student in one of the universities in their area. Nancy and Ricarte hope that the lenders will approve this loan because they believe that it will definitely help Ricarte with his education and to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, books, and uniforms of Ricarte, her son.

loans.name: Milagros

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.

Milagros has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, fish and spices for her restaurant

loans.name: Ana

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ana is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed, rice and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds,barns rice  and vitamins for her pigs
