Josephine has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shirt and pants to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gina is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy more fish to make dried fish.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
Dinora de 40 años de edad,  ha estudiado hasta bachillerato,es casada su esposo se dedica a albañil,tienen dos hijos ya adolescentes estudian,viven casa propia.


Dinora es empleada en una farmacia por nueve años,el trabajo lo adquirió debido a la necesidad de darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos,el horario de trabajo de ella es de 8:00  AM a 6:00 PM.

 
El préstamo lo utilizara para construir un muro perimetral, debido a que su casa esta insegura y dejan solo todo el día.

El sueño de Dinora es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales y  con el tiempo trabajen y se sostengan por ellos mismos, se ganen la vida y seguir trabajando con credicampo.
texts.en:
Dinora is 40 years old and studied through high school. She is married and her husband works as a bricklayer. They have two teenage children who are studying. She and her family live in their own home.

Dinora has worked as a pharmacy employee for nine years. She acquired her job because she needed to provide everything her children need. Her work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.

This loan will be used to build a perimeter wall since her house is insecure and left empty all day. Dinora’s dream is to see her children become professionals so that they can work, support themselves, and earn a living. She also wants to continue working with CrediCampo.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy more fish to sell at her business.

Lucila successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Lucila's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribet is 28 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking person on her bicycle. She wakes up early in the morning and prepares breakfast for her kids and after that she rides her bicycle to offer her products in the community. Maribet dreams that someday she will have her own stall in front of their house. She hopes that she can save enough money to save for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and green leafy vegetables for her business

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. 

Eleonor requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional rice seedlings and fertilizer. She has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia, aged 36, is married to a rickshaw driver. The couple is blessed with three children. Roselia has managed a hog raising business for almost five years now and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) a month from the business. 

Due to insufficient funds for the education of her daughter (named Judy Rose), she is asking for a loan from the generous lenders through ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) amounting to 10,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fees of Judy Rose. Her daughter is taking up a B.S. of Business Administration. Roselia and Judy Rose are hoping that their requested loan will be granted because they believe that it will definitely help Judy Rose to have a successful career.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees of he daughter, Judy Rose.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling coconut wine and vinegar in the Philippines.

She requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Enriquita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell.

Ester has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

texts.en:
Ma. Asuncion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Ma. Asuncion would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 33 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Analiza is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Analiza has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and  vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is 27 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $80. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, fish, coffee and slippers. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, fish, coffee and slippers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 48 years old, is married with six children. She has been engaged in selling different clothes in the community for 22 years. She loves fashion; that's why she built a business about selling clothing. 

Evangeline is a very responsible woman. She loves to communicate with different people, most especially, her customers. 

To have additional income, she is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy pants, shorts, blouses and different shirts for her business. 

In the future, Evangeline hopes that she can save enough money for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, blouses and different shirts for her business.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is aged 42. She is married to a driver and blessed with eight children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village and has for almost five years. She is earning a net income of 1,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, noodles, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, noodles and beverages to sell.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is studying in the university in order to have a better future. She had to move forward with the support of her parents. She says success is not a final failure; it is not fatal, but it is the courage to continue that counts.

This line makes her believe that she had to continue for her parents, working for them to have a better future. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to pay the school tuition fee for this semester. To get a better job is her ambition.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for this semester

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old, married and had two children. He is managing a store with his spouse. They also manage a small bakery for income. Pedro wanted to increase his sales and will strenghten his small bakery. He is asking for additional capital of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy sardines, soap, biscuits and flour to make breads to sell. It will help attain good sales and profits as well. 

If Pedro will gain good sales and profits, he will achieve financial stability for his family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy sardines, soap, biscuits and flour to make bread to sell

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie owns and manages a farm, growing and harvesting corn for sale. He had his previous loan he used for farming and had successfully repaid. 

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. Improving his farm is his main purpose in order to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, la menor aún viven con ellos. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Rosa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice para su trabajo, el en la época invernal siembra maíz, maní y necesita del crédito para pagar la mano de obra. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende bebidas como aguas, sodas, cervezas y colas, esto le deja ganancias extras por el bien de su familia.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito por que gracias al crédito tuvieron una buena producción y ahora esperan realizar otro crédito para la recolección de los frutos. Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra para la recolección de los frutos y para comprar aguas, sodas y cervezas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan  los créditos. Sus sueños tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
In the area known as Estancia Vieja, in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, the members of Estancia Vieja loan group meet every five days. It's an area of humble people, dedicated to agriculture and commerce in general.

Rosa, who is 55, lives in this area. She's married, and has five older children from this union, the youngest of whom still lives with them. Her husband earns a living through agriculture.

Rosa is taking out the loan so that her husband can use it for his work. In the winter season, he plants corn and peanuts, and needs the loan to pay for labor. 

She has a small business in her house where she sells drinks like water, sodas, beer and colas. This gives her extra income for the benefit of her family.

She's repeating the loan because thanks to her previous loan, she had a good production. She now hopes to have another loan for harvesting the crops. This loan is to pay for labor for the harvest of the fruits, and to buy water, sodas and beer. 

She is at the start in the loan group, and she likes it because of the help the loans give her. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy sodas, waters and beers.

loans.name: Cristina Aracely

texts.es:
Cristina  de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería, ambos son los responsables de la manutención de su hijo de 14 años de edad quien está estudiando su octavo grado, es un adolecente muy respetuoso y educado.

Cristina tiene un puesto de industria y comercio de tortillas, labor que tiene tres años de realizar a pesar de todos los esfuerzos que le toca realizar, es una mujer que no la hace cara fea al trabajo, comenta que todo su esfuerzo es para aportar con los ingresos al hogar. Ella aprendió de su mamá desde pequeña, su madre la indujo por el buen camino de la responsabilidad y el esfuerzo al trabajo, esfuerzo que no fue en vano porque creció una hija ejemplar. No tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, antes de tener su propio puesto de tortillas, trabajaba ayudándole una señora que la buscaba a que también le ayudara con elaboración de tortillas. Ahora ella paga una persona que le ayude a atender a toda la clientela, ya que tiene bastante demanda, nadie más se involucra en el negocio. El horario que tiene es de las 3 de la mañana que se levanta a preparar el maíz e irse al molino para ya a las 6 am tener todo listo para dedicarse solo hacer y vender, cierra su venta a la 1 pm.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de 10 sacos de maíz y una camionada de leña, por lo que tendrá una buena inversión, la mejora que del préstamo será el poder comprar suficiente materia prima para hacer frente a la demanda que tiene, la necesidad satisfecha será el poder comprar por mayor lo que a diario necesita.
 

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que podrá cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Cristina is 37 years old and studied through the fourth grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in masonry. Both of them are responsible for supporting their 14-year-old son, who is in the eighth grade. He is a very respectful and studious teenager.

Cristina has a stand where she works and sells tortillas. She has been in this trade for three years despite all of the efforts it took for her to get started. Cristina is a woman who does not go about her work with a begrudging look on her face. She says that all of her efforts are geared to contributing to the household income. Cristina learned this trade as a child from her mother, who encouraged her to go down the good path of responsibility and hard work. Her mother’s efforts were not in vain because she raised an exemplary daughter. Cristina was not involved in any other activities prior to establishing her tortilla stand. She works with the help of a woman who was also looking for someone to assist her with making tortillas. Cristina currently pays this employee to help her attend to all of the customers since there is already adequate demand. No one else is involved in the business. Her schedule begins at 3:00 A.M. when she has to wake up in order to prepare and grind the corn. By 6:00 A.M., she has everything ready to make and sells tortillas. She stops making sales at 1:00 P.M.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy 10 sacks of corn and a truckload of firewood, which will be a good investment. The improvement that his loan will bring will enable her to buy sufficient supplies so that she can meet the existing demand. She can accomplish this by purchasing her everyday supplies at wholesale.

Her dreams include constantly growing her sales so that she can have more income. As a result, she would be able to cover her needs and those of her family. The profits would also be invested in her loan payments and the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of corn and a truckload of firewood.

loans.name: Libania

texts.en:
Libania is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as trousers for schoolchildren. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Libania is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy trousers for schoolchildren

loans.name: Gesita

texts.en:
Gesita helps her husband manage their farm to make a living. Doing this for more than four years makes her improve her ability in farming. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm and is now currently borrowing a loan to purchase organic fertilizer. 

She is hopeful that they will have an abundant harvest to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, 46 years old, is married and from the San Jose province of Isabela. Daisy has been engaged in selling different food products for 20 years. Daisy is requesting a loan amounting to 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fish, chicken and meat for her stall. Daisy hopes that her business expands so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken and meat for her stall.

loans.name: Kernie Jane

texts.en: Kernie Jane is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She studied in a university in order to fulfill her dreams of becoming a successful computer engineer. Her parents earn a living by selling fish in the market. She needs financial assistance to pay tuition fees. With her GDMPC (Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative) education loan, she will be able to continue her studies and hopefully in the future, she will find a better job in line with her desires.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 46 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analyn has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like clothes, body lotion, home products and school supplies.

Analyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like clothes, body lotion, home products and school supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and repair shop. 

Cecilia is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: El G.S. Dios es Amor, está conformado por cuatro integrantes Julia Bertha, Beatriz Isabel, Dany, Santos Francisca, todos solteros, con 8 hijos menores de edad y bajo su responsabilidad, originarios de uno de los municipios del norte del departamento de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, ganadería, agricultura, entre otros más, estos integrantes se conocen muy bien porque son de la misma zona motivo por el cual deciden forma un Grupo Solidario para ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocios, Julia Bertha quien es la coordinadora del Grupo Solidario es quien se encargara de la responsabilidad  y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de una panadería donde ofrece productos de consumo de pan de maíz como: cosa de hornos, rosquillas hojaldras también pan dulces, simples, repostería, galletas simples, dulces entre otros, también tiene se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general a si como ropa nueva, zapatos, celulares, accesorio de celulares, laminados de acero y plata etc., y tiene una pequeña pulpería donde oferta productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos congelados, golosinas, gaseosas, juegos, sopas maruchan, papel higiénicos entre otros más, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de la localidad y distribuidoras, sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios y verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales, incrementar su negocio y en un futuro no muy lejano poder comprar un medio de transporte para surtir pedidos. el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima como: harina, manteca, queso, azúcar, productos de consumo del hogar, entre otros mas, gracias a la variedad de productos y la buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes es que su demanda ha crecido más y necesita para surtir más sus negocios y de esa forma satisfacer las necesidades y demandas de sus clientes. el Grupo Solidario Dios es Amor, agradece mucho la oportunidad que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Dios Es Amor” (God Is Love) consists of four members: Julia Bertha, Beatriz Isabel, Dany, and Santos Francisca. All of them are single and are responsible for eight young children among them. They are originally from one of the towns in the northern part of the Department of Chinandega, which is in western Nicaragua. This area is known for being productive in trade, livestock breeding, agriculture, and other sectors. The members know one another very well because they are from the same area. They decided to form a solidarity group so that they could help one another financially and invest in their different businesses.

Julia Bertha is the coordinator of this solidarity group. She is responsible for submitting the payments on time and in the correct manner. Julia is a micro-entrepreneur and the manager of a bakery where she offers baked goods made from corn, puffed donuts, sweet bread, simple bread, pastries, basic cookies, candies, and other items. She also buys and sells general merchandise such as new clothing, shoes, mobile phones, phone accessories, steel and silver plated goods, and other items. In addition, Julia has a small store where she offers everyday consumer products such as rice, sugar, oil, frozen products, snack foods, sodas, juices, ramen soups, toilet paper, and other items. She purchases her inventory with cash at the markets in her town and from distributors. Her sales are conducted for cash or on credit. She sells her products as a traveling vendor or from her home.

One of her dreams is to see her children finish their studies and fully develop into professionals. She also wants to increase her business and purchase a vehicle in the near future so that she can transport merchandise for fulfilling orders. The purpose of her new loan is to invest it as working capital so that she can buy basic goods such as flour, lard, cheese, sugar, household products, and other items. Thanks to the variety of products and good service that she offers to her customers, demand has grown. Therefore, she needs more inventory for her businesses. This will help her to satisfy the needs and demand of her customers.

The solidarity group “Dios Es Amor” is extremely grateful for the opportunity that the Kiva lenders have offered to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy a variety of household products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina continua dedicándose a su negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo boletos y tours para sus clientes que le solicitan del extranjero y otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos, y otros.
La socia está feliz con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ernestina still has her travel agency which she has been involved in for several years.  The business is prospering thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She continues to sell tour tickets to her customers and foreign visitors, and wants to continue working so she can support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy tour tickets and other items.  She is happy to have funding and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy tour tickets and other items.

loans.name: Mariana Jasmine

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Mariana se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en sus casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad y también vende por libras a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa.  Lleva 5 años dedicada a esta labor y esto le permite ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito, es la secretaria del grupo y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños es  ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales ya que es por lo que lucha todos los días.
texts.en:
The members of the “Estancia Vieja” communal bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo’s Colon Parish’s Estancia Vieja sector. This is a place of humble people dedicated to agriculture and general commerce. 

We met Mariana, 38, here. She’s married and has three children who are 18, 16 and 14 years old; all attend school. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Mariana raises pigs and barnyard fowl; she has a small farm at home. Seasonly, she buys large numbers of chicks that she raises for three months which is the time it takes to get them ready for sale. After this period of time she sells them to local stores or also by the pound or live to merchants that come by her house. She’s been doing this work for five years and it allows her to help with her children’s schooling costs. 

She will use this new loan to buy chickens, feed and medicine both for the chickens and for the pigs. She’s a founding member of the communal bank and is the group secretary; she’s very happy because they’ve helped her so much. Her dream is to see her children become good professionals and that’s what she strives for every day.

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed and medicines for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nolberto Fabian

texts.es:
El señor Nolberto un hombre luchador de 32 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 2 hijos el mayor tienen 8 años y el ultimo tiene 3 años ellos son la razón de su lucha por superarse día con día para darles un excelente futuro ya que su más grande sueño es ver a sus hijos siendo unos profesionales, la esposa no trabaja ella le ayuda en el negocio de los cerdos. 
Él vive y tiene el negocio en el recinto 6 de enero un lugar muy hermoso lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, el clima es cálido húmedo, él se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de este negocio junto con sus familiares y al ver que es un negocio muy rentable decidió ponerlo en marcha y hasta el momento tiene muy buenos resultados, diariamente entre en empleo y el negocio trabaja un promedio de 12 hora por día 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio en la ampliación y arreglo de las chancheras y también comprara alimentos para los cerdos, con esta inversión podrá mejorar e incrementar su producción y esto le generara más ingresos para él y su familia.
El señor Nloberto agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Nolberto, 32, has a solid relationship with his common-law wife with whom he has two children, ages eight and three years old, who are the motivation for his daily struggle toward giving them an excellent future.  His greatest dream is for his children to become professionals.  His wife does not work but helps him in the pig business.

He lives and runs his business in the community "6 de Enero" which is a very beautiful place with a warm, humid climate and full of kind, hard-working people.  He raises pigs for a living which he learned about from relatives.  Seeing that the business was profitable he decided to set up his own business and so is getting very good results.  He works an average 12 hours a day between his employment and his business.

Through this investment he will be able to increase production and generate more income for himself and his family.

Norberto is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: To repair and expand his pig pens.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a 53-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lanie has a bag-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan amount through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to buy new supplies for her bag-making business.

Lanie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора родилась в 1965 году. Она вместе со своей семьей живет на севере Таджикистана. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Гулнора является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и Гулнора с ежедневными проблемами и заботами справляется сама. Гулнора уже более 3 лет занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает коров и баранов. Она имеет большого коровника у себя дома. Гулнора сама продает скот на местном рынке. Иногда в этом деле помогает ей ее сын. Гулнора запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulnora was born in 1965. She lives with her family in the north of Tajikistan. She is married and is raising 3 children. Gulnora is the sole provider for her family because her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and Gulnora handles the daily problems and concerns by herself. Gulnora has been involved in animal husbandry for over 3 years. She fattens up cattle and sheep. She has a large cowshed at home. Gulnora sells the livestock herself at a local market. Her son sometimes helps her with this business. Gulnora is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy livestock in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz entre otros.
La socia está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member continues to work at her business selling food, which she has been involved in successfully for some time thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She prepares dishes such as chicken and rice, and others. She wants to continue working and supporting her family.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase rice and other items. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To by rice and other items.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Agueda tiene 50 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, leche entre otros, la socia a la vez tiene otro negocio de hostal, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Agueda is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusi Ccoyllor” which is located in the District of Vilcabamba in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Agueda divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. She sells different types of products such as rice, milk, and other items. Her other business is a hostel. Agueda wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, and other products. Agueda is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Robles

texts.es:
Robles es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.
Tiene 3 hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha incansablemente para poder brindarles una excelente educación y un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, el principal producto cultivado es el cacao, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovadora y siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Robles está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para poder abonar sus cultivos y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo hasta la etapa de la cosecha, con esto obtendrá mayores ingresos con las ventas. Gracias a esto seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Robles is an enterprising man. He is 40 years old and lives with his family in Yarinacocha.

Robles has three children who are his greatest source of pride. For this reason, he works tirelessly to provide them an excellent education and a better future.

For more than 10 years, Robles has worked in agriculture. The main crop that he cultivates is cacao. He is doing very well because he is a responsible, hardworking, and innovative individual who always offers quality products.

Robles is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have offered. He will be able to buy supplies for fertilizing his crops and providing them with adequate maintenance until harvest time. As a result, he will be able to generate more income from his sales. Robles continues to strive so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his cacao crops.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to provide for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as oils, body lotion, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, dried milk, sleepers, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, body lotion, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, dried milk, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely, 49 years of age, is widowed and has five children.

She has had a hog raising business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 per hog. Her income from this business is usually spent on the school costs for her children. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would now like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feeds to supply the needs of her hogs. 

She hopes that her business will continue to grow to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds for her hog raising business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is aged 34 and still single. She owns and operates a retail store in her village and earns a net income of 300 PHP (Philippine Pesos) daily. Due to a lack of capital, she would like to take a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, frozen foods, sugar, beverages, coffee, and milk to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, frozen foods, sugar, beverages, coffee, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.ru: Муминчон добрый и трудолюбивый человек, который живет в отдаленном регионе. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Муминчон и его семья занимаются фермерской деятельностью. Он откармливает коров. Этим бизнесом Муминчон занимается уже более 20 лет. Он данное время откармливает 2 голов коров и хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес. Муминчон с такой целью обратился за займом в сумме 4000 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного дохода он собирается улучшить условию проживания для семьи. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muminjon is a kind and hardworking person, who lives in a remote region. He is married and raising 3 children. Muminjon and his family are involved in farming. He fattens up cattle. Muminjon has been involved in this business for over 20 years. At the present time, he is fattening up 2 cows and wants to increase his working capital and, thus, develop his business. Muminjon requested a loan in the amount of 4000 to achieve this goal and buy livestock. He plans to use the resulting income to improve his family's living conditions. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase his working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cases of snacks and roasted groundnuts

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than four years. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying spare parts for repair and recently, he took a new loan to purchase new tires to replace the old used ones. He is planning to improve the business to have a better source of income for his family.

In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, los tres ya son mayores de edad y uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña María se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría de dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los vende  a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa, de igual manera lo realiza con los chanchos los cría hasta que estén listos y luego los vende a comerciantes.  Lleva muchos años dedicada a esta labor con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños es salir adelante.
texts.en:
In a community known as "Estancia Vieja" in the Colon Parish in the city of Portoviejo the members of the communal bank "Estancia Vieja" meet every fifteen days.  The community is made up of humble people who work in agriculture and general commerce.

Here is where Maria, 60, lives.  She is married and had four children, one of whom passed away.  The other three are adults and one lives with her.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Maria raises pigs and barnyard fowl.  She has a small farm at home and, seasonally, she buys a large number of chicks that she raises for a three-month period until they are ready to be sold.  Then she sells them to merchants who visit her home.  She does the same thing with the pigs.  Maria has been involved in this business for many years and earning an income for the family.

This new loan will be used to buy chicks, feed and medicine for the chickens and pigs.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes the help she receives from the group.  Her dream is to be prosperous.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed and medicine for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Andrea works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Arlene is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Gloria is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for ten years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity and running water connections in her home.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita ella es soltera y tiene 70 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frazadas, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal banking group "SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO" which is located in the city and district of Cusco, Peru.

One of the members, Margarita, is 70, single and has five children.  She runs a restaurant business and prepares different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups and meat stir-fry.  Her work schedule is from 10:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and she has been in business successfully for eight years.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant and she is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

The individual photograph of one of the members was taken after the group photo for work-related reasons.

The other members are involved in businesses such as blanket sales, animal farming, a grocery store and food sales.

Margarita is grateful to everyone taking part in her dream.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer and she helps earn income by operating a garden to make a living. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative and it helps them to improve their quality of living. She borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She was determined to improve their living and with this belief, she never get tired of working on the farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, chips, sugar, soap, etc. in her general store.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from a coffee shop and food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, chips, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jonelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Jonelyn is borrowing 28,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store business.

Jonelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking woman who, besides her fish selling business, operates a green grocery business. She greatly appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and produce for resale. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and produce for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one young child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and household consumables. 

For the past two years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuations as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kholdona

texts.ru: Холдона честная и образованная женщина. Ей 61 года. Она вдова и имеет одного совершеннолетнего сына. Она имеет педагогическое образование и в течение многих лет работает в средней школе. Так как ее зарплата маленькая и не хватает для проживания, она начала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды несколько лет. Она торгует на местном рынке и имеет свою торговую точку. Ее сын помогает ей введению бизнеса. Холдона старается продавать модные и удобные одежды и таким образом она привлекает покупателей. Холдона хочет купить детскую одежду для увеличения оборотного капитала и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kholdona is an honest and educated woman. She is 61 years old. She is a widow and has one adult son. She has a pedagogical education and has been working at a secondary school for many years. Because her salary is low and she does not have enough money for living, she started her own business of reselling children's clothing several years ago. She sells at a local market and owns her retail outlet. Her son helps her with running the business.. Kholdona tries to sell stylish and comfortable clothing and, thus, attract customers. Kholdona wants to purchase children's clothing in order to increase her working capital and is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to achieve this goal. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spices, baobab flour, Shea butter, and peppers

loans.name: Mejreme

texts.en:
Mejreme is 29 years old and a mother of a 9-year-old son. She lives with her family in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. Her husband works in construction, painting different buildings and houses in order to earn a living. 

Mejreme used to keep a cow to help with the family income and food, but she had to sell it to pay for other family expenses. Now, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new cow and renovate her stable. She will use the cow only for family use, cutting their expenses for milk and other diary products. She is very happy to have this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow and renovate her stable.

loans.name: Rrustem

texts.en: Rrustem is 30 years old and a married father of five children. He has three boys and two girls between the ages of 2 – 13 years and they all live together in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. Rrustem works in construction and collects plastic to sell. However, he still needs more money in order to build an annex for his room. He has said that without this loan, he is not able to complete any reports but does want to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to build an annex for his room.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish selling business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Gemma has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, gari [manioc flour], beans, and other food products

loans.name: Kwimage Group

texts.en:
Stellah is in her thirties and is a businesswoman. She has been managing a poultry business, a project that she has managing for three years now. She is not married and lives with her own two boys who are in school. She started her business with a few birds, but little by little she grew to more than 100 birds per one batch. Stellah starts working from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. every working day and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

She is now approaching Tujijenge Tanzania to find financial support so as to improve her business production more. Stellah, together with five other women, is requesting for a loan to be apportioned among Kwimage Group (six members). The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will use her portion to buy chicks and chicken feed to improve production. Stellah wants to become a great poultry business woman.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed to improve production.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргизе 46 лет. Она живет на районе Спитамен. У Наргизы не большая семья. Она замужем и в браке имеет двоих детей. Наргиза дома занимается куплей и продажей скотин. Данной деятельностью она занята уже 7 лет. Ей нравиться проводить время на скотном дворе. Она любит животных, и данный бизнес является прибыльным. Наргиза просит кредит, чтобы приобрести пару бычков, тогда у нее увеличиться поголовья скотин и расшириться бизнес, соответственно доходность тоже увеличиться. С такими планами она надеется получить кредит. Поддержите Наргизу, она заранее благодарит Вас.
texts.en: Nargiza is 46 years old and she lives in the Spitamen region.  She has a small family, which consists of her husband and two children.  She has been involved in buying and selling livestock for the past seven years.  She enjoys spending time on the farm.  She loves animals, and the business she is currently involved in is quite profitable.  She has turned to credit to purchase a couple of young bulls in order to increase her cattle headcount, expand her business, and consequently raise her income level.  With these goals in mind, she would like to receive a loan.  Please support Nargiza; she is thanking you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a couple of young bulls.

loans.name: Qory Orcco-Pucyura Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal QORY ORCCO - PUCYURA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Pucyura  en la provincia  de Anta departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ana, la socia es casada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de yogurth,nata entre otros, la socia lleva años en este su negocio administrándolo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende a pedido para todos sus clientes que le solictan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, agricultura, ganadería, venta de granos secos, panadería, crianza de animales menores, venta de verduras.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the "Qory Orcco - Pucyura" communal bank in the Pucyura district of the Ana province, Cusco department, Peru.

Ana is married and has one son. As well as looking after her home and child, she has a business producing yoghurt, custard and other products. Ana has been running this business for years, and it is going well thanks to her determination. Ana sells products on order. She is responsible and persevering. This is Ana's only way of helping her family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy supplies, including milk.

The other members of this group have businesses selling clothes, in farming, raising cattle, selling dry grains, a bakery, raising young animals, and selling vegetables.

The member in the smaller photo was unable to arrive on time to the meeting the day the photo was taken.

Ana is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, sheep and hens, and feed for the guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS GIRASOLES, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yanet Marlene tiene 42 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parad e esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosa entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican  la venta de ropa, restaurante y docentes.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a al reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yanet Marlene is a member of the "Los Girasoles" communal bank, in the Cusco province and department.

Yanet is 42 years old and has three children. She is single. In addition to carrying out the household chores, Yanet has a grocery store. She has had this business for some time now, and it is going well thanks to her determination every day. Yanet sells different types of products, such as rice, sugar and more. Yanet wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

Yanet is applying for a loan in order to buy fizzy drinks and other items. 

Yanet is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

The other members of the group work in the following areas: selling clothes, running a restaurant, and teaching.

The smaller photo is of one member who arrived late to the meeting where the group photo was taken; she was late due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and hire laborers for weeding, pruning, harvesting and transporting her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting the crops.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with three children and is operating her own farm in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur to make a living. She has been doing this for more than four years. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm and gather an abundant harvest in return. She is hopeful that with this line of business, she can support the needs of her children and be able to send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, soap, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, soap, maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn, vegetable oil, and fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal, fruit, and gari [manioc flour]

loans.name: Morena Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras,con el propósito de comprar mercadería e incrementar los ingresos en el hogar, desde hace un año se organizaron para poder acceder a financiamiento.

Ana Belén: Es una mujer emprendedora, alegre, coordinadora del grupo solidario, tiene 31 años de edad, casada,  tiene una hija de 8 años. Con el propósito de tener su fuente de ingresos desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicida financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, pan, toalla sanitaria chiverías entre otros. Gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por PANA PANA y a las ganancias percibidas, le han permito establecer recientemente un comedor, por lo que el financiamiento también lo invertirá en comprar insumos: verduras, carnes, granos básicos, frutas, bastimentos, entre otros productos.  Su sueño es ampliar la infraestructura de su comedor.
texts.en:
This group has three enterprising members. With the aim of buying merchandise and increasing their household incomes, the members came together to create this group and apply for financial support.

Ana Belén is an enterprising and happy woman; she is coordinator of this group. Ana is 31 years old, married and has an eight-year-old daughter. With the aim of having her own income, two years ago she set up a grocery store in her house. Ana is applying for this loan in order to buy merchandise for her shop. She will buy basic grains, bread, sanitary towels, dairy products and more. Thanks to the loans from "Pana Pana" and the profits earned as a result, Ana has recently opened a small café. As a result this loan will also be used to buy supplies: vegetables, meat, basic grains, fruits, and other items. Ana's dream is to make the eatery larger.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her eatery: vegetables, meat, basic grains, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Thúy is 27 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 14 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2012, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years. The main harship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Alena

texts.es: Alena: Es una señora amable, emprendedora, casada, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos: 2 mayores de edad y 5 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde 4 años estableció una pulpería en su vivienda. Inicio trabajando en la modalidad de grupos solidarios desde hace 2 años, con el propósito de poder acceder a financiamiento, lo que le ha permitido mejorar la infraestructura de su local y diversificar sus productos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, pan, papel higiénico, condimentos, gaseosas, cosméticos, blusas, ropa interior entre otros productos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Alena is a friendly and enterprising woman. She is 44 years old, married and has seven children. Two of her children are adults while the other five are teenagers, and currently in secondary school. With the aim of earning her own income, four years ago Alena opened a grocery store in her home. She joined the loan group two years ago in order access financial support. This has allowed her to make improvements to her shop, and to diversify her range of products. Alena is applying for this loan in order to buy basic grains, dairy products, bread, lavatory paper, condiments, blouses, underwear and other items. Alena's dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, bread, lavatory paper, condiments, blouses, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Nhóm 21 Thôn 6 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Vân is 27 years old and she is married with two children. Vân is the group leader of the Nhóm 21 Thôn 6 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years. The main harship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương works in agriculture, farming food. She is 31 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

The main harship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom and a water tank.

With her business profits, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom and a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards and sweet bread

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung works in agriculture, farming food. She is 26 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Dung has been involved in her business for eight years. The main harship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom, and water filter system.

In the future, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom, and water filter system.

loans.name: Thư

texts.en:
Mrs.Thư works in agriculture, farming food. She is 46 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thư joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thư has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main harship that she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom, and water filter system.

With her business profits, Thư hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom, and water filter system.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
In a village in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Michael is operating a farm to make a living. He earns an income through farming as his main source of income. His determination to send his children to school is the reason for this great endeavor. 

Michael had joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative and successfully repaid his previous loans that he used for improving the business. He recently borrowed a new loan to finance the planting and fertilization of his farm. He is hopeful that out of this, he will be able to generate more income that brings success to the entire family.

loans.use: to finance the planting and fertilization of his farm.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh has a service business repairing electronics. He is 35 years old and he is married with three children. He lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

This is Minh's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. 

Minh has been involved in his business for seven years. The main harship that Minh faces in his life is not having a latrine, so his family shares his neighbor's latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Minh hopes to make enough money to provide for his kids, to buy a motorbike, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maa Subhadra Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Subhadra Self Help Group is located in a village in the Khurda district of Odisha, India, and has nine members. All members are women. As a group, they have supported and encouraged each other to save and improve their financial circumstances. 

Bishnupriya is the President of the group and is seated with her hand raised. Bishnupriya, 46, lives with her husband and their three school-aged children in a humble home. Bishnupriya’s husband works as a farmer in the village. To help supplement the income for their family, Bishnupriya has been engaged in the activity of agriculture. She grows paddy in her field and sells it with the help of her husband. She, along with her group, has requested this loan and she will use her portion for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

Bishnupriya and her group members are very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and sacks for storing the paddy.

loans.name: Yến

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is 27 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. This is her first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Yến has been involved in her business for four years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Yến hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her child, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
The group Maa Mahalaxmi Self Help Group (SHG) has 13 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photograph is Anita who is the leader of the group. Anita is a 34-year-old woman married to a fisherman from a village in Khurda district of Odisha, India. The couple has a son who is in school. Anita lives with her son and together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. She helps her husband to sell fish. Her husband goes to the lake every morning to fish and she sells those fish in the market as fresh fish and keeps some of them for drying. (Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use. It is done by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated.) Demand for dry as well as fresh fish is very high in the region. 

All other members of this group are also engaged in selling fresh and dry fish in the market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Anita and her group Maa Mahalaxmi SHG has requested a loan of 169,000 INR and she will use her portion for purchasing a storage box for fish and a fishing net. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase a storage box for fish and a fishing net.

loans.name: Maa Brundabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Brundabati Self Help Group is a group consisting of nine members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they were all facing the same kind of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they could provide basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mamata, who was selected as their president. Mamata is a 31-year-old lady living with her husband and her one child, who is student. The lady standing with her raised hand is Mamata. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near to her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc., in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. She has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is married and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur with his family. His wife is a housekeeper while Wilson operates a motor transportation and rental business to make a living. He has been doing this for many years and he earns a good amount for the family. 

He became a member of Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative and now he is requesting a loan to buy new tires. He plans to acquire another motorcycle unit for expansion.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Jibanajyoti Mahila Shg Group

texts.en:
Samima is a 46-year-old widow who has two children. She lives with her parents-in-laws and her children in a small village in the Khurda District of Odisha, India. Samima is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with work in her business. She has a business of growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market of the Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has had this business for eight years and it is going very well. 

At this time, Samima is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group "Jibanajyoti Mahila Self Help Group". The members of the group have selected Samima as their President. The lady standing with her raised hand is Samima. The common goal of this group is to increase their business activity.

Samima and her group members are very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and tools for farming.

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru:
Давлатмох проживает в районе Хуросон, города Кургантюбе. Она 45-летняя замужняя женщина. Давлатмох живет вместе с мужем, сыновьями и невесткой. У нее четверо сыновей. 
Давлатмох занимается семейным бизнесом. Она разводит мелко-рогатый скот для продажи. Давлатмох решила заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Для этого ей необходимо купить корову и троих телят.
texts.en:
Davlatmoh lives in the Khuroson region, in the city of Kurgantyube. She is a 45 years old, married woman. Davlatmoh lives together with her husband, sons and a daughter-in-law. She has four sons.

Davlatmoh has a family business. She breeds sheep and goats for selling. She decided to start breeding and selling cattle too. To do this, she needs to purchase a cow and three calves.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and three calves

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура 34 летняя уроженка района Спитамен. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Мастура занимается куплей и продажей мелко рогатых скотин. Деятельности скотоводства она научилась от своих родителей, которые в свое время тоже занимались животноводством. Мастура 8 лет назад, решилась начать бизнес, чтобы помочь семейному бюджету. В течение 8 лет она полностью освоила свою работу и хочет расширять бизнес.
