На данный момент у нее очень малое количество скотин, и чтобы увеличить количество, она просит кредит и надеется на Ваше отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Mastura is a 34 years old native of the Spitamen region. She is married and has one child. Mastura works with selling sheep and goats. She learned the business of animal sales from her parents, who also worked with this back in the days. 

Eight years ago, Mastura decided to start a business, in order to help the family budget. During these eight years, she has fully mastered her work, and would like to expand the business. Currently she has few heads of livestock, and in order to increase the number, she requests a loan and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock and expand animal sales business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy nail varnish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments and food products.

loans.name: Gulhavas

texts.ru:
Гулхавас 43-леняя женщина проживающая в районе Вахш, города Кургантюбе. Гулхавас замужем. Она мать четверых детей. У нее трое дочерей и один сын. Ее дети занимаются растениеводством. Сама Гулхавас уже три года занимается животноводством. Она разводит коз у себя дома. Гулхавас научилась этим делом у своих подруг. Они помогли ей быстро освоиться. 
Гулхавас берет кредит для закупа овец, чтобы расширить совою деятельность.
texts.en:
Gulhavas is a 43 years old woman living in the Vakhsh region, in the city of Kurgantyube. Gulhavas is married. She is the mother of four children. She has three daughters and one son. Her children work with field crop cultivation. Gulhavas has worked with livestock breeding for three years. She breeds goats at her home. She learnt this business from her friends. They helped her to quickly get a grip of it. 

Gulhavas takes a loan to purchase sheep, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jewelry and pearl necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments and vegetables.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es: Adelfa: Es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa usada, es no vidente. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua: Paca de ropa mixta y con apoyo de su hermana distribuirlas a precios accesibles en Waspam y Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Adelfa is married, 51 years old, and from Puerto Cabezas. She has two, school-aged children. Five years ago, she set up her business selling used clothing. She is blind.

She is requesting her second loan to buy merchandize in Managua in the form of packs of used clothing, and with the help of her sister, distribute them at affordable prices in Waspam and Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy merchandize in Managua: packs of used clothing.

loans.name: Naboth

texts.es: Naboth: Es un señor amable y luchador, tiene 35 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad que cursa su primer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar camarones y pescados a los buzos y venderlos a precios accesibles. Su sueño es tener un local donde ofertar sus productos con los equipos necesarios.
texts.en:
Naboth is a kind and hard-working man, who is 35 years old, married, and has a 13-year old child who is in their second year at secondary school. To have his own source of income, Naboth has sold seafood for around ten years.

He is requesting a loan to buy prawns and fish from divers and sell them at affordable prices. His dream is to have a premises in which he can offer his products with the necessary equipment.

loans.use: to buy prawns and fish from divers and sell them at affordable prices.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима замужняя женщина в возрасте 62 лет. Она жительница не большого городка Турсунзаде. Город был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя Мирзо Турсунзаде. В этом городе она живет со всей семьей. Халима не смотря на свой возраст, берется за не легкую работу. Она занимается растениеводством. Халима каждый год без перерыва сажает сельскохозяйственные культуры и в этом год она не пропустила посев. Теперь ей необходимо обработать урожай полезными минеральными удобрениями. Халиме не хватает средств  для купли достаточного количество урожая. И она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Halima is a married woman of the age of 62 years. She is a resident of the small town of Tursun-zoda. The town was named in honor of the great Tajik writer Mirzo Tursunzoda. She lives in this town with her family. 

Despite her age, Halima has taken on a job that is not easy. She works with field crop cultivation. Every year, without break, Halima plants field crops, and this year she didn't miss the sowing either. Currently she needs to process the harvest with mineral fertilizers. Halima does not have money for purchasing a sufficient amount for her harvest. Therefore she applies for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to process the harvest, to get a rich harvest

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: Jessica María: Es una joven amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 25 años de edad, casada, tiene 2  hijos. Estilista profesional, su esposo trabaja como buzo. Con el objetivo de acondicionar su negocio, aumentar su mercadería y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua: blusa, Shorts de hombre, paca mixta, chinelas y venderlas a precios accesibles. Su sueño es establecer su propio salón.
texts.en:
Jessica María is a kind young woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She is a professional stylist, and her husband works as a diver.

With the aim of developing her business and improve her family's quality of life, she is requesting a loan to buy blouses, men's shorts, mixed packs of clothing and sandals to sell at affordable prices. Her dream is to set up her own salon.

loans.use: to buy blouses, men's shorts, mixed packs of clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Terry

texts.es: Terry: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 31 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos, su esposa es docente.  Desde hace 8 años trabaja en el sector de pesca artesanal. Con el objetivo de aumentar su productividad y los ingresos para el hogar solicita financiamiento para comprar gasolina y poder pescar, con su lancha de motor de borda. Su sueño es tener su propio barco para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Terry is a hard-working man from Puerto Cabezas. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a teacher. He has worked as a small-scale fisherman for eight years.

In order to increase his productivity and the household income, he is requesting a loan to buy fuel so that he can fish with his motor boat. His dream is to have his own fishing vessel for his work.

loans.use: to buy fuel and be able to fish.

loans.name: Mauri

texts.es:
Mauri es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de Administración agropecuaria, comenta que tiene como meta poder desarrollar su propia empresa dentro de su ciudad.
Está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le permitirá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas y gastos de manutención.
texts.en:
Mauri is from the city of Carapeguá, and is studying a degree in farm management. He says that his goal is to develop his own business in his city.

He is very grateful for the opportunity he is receiving, which will allow him to continue studying as he has been. He is requesting this loan to cover his university fees and maintenance costs.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es:
Idalia actualmente está cursando el 3er. año de contabilidad y audito-ría, su meta es convertirse en una joven profesional, así cumplir con sus objetivos trazados.
Ella se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y el día de mañana poder retribuir a sus padres el es-fuerzo que han hecho por ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Idalia is currently in the 3rd year of her accounting and auditing degree. Her goal is to become a young professional, and in this way, achieve her planned objectives. She is working hard to succeed, and to soon be able to repay her parents for all they did for her. 

She is requesting this loan to invest it in paying her university fees, so she can continue to fight as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru: Соро жительница города Шахритус. Она живет вместе с детьми и внуками. У нее большая семья. Соро берет кредит с целью построить коровник и купить скот, чтобы заняться животноводством. Пока она помогает детям в торговле на рынке. Чтобы помочь своей семье и не сидеть без дела, она собирается начать свой бизнес. Соро будет рада вашей доброте.
texts.en:
Soro is a resident of the city of Shahrituz. She lives with her children and grandchildren. She has a large family. 

Soro takes a loan with the aim to build a cowshed and purchase cattle, in order to work with livestock breeding. Currently she helps her children with trading at the market. In order to help her family and not sit without anything to do, she decided to start a business. Soro will be happy for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and calves

loans.name: Ashuza Group

texts.fr: Madame Cikala est membre du groupe de crédit Ashuza. Mariée à agent de L’Etat Congolais, elle exerce ses activités de vente de chaussures usagées au marché central depuis 2006 pour nourrir et payer les frais scolaires pour ses 4 enfants qui étudient. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 ballots de chaussures d’occasion. Son rêve est de devenir fournisseur de la place. A cet effet, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Cikala is a member of the Ashuza loan group. She is married to a Congolese civil servant and has been selling second-hand shoes since 2006 so she can feed her four children and send them to school.

The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy four bundles of second-hand shoes. Her dream is to become a major local supplier.

Cikala would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to poor businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy four bundles of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mulasi est présidente de l’association de crédit Espoir. Agée de 45 ans, elle est mère de 6 enfants tous empruntant le chemin de l’école. Mariée à chômeur, elle exerce son activité de commerce depuis 2005 orienté dans la vente d’Amstel. Elle  loue un dépôt au marché public de la place raison pour laquelle elle  sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 40 caisses d’Amstel et ainsi constituer son stock. Son rêve est d’acheter une parcelle. Au final, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir abondamment.
texts.en:
Mulasi is the leader of the Espoir loan group. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, who all go to school. Her husband is unemployed.

Mulasi has been running her business selling Amstel beer since 2005. She rents a kiosk in the public market and is requesting this loan so she can buy 40 cases of Amstel beer to restock her business. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Mulasi would like to thank Hekima and ask for God's blessing.

loans.use: to buy 40 cases of Amstel beer.

loans.name: Arsenio Sipriano

texts.es: Arcenio: Es un señor amable y luchador, originario de Cruz Rio Grande, desde hace 20 años se traslado al municipio de Rosita, por motivos familiares. Su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos adolecentes en edad escolar. Con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento y construir poco a poco su vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar 140 piedras canteras. Desde hace 17 años vive en casa de su suegra, habitada por 7 personas. Su sueño es construir su casa de concreto y que su hijo mejore de salud, ya que se encuentra delicado y ha sido traslado a Managua para realizarle estudios médicos.
texts.en:
Arcenio is a kind, hard-working man from Cruz Rio Grande. 20 years ago he moved to the town of Rosita for family reasons. His wife is a housewife, and he has three school-aged, teenage children. 

In order to reduce overcrowding and gradually build his home, he is requesting his first loan to buy 140 quarry stones. He has lived in his mother-in-law's house for 17 years, in which there are seven people. His dream is to build his house out of concrete, and for his son's health to improve, as he is unwell and has been taken to Managua to have medical tests carried out.

loans.use: to buy 140 quarry stones.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.fr: Madame Kumbuka, presidente du groupe de crédit Grace est âgée de 36 ans.  Elle est mariée à changeur de monnaie et  mère de 7 enfants qui étudient. Vendeuse ambulante depuis 1998, elle sollicite ce  nouveau prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter 100 cartables. Son objectif est d’acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima du  soutien qu’il apporte aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Kumbuka is 36 years old and head of the Grace loan group. She is married to a money-changer and they have seven children, who are all in school.

Kumbuka has worked as a travelling trader since 1998 and is requesting this new loan in order to buy 100 schoolbags. Her ambition is to buy a plot of land.

Kumbuka would like to thank Hekima for the support it offers to women on a low income.

loans.use: to buy 100 schoolbags.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es la hija mayor, comenta que vivió en  España por 5 años con sus padres y su hermano  menor. Está estudiando la carrera de Diseño gráfico, y comenta que su meta principal es culminar la carrera y trabajar en lo que más le gusta.
De aquí a un tiempo se ve trabajando en su área como una gran profesional y su mayor aspiración es trabajar en una multinacional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención, como ser copias, materiales de estudios y demás.
texts.en:
Elisa is the eldest daughter and says that she lives in Spain for five years with her parents and younger brother. She is studying a degree in graphic design, and says that her main goal is to finish the degree and work in what she most enjoys.

Some time from now, she sees herself working in her field as a successful professional, and her greatest dream is to work in a multinational company.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in maintenance fees for photocopies, study materials and other items.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance fees for photocopies, study materials and other items.

loans.name: Upole Group

texts.fr: La cliente Cibalonza est secrétaire-adjointe de l’association d’affaire Upole. Actuellement vendeuse de souliers usagés, il ya 7 ans elle vendait du sorgho et les haricots avant l’avènement de Hekima aux différents marchés du village. Mariée à un agent de la fonction publique, elle est âgée de 44 ans et  mère de 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école.  Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter 60 paires des souliers et ainsi les revenus de ce prêt offriront à sa famille une meilleure vie et à la longue devenir grossiste.  Elle remercie Hekima pour ce geste de générosité à l’égard des femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Cibalonza is the deputy secretary of the Upole business group and she runs a business selling second-hand shoes. Seven years ago, before Hekima arrived, she used to sell sorghum and beans in the various village markets.

Cibalonza is 44 years old and married to a civil servant. They have five children, who all go to school. Cibalonza is requesting this new loan to buy 60 pairs of shoes; the income she receives from reselling them will help her give the family a better life and in the long term enable her to become a wholesaler.

Cibalonza would like to thank Hekima for its generosity to women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her previous loan. She managed to add more stock in her retail shop business. Besides the retail shop, Peninah operates a clothes-selling business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a kitchen out of concrete and wood.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando está siguiendo la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, está cursando el último año. A la vez que estudia también trabaja, y su meta es seguir estudiando de modo a ser un profesional eficiente con el objetivo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar los gastos de su tesis, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tendrá. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir su sueño.
texts.en:
Armando is studying Business. He is in his last year. While he goes to school he is also working, and his goal is to keep studying so he can be an effective professional with the purpose of having a better quality of life. 

He is asking for a loan to be able to invest in paying for expenses for his thesis. This way he can cover this expense that he will have. He is thankful for this opportunity he is getting so he can continue to follow his dream.

loans.use: to pay for expenses for his thesis.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es estudiante de la carrera de Licenciatura Agropecuaria, comenta que su sueño es ser Licenciado y poder realizarse como persona.
Además de estudiar también trabaja, y se destaca por ser una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Rodrigo is studying to get his bachelor degree in agriculture. He says that is dream is to graduate and become actualized as a person. In addition to going to school, he also works. He stands out as a person who is a fighter and who makes sacrifices. He is asking for this loan to pay for his tuition so he can continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Hiền has a manufacturing business making wooden furniture. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hiền is 50 years old and she is married with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. The main hardship she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 35-years-old, married and has two children. She and her spouse are farmers. They plant and harvest corn to sell to traders. This way, they generate income used for education and meals for the family. The other part of the income is used as revolving capital for the next planting season. 

She has insufficient funds now, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy insecticides, pesticides and herbicides used in farming. It will help nourish her crops for a fruitful harvest someday. 

Her photo was taken in their backyard.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 64-years-old and a married father of three children who are all adults.  He has been farming for the last 15 years and earns an income of KES13,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He is now servicing his fourth loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan amount to buy farm inputs, e.g. fertilizers and pesticides.

The profit he earns will be used to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business and venture into large scale farming

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, e.g fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Duyên has a manufacturing business making wine; she has been involved in this business for 6 years. She is 30 years old, and married with three children. Duyên lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Duyên first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Duyên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Tubandanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Simon  fait partie du groupe  Tubandanye II et  habite à Gitega. Il a 52 ans et est marié à  Godelieve, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  l’un a 18 l’autre 20 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de poivrons et d’oignons depuis 30 ans.  

Il est à son quatrième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande quantité d’oignons et de poivrons    à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Simon, age 52, is a member of the group Tubandanye II and he lives in Gitega. 

He is married to a merchant named Godelieve, and they have two children aged 18 and 20. 

Simon has been selling peppers and onions for 30 years.  

This is his 4th loan cycle with Turame. He plans to use this credit to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of peppers and onions to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of peppers and onions to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is into a vegetable vending business. She is selling vegetables in their community where she earns PHP 300 daily. To add to her income, her husband is a private employee in their town. Though both of them do have a livelihood, their income is not enough to supplement the everyday expenses of their three children and household expenses as well. 

With that, Magdalena is asking for Php 20,000 loan from KIVA lenders to pay for tuition fees and for the school allowances of Michelle Rae.

Michelle Rae who is a third year student of BS Entrepreneurship. Magdalena and Michelle Rae are hoping that their loan will be granted so that Michelle Rae will have a successful career in the future.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees and for the school allowances

loans.name: Nhóm 5 Thôn 1 Quảng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghĩa works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Nghĩa is 36 years old, and she is married with two children. Nghĩa is the group leader of the Nhóm 5 Thôn 1 Quảng Bình solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nghĩa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nghĩa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nghĩa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Bích

texts.en:
Mrs. Bích operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Bích is 23 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, along with her two dependents.

In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bích has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Bích faces in her life is not having latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Bích hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Nhóm 3 Thôn 1 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàn works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hoàn is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hoàn is 52 years old and married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 3 Thôn 1 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2013, Hoàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoàn has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Hoàn faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: La cliente Cheusi est  une femme entrepreneur, vice-présidente de l’association de crédit Ishara. Elle est âgée de 38 ans, mère de 5 enfants (2scolarisés) et mariée à un homme sans profession. Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter  50kg de farine, 1 bidon d’huile, 25kg de sucre et 1paquet de braise. Son objectif c’est de prospérer  dans ses affaires. Elle remercie Hekima de faciliter l’accès au crédit aux femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer, Cheusi, is a female entrepreneur, who is vice-president of the Ishara loan association. She is 38 years old and mother to five children (two of whom are at school); she is married to an unemployed man. She is requesting this new loan to buy 50 kilos of flour, a container of oil, 25 kilos of sugar and a packet of charcoal. Her main objective is to prosper from her business. She thanks Hekima for facilitating access to loans for women with low income.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of flour, a container of oil, 25 kilos of sugar and a packet of charcoal.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is a farmer raising crops, specifically planting and harvesting corn to sell. He is 62 years old, and had three grown-up children. Though he is old enough, he still manages his business well with the help of laborers, who he pays during the planting season. He wanted to increase his crop production and in need for additional capital to sustain his crops. 

To achieve this, he is asking for additional capital of P50,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for labor costs in farming. This will help him achieve a profitable business.

In the future, Dante hopes to pass on a good farming business to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and for labor costs

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more bread, salt, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more bread, salt, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
This is Saumu. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her coconut selling business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

Besides the coconut selling business, Saumu weaves mats and sells them. She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of reefs for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reefs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stylish ready-made women's clothes

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa: Es originaria de Rosita, tiene 40 años, madre soltera de 2 hijos, el mayor de 22 años es independiente y la menor de 13 años estudia su segundo año. Cuenta con una experiencia de 15 años en docencia. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para construir su baño de concreto, debido a que la infraestructura del baño se encuentra en estado deteriorado toda su vida ha utilizado letrina. Su sueño es tener una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Josefa is originally from Rosita. She is 40 years old and the single mother of two children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and is independent and her youngest child is 13 years old and is in her second year of school.

She has 15 years of experience in teaching. With the goal of improving her home and improving her quality of life, she has requested a loan to build a bathroom out of concrete. The infrastructure of her current bathroom is deteriorated and she has used a latrine all of her life.

Her dream is to have a home with adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to build a concrete bathroom.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be jovial. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are urban residents. 

He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to have expanded within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Nyamulagira B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mujangombe est une commerçante depuis 3 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires «Nyamulagira B», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 2 encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des matériels de construction et s’entraide avec son mari. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter des planches, briques cuites, chevrons, sticks d’arbres etc. Dans l’avenir, Elle compte améliorer son habitat, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: The customer, Mujangombe, has been a trader for the past three years and is a member of the "Nyamulagira B" business association. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 30 years old, married and mother to four children, two of whom are studying and two of whom are still children. She sells construction materials and helps out her husband. She is requesting a loan from Hekima so she can expand her business. She began it with funds from her husband. She is going to buy planks, terracotta bricks, rafters and tree sticks, etc. In the future she is planning to improve her home, educate and feed her children. She thus thanks Hekima for its support for female entrepreneurs who are excluded from classic banks. It should be noted that one customer is carrying a baby in the photo.

loans.use: to buy planks, terracotta bricks, rafters, tree sticks, etc.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur lives with his wife and newborn child in Fuzuli region, but he has been an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli city for over 20 years. Seymur is 30 years old. He has been in the trading business for 5 years. Seymur sells fruits and vegetables in his little store. Now he wants to buy more seasonal fruits (watermelons, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.) to sell and for this reason Seymur has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 600 Azerbaijan new manat. He says great thanks for a loan from the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits

loans.name: Nyamulagira A Group

texts.fr: Nyaziro est un commerçant depuis 7 ans et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Nyamulagira A», entrepreneur,  dynamique, âgé  de 37 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 2 sont gamins. Il est vendeur des divers matériaux de construction. Il sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Il commença  avec de fonds reçu de son salaire quand, il fut enseignant. Sa conjointe est une ménagère. Il va  acheter 60 sacs de ciment etc. Dans l’avenir, il compte scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, il remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs exclus  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Nyaziro has been a trader for the past seven years and is member of the "Nyamulagira A" business group. He is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 37 years old, married and father to four children, two of whom are studying and two who are just kids. He sells a variety of construction materials and is requesting this loan from Hekima to expand his business, which he began with money he earned when he was a teacher. His wife is a housewife. He is going to buy 60 sacks of cement, etc. He is planning to educate and feed his children in the future. He is grateful to Hekima for its support for small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic bank system.

loans.use: to buy 60 sacks of cement, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with one child who is not in school.

Mwanasiti sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Utaratibu Group

texts.fr: Madame Nzigire est membre de  la micro entreprise Utaratibu. Femme dynamique ; elle est  âgée de 40 ans ; mariée à un homme d’affaire et ensemble ils ont  9 enfants dont  7  vont à l’école. Elle sollicite un nouveau  prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter 5 sacs de souliers.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur de lui avoir permis de progresser dans ses affaires.
texts.en: Nzigire is a member of the Utaratibu micro-business. She is a dynamic woman, who is 40 years old and married to a businessman; they have nine children together, seven of whom attend school. She is requesting a new loan so she can buy five sacks of shoes. She thanks Hekima with all her heart for having enabled her to progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of shoes.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: Madame Nabintu est présidente de l’association de crédit Ujamaa. Mariée à un mécanicien, elle est  mère  de 7 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle effectue les activités de commerce depuis 1992. Agée de 42 ans, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter  400kg de farine de mais. Elle projete acheter une maison, agrandir son entreprise et se constituer de l’épargne. Au final, elle rend grâce à Dieu et bénie Hekima de soutenir les femmes  à bas revenu.
texts.en: Nabintu is president of the Ujamaa loan association. She is married to a mechanic and is mother to seven children, who all go to school. She has been carrying out a trading activity since 1992, and at the age of 42 is requesting a loan to buy 400 kilos of corn flour. She is planning to buy a house, expand her business and build up some savings. Finally she gives thanks to God and blesses Hekima for the support it gives to women with low incomes.

loans.use: to buy 400 kilos of cornflour.

loans.name: Ntahaliza Group

texts.fr: Madame Buhoro est  membre du groupe de credit Ntahaliza. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, mariée à un homme d’affaire et  ensemble ils  ont  17 enfants (13 scolarisés). Elle commença le petit commerce des habits usagés dès son jeune âge en 1980. Au fil des ans, elle devint une grande commençante et décida de changer d’activité et devient vendeuse des tôles. Le nouveau prêt sollicité va acheter 20 tôles pour compléter son stock.  Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et construire une maison. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de son service d’appui aux femmes économiquement pauvres.
texts.en: Buhoro is a member of the Ntahaliza loan group. She is 47 years old and married to a business man; together they have 17 children (13 of whom are studying). She began a small used clothing business in 1980 when she was young. Over the years she has become a significant businesswoman and decided to change direction and starting selling sheet metal. The new loan she is requesting will be used to buy 20 pieces of sheet metal to supplement her stock. She would like to expand her business and build a house. She thanks Hekima for its help for poor women.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of sheet metal to supplement her stock.

loans.name: Kijitonyama Group

texts.en:
Hilda, who is in her late 20s, is married with one small kid. She has been running a beauty salon for two years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Hilda's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipment, and has successfully paid back her loan.  She used the profit to pay rent and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy a new dryer and a new steaming machine. She dreams of owning a food and drinks shop.

Hilda will share this loan with her loan group "KIJITONYAMA," with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new dryer and a steaming machine.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis es estudiante, también trabaja en una establecimiento como administrador, vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes les ayuda económicamente.
Es una persona, honesta, trabajora, responsable y muy dedicada a sus estudios, desea salir adelante con sus esfuerzos para alcanzar sus objetivos. Su meta es de tener su título Universitario para poder trabajar de forma independiente y así ayudar más a sus padres. Y formar una familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma seguir luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Denis is a student and also works as an administrator at a business. He lives in his parents' home and helps them financially. He is an honest, hardworking, responsible person and is very dedicated to his studies. He hopes to move forward with his efforts to achieve his goals.

His dream is to earn his university degree so that he can work independently and help his parents, and start a family.

He requests this loan so that he can pay university costs and continue fighting to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: Madame Lwabaguma est trésorière du groupe Lumière. Mariée à un homme d’affaire, elle est âgée de 35ans, et mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Vendeuse depuis plus de 7ans, elle sollicite le prêt pour acheter  60 chemises pour homme. Son souhait est d’ouvrir un magasin et acheter une parcelle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de disponibiliser  le crédit en faveur des femmes commerçantes.
texts.en: Lwabaguma is the treasurer of the Lumière group. She is 35 years old, married to a businessman, and has six children, all at school. She has been a saleswoman for more than seven years and is requesting this loan to buy 60 men's shirts. She would like to open a shop and buy a plot of land. She thanks Hekima for making credit available to women traders.

loans.use: to buy 60 men's shirts.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.es:
Tamara es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona muy dedicada y trabajadora, comenta que a la par que estudia también trabaja, y de esa forma lucha día a día.
De acá en adelante tiene el anhelo de terminar su carrera y ser una buena profesional en el área. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Tamara is from the city of Pilar. She is a very dedicated and hardworking person. She says that she works as well as attends school and this is how she fights from day to day. 

Her goal is to finish her studies and become a good professional in her area of study. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has been provided to continue studying. 

She requests this loan to continue to pay university costs so that she can continue to study.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Lemayian

texts.en:
Lemayian is 36 years old, married and a father of three school-going children. He has been selling household goods, and besides that, has done a crop farming activity for the last four years. He earns an income of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He is now servicing his second loan of 5,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan amount to buy basins, Thermoses, jerricans and jugs.

The profit he earns will be used to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business and venture into wholesale.

loans.use: to buy basins, Thermoses, jerricans and jugs

loans.name: Collet

texts.en:
Collet is a female Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a semi urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the 10,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a cereals store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: Bwenge est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Mapatano», entrepreneur, âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, dont 2 scolarisés et 3 autres sont encore gamins. La cliente est une vendeuse de pommes de terre. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt dans le centre commercial de la place. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari et s’entraide avec son conjoint. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 sacs de pommes de terre (800 kg). Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour le soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bwenge is a merchant and member of the business group Mapatano. A 28-year-old entrepreneur, she is married with five children, two of whom go to school; the other three are still too young.   

Bwenge sells potatoes. She conducts her sales from a depot at the local shopping center. She initially started her activity with capital given by her husband, and the two of them help each other out. 

Bwenge has been engaged in this activity for 2 years, and she plans to use this new loan to buy 10 sacks of potatoes (800 kg).  

Her goals for the future are to buy a plot of land, and to ensure that her children are fed, clothed, and educated. Bwenge wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping women entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these difficult post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of potatoes (800 kg).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and iron steel to complete the building of the house and to renovate it.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with six school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asha has operated a fruits selling business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Cintia

texts.es:
Cintia está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, está estudiando y luchando por ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Desea terminar sus estudios para poder trabajar en una empresa, o ir adquiriendo experiencia para el día de mañana abrir su propio negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con su sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Cintia is in her fourth year of studies in commercial engineering. She is studying and striving to be a professional who is useful to society. 
She wants to finish her education so she can work in a company, or gain experience to open her own business sometime in the future.
She is requesting this loan in order to pay her university fees and thus be able to continue her dream of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Fatoumata Amadou's Group

texts.fr:
Le  banc villageois a été créé le 10 Décembre 2012, il est composé de femmes qui partagent des valeurs sociales et aspirent à améliorer leurs conditions de vie. Elles habitent toutes le même village et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce et font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatoumata (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 24 et mère de 04 enfants 02 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est une femme très entreprenante, elle est vendeuse de fruits aux entours du marché central dans la commune. Cette activité elle la pratique depuis plus de 06 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter par carton de mangue de variété «quinte» à 15 000 Fr CFA et au marché hebdomadaire international des cartons d’ananas pour 13 500 Fr CFA l’un.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges quotidiennes d’une part et d’autre à améliorer son épargne afin de faire croître sa capacité de financement.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was set up on 10th December 2012 and is made up of women who share the same social values and aspire to improve their living conditions. They all live in the same village and most of have small trading activities and also practise farming in the rain.

Fatoumata (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower. She is married, 24 years of age and mother to four children: two girls and two boys. She is a very enterprising woman and sells fruit around the central market in the municipality. She has been doing this for more than six years and has great experience in the field.

With her new loan she is planning to buy "quinte" mangos by the carton to the value of 15,000FCFA and, at the weekly international market, cartons of pineapple at 13,500FCFA each.

The profits she makes will, on the one hand, enable her to help out her husband more with the daily expenses, and on the other, to boost her savings so she can increase her financial capacity.

loans.use: to buy "quinte" mangos by the carton to the value of 15,000FCFA and at the weekly international market cartons of pineapple to the value of 13,500FCFA each.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es estudiante de Licenciatura Agropecuaria, comenta que se está esforzando por ser un profesional útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas.
Él es una persona muy luchadora que se dedica mucho a sus estudios para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is getting a degree in agriculture and livestock.  He said he's making an effort to be a professional who is useful to others and to society.  He's a very persevering person who's committed to his studies so he can be someone in life.

He's requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr:
Audace  fait partie du groupe  Faraja et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 36 ans et est marié à  Emmanuellique, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l’un a 2ans et l’autre 5 ans. 
Il a sous sa charge un enfant  orphelin qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de chaussures depuis  7 ans.  

Il est à son  cinquième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et   acheter  beaucoup de chaussures  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Audace belongs to the Faraja group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old and married to Emmanuellique, who is a farmer. Together they have two children, one who is two years old and the other five. He also has an orphan in his care who is studying.

He has been buying and selling shoes for the past seven years and is on his fifth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shoes to resell, so he can earn more money.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shoes for resale, so he can earn more.

loans.name: Marlides

texts.es: Marlides es una mujer de 49 años de edad muy trabajadora; ella vende pasteles hacas y postres que ella misma prepara. Con este negocio ha apoyado el sustento de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 6 hijos en edades de 9 a 26 años. Desde hace 14 años data su experiencia pues siempre le ha gustado el comercio y su inclinación por la preparación de alimentos la tradujo en una forma de genera ingresos, iniciando con amigas y vecinas de su barrio y poco a poco expandiéndose a otros sectores cercanos a su vivienda. Su meta es organizar su estructura y tener una vitrina calentadora y otros equipos, y como meta familiar se propone educar a sus hijos con calidad. En la actualidad Está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para elaborar alimentos como lácteos azúcar etc y también invertirá en mercancía variada que viene en los catálogos a los cuales también se encuentra afiliada con el fin de ampliar su espectro comercial,  vender mas y ganar un poco mas de dinero que beneficie a su hogar.
texts.en: Marlides is a very hard-working woman of 49. She sells cakes, filled pastries, and desserts that she prepares herself. With this business, she has supported the sustenance of her household, which consists of her husband and their six children, ages from 9 to 26. Her experience dates from 14 years ago, since she has always liked business, and she translated her inclination to prepare food into a way to generate income. She began selling to her friends and neighbors from her neighborhood, and little by little she expanded to other areas near her home. Her goal is to organize her workplace and have a heated display case and other equipment.  As a family goal, she proposes to give her children a quality education. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy supplies to make her foods, such as dairy products, sugar, etc., and she will also invest in various merchandise that comes through catalogs with which she is also affiliated, with the goal of expanding her commercial spectrum, to sell more and earn a little more income that will benefit her household.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food, such as dairy products, sugar, etc., and she will also invest in a variety of catalog merchandise

loans.name: Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Bahati, who is in her mid 20s, is married with two children who are still in school.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Bahati's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to restock the missing items in her food store. She dreams of improving the quality and quantity of her food.

Bahati wull share this loan with her loan group "Uchumi," which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the food store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old and married to Richard. They are blessed with two children who are in secondary school. She has been in crop farming for the last five years and earns an income of KES 7,000.
	 
She has applied for her second loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers.                                                                                              

The profits she earns will be used to pay the school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay the laborers.

loans.name: Al- Ikhwa Group

texts.en:
Al-Ikhwa is a group that includes four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 105,000 YER from AMB.

Aziza is the leader of the group. She is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 4 years old. She has a university education. 

Due to high unemployment in the country, Aziza couldn't find a job to help her husband pay for the expenses of the family. Recently, she worked as a housewife and her husband has a taxi for transportation and works as a driver. From the taxi,  he earns good money but it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Aziza decided to help him pay for the expenses of the house. Their house lacks many of the food materials. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials as sugar, flour, meat, and fruits and vegetables to be able to face any possible financial crisis inside the house.

Aziza looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of foods in order to save a secure future for her children and to be able to meet any financial crises inside the house.

loans.use: to purchase food materials such as sugar, flour, meat, fruits and vegetables to be able to face any possible financial crisis inside the house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 57 year old hardworking widow who supports a family of four children, and has been operating a house-rental business for a period of fourteen years, earning her an income of KES 70,000 at the end of every month. She is now taking her sixth loan of KES 120,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use the entire amount of money to complete constructing her unfinished rental house for the occupants to settle in. Joyce plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children. She hopes to be able to further their education to higher levels, and to build other rental houses in the nearby towns.

loans.use: To complete constructing her rental house for the occupants to settle in a conducive environment.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali, 22, is a housewife raising a very young son. They live in a remote village Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. She hails from Dhupguri.  She lives with her husband, Gopal.  Anjali received education up to grade 9 and after that she got married.  Her husband attended school till sixth standard.

Anjali's husband is engaged in cultivation of lands, while Anjali helps him in his work after managing her household work.  Her husband works hard to come out ahead in vegetable cultivation. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, beans and other seasonal vegetables. His simple and polite behavior as well as good quality products has acquired a good many customers and he wants to satisfy them by supplying more quality products.  

Now, he wants to cultivate paddy rice, which is the staple food for the people of this region.  But due to insufficient capital, he cannot materialize his dream.  So to help her husband, Anjali is requesting financial help.

The loan she is requesting from BJS (Kiva’s partner) is to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs so that she can continue with her cultivation activity and enjoy a better quality of life with her husband and son.

She aspires to purchase more agricultural lands with the profit generated from this business.

She is very much thankful to her lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers and seeds for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Maa Jogamaya Shg Group

texts.en:
Kuni is a 32-year-old lady who has two children. The lady standing with her raised hand is Kuni. She lives in a village of Khurda district of Odisha, India, with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started a business making and selling flour, such as wheat flour, maize flour, gram flour, lentil flour, rice flour, etc. She makes these flours with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of flours depending on the demand for flour in the market. 

Kuni is requesting this loan with her group, and she will use her portion to buy more supplies such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is in a group of nine members, all women who live in the same community. They named their group "Maa Jogamaya Self-Help Group." They are situated in the Khurda district of Odisha, India

All the woman of this group are facing financial problems so with this loan they are very happy and hope this will help them to make more money from their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing wheat, maize, grains, lentils, etc., for making flour.

loans.name: Kamali

texts.en:
Kamali is 30 years old and living with her husband and their only son.  Her husband, Sushil, 38 years old, is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time.  They live at Kathapara, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district.  Both Kamali and her husband passed sixth standard.  Their son is a student of grade one.  They have a small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Kamali's husband started to cultivate vegetables, but later on he grew paddy rice.  Now he mainly grows paddy, which has got a good demand in the market, being the staple food for the people of their locality.  He cultivates paddy and with the help of Kamali. He harvests and sells the produce in the local markets. He has a very good relationship with his customers, as he supplies quality products at cheaper rates and on time.  

Now they have a new idea of cultivating paddy on a large scale to provide better economic conditions to the family.  But due to shortage of funds, he can't fulfill his dream.

To help her husband, Kamali is requesting a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to earn more income from her current business to improve their living conditions. She will use the loan to purchase agricultural inputs like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

She hopes to purchase more lands with the profit generated and she is very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco es de la ciudad de San Pedro, comenta que sus padres lo apoyan y ayudan en todo y que de esa forma está saliendo adelante y luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
Está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y dice que por medio de esta profesión quiere poder ayudar a su familia, y a las demás personas de la sociedad que necesiten de sus servicios.
Pide este préstamo ya que necesita pagar materiales de estudios y sus cuotas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Marco is from the city of San Pedro and comments that his parents support and help him in everything. So in this way he is getting ahead and struggling to be someone in life. He is studying law and says that in this profession he will be able to help his family since the other people in society will need his services. He is requesting this loan to pay for study materials and his tuition. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving and it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay for study materials and tuition fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21 year- old single man from Khan Younis. His father works as an employee in a local company, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Mohammad works in transferring goods using his rickshaw.  He buys from the wholesalers and resells the goods.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new engine for his rickshaw.  By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to repair his rickshaw and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to buy a new Engine for his rickshaw

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda comenta que su intención es culminar la carrera de Derecho para cumplir con sus metas previstas de crecer como persona y como profesional. 
Quiere ayudar a su familia y ser útil a la sociedad a la que pertenece. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cotas de la universidad, ya que con ello podrá seguir luchando por sus sueños de ser un profesional exitoso.
texts.en: Gilda says her intention is to complete her law degree program so that she can meet her planned goals of growing as a person and as a professional. She wants to help her family and be useful to the society to which she belongs. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue studying. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees, as this way she will be able to continue striving for her dream of being a successful professional.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto está estudiando Ingeniera Agroindustrial, tiene como meta poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Él es una persona muy sacrificada y que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograr sus metas de ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le ayudará a seguir sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Fausto is studying agroindustrial engineering. His goal is to be able to help his family and loved ones.

He is a very sacrificing person who is putting in his best effort to be able to achieve his goal of being a useful professional in society.

He's asking for this loan because he wants to be able to cover the tuition costs of his university, which will help him continue with his dreams and goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1988. She is a kind and hardworking woman who lives in an agriculture area. Firuza is married . She has been busy with growing agriculture products such as carrots, onions, watermelon, etc. She has been working on her land from early morning till late evening for four years. Firuza’s relatives help her with managing the business. Firuza tries to develop business and maximize profit, as the main family income is from farming. 

She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 30 year old married woman who supports a family of one child. Her husband adds additional income to their family.  Winnie operates a beauty  salon business which has been in operation for six years, earning her an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Winnie was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbour and is now taking her first loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use the entire loan amount to add more stock of beauty products to boost her business and meet the expectations of her clients. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child and buy school textbooks. She hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia works in the bus terminal selling food, magazines, and snacks such as “tagactac,” a local delicacy and specialty of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns well to provide for her needs. Eustaquia has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Eustaquia is requesting a loan to buy additional snacks to offer to travelers. She plans to save a portion of her profit to have for future needs.

loans.use: to buy  snacks to offer to travelers

loans.name: Guadioso

texts.en: Guadioso has been operating a service-based business for many years to support his family. He earns well and has successfully repaid his previous loan for buying tires. Gaudioso wants to make sure of the success of his business and it helps to improve the business.  Currently, he is taking a new loan to buy a new set of tires, and to pay for repair and maintenance. He hopes to expand his business to gain more income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires, repair and maintenance

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a young entrepreneur from Dhupguri.  She is 24 years old and married.  They are raising two young daughters, of whom one is a student of grade 1. They live in a small village Altagram in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Aklima's husband, Dakhil, aged 24 years, is a small trader of food items.  Both have elementary education.

Alima's husband has been engaged with a small business for a few years.  In spite of his tireless work, his meagre income does not provide the family with a decent lifestyle and he is unable to cover all the expenses. So Alima decided to start her own bag manufacturing business in order to better provide for her family.  She runs the business from her house. She buys materials from the market and stitches the bags and sells them in the local market as well as in her neighborhood.

Self-confident and supported by her family, Alima has successfully penetrated in the male-dominated business world.  She gets sufficient help and market knowledge from her husband. She knows that there is a great demand for her products (bags) in the market.

She is determined to succeed despite of the many challenges, and the greatest of them is lack of capital to expand her business.  So she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to overcome the problems.  She wants to purchase more raw materials for her business such as leather, cloth, gum, yarn, handles, buttons and other necessary items, and she will fully use the loan for that purpose.  She hopes the loan will enable her to reach to her goal to build up a bag manufacturing factory in the future.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her existing bag manufacturing business.

loans.name: Maa Dhanalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, 11 women from a village stepped out and formed a group called Maa Dhanalaxmi Self-Help Group in Odisha. They help each other and share their problems and solve the problems among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. 

Gitanjali, leader of the group, has six goats. The lady standing with her raised hand is Gitanjali. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccines and fodder to them when it is required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they are full grown. It takes eight to nine months for her to have them ready to sell. 

Gitanjali goes out in the morning to leave the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way she is earning to manage her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily needs. 

Gitanjali wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. She has requested this loan with her group so that they can earn more and they will control their families' cash flow.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing 10 goats for her goat farm.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en: Dilshod is 54 years old. She is a very sociable woman. She works with her husband and three children. Dilshod and her husband have been busy with growing agriculture products for more than 10 years. Dilshod mainly grows carrots. She sells the harvest in a local market. She knows all details of growing carrots well, so she usually gets good harvest. Dilshod, since childhood, has helped her parents to grow agriculture products. She buys food items and clothes for her family from the profits of her business. She is going to make the second sowing of carrots but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Хурматой. Она замужем. Ей 58 лет. Хурматой с мужем, невесткой и внуком живет в маленьком городке Турсунзаде.  Хурматой занимается кройкой и шитьем национальной одежды. Она этой деятельностью занята 10 лет. Ее невестка тоже начала заниматься шитьем. Хурматой берет заказы на шитье на дому для нее это очень удобно. 
  На сегодняшний день швейная машинка Хурматой сильно устарела и она самостоятельно не может купить швейную машинку. Она надеется получить кредит, чтобы совершить покупку и продолжить работу и не лишиться источника дохода.
texts.en:
This is Hurmatoy. She is 58, married, and lives in the small town of Tursun-zoda with her husband, daughter-in-law, and grandson. She has sewn traditional dresses for 10 years. Her daughter-in-law is also a seamstress. Hurmatoy takes sewing orders at home, which is convenient for her. 

Hurmatoy's sewing machine is obsolete and she cannot buy a new one on her own. She hopes to receive a loan to buy a new sewing machine so that she can continue her work and not lose her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Créé  en janvier 1998 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupement est l’un des plus anciens du programme et la majorité des membres jouissent d’une forte connaissance du système. Elles sont restées très dynamiques avec une solidarité renforcée de jour en jour car vivant dans le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est marié, âgée de 39 ans et mère de 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et articles vestimentaires qu’elle achète à la capitale dans un grand marché de la place. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et maîtrise à merveille les rouages de ce commerce.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des lots de brodés pour une valeur de 350 000 Fr CFA et divers articles vestimentaires : chaussures pour femme, pochettes et autres.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désirent d’une part accroître son épargne et d’autre part assurer une meilleure prise en charge des préoccupations familiales sur le plan de la nourriture, de la santé et de l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Created in January 1998, this group is among the first ones to join the program, and most of its members have a strong knowledge of the system. They remain very dynamic and since they live in the same neighborhood, their solidarity deepens every day. Their main activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Mariama, age 39, is the featured borrower for this group. She is the member sitting at the right. She is married with four sons. She sells fabrics and clothing that she buys at a large market in the capital. She has been doing this for over 10 years and has a great command of her activity. She plans to buy 350,000 FCFA worth of embroidered fabrics, as well as a variety of clothing items including ladies’ shoes, purses, etc. 

The profits earned will be used to bolster her savings and to better handle household needs in terms of the children’s nutrition, health and education.

loans.use: to buy 350,000 FCFA worth of embroidered fabrics, as well as a variety of clothing items including ladies’ shoes, purses, etc.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 44 years old and has four children. She lives in Tuguegarao City. To earn a living, Clara sells grocery items in her village. She hopes to increase her merchandise but she does not have enough capital to re-stock her store.

Clara is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as canned goods, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. She will keep extending good products and services to people. In the future, Clara plans to construct a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric materials for making table cloths

loans.name: Momina

texts.en:
Momina is from Dhupguri.  She is 40 years old, married and a mother of four children (two sons and two daughters), of whom two are students.  They live in a remote village West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. Both Momina and her husband are uneducated and can sign their names only.  They were deprived of education due to the poor economic resources of their parents.

Momina's husband is a laborer on a daily wages basis. His monthly earnings are scanty and unpredictable as his income depends on the daily income of his service.  Their eldest son also works as a daily laborer.  Due to the inconsistent income of Momina's husband and son, it was very difficult to make the both ends meet, and the family was facing acute financial crisis until Momina engaged herself in cattle breeding.  

She started the business by purchasing a dairy cow to give a financial assistance to her family.  She supplies milk to her neighbors, who are her main clients.  Her husband also helps her according to his convenience. Her business is a great financial support for the family.  Now with the growing expenses of a six-member family, she needs to expand her business.

So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase one dairy cow, which will provide more milk.  She hopes this will help her to avoid critical situations in the future and generate more income for the well being of her family.

She dreams to construct a decent and better house for them in the future.

She gives her thanks to both the generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and has one child who is not in school. For the past two years, she has worked selling poultry. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Riziki owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

Riziki is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Pabitra

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village Khalaigram located in the district of Jalpaiguri, Pabitra is a 43-year-old woman who is married and is rearing two children (one son and one daughter). She is illiterate but can sign her name, which her husband, Gajen, can't. He is a farmer by profession. Their children are in grades 9 and 12.

To make a living, Pabitra's husband is farming vegetables and rice in his ancestral land. The main source of the income for his family comes from their rice farm. These crops, being the main food of the regional people, have a great demand in the market. He has been cultivating rice for many years and acquired a vast knowledge about cultivating this crop. He grows good quality rice and sells at a cheaper rate to his customers. That is why he achieved a good many customers and the number is increasing gradually. So to satisfy the customer demand as well as strengthen his family economy, he wants to produce rice in larger quantities. His main challenge is capital.

Pabitra came to know about BJS, which gives business loans to rural women. She asked for a loan to help her husband to sustain his cultivation. Her plan is to use the loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to support her husband's agribusiness. She hopes she will be able to continue growing her business and improve her living conditions through this loan. She dreams to purchase more land in the future.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Akadashi

texts.en:
Akadashi, mother of a toddler, is from Dhupguri.  She is married to Badal, who is a cultivator by profession. They live at Baroghoria, a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Akadashi studied till grade 7. She is a housewife who looks after her husband and young child and manages the household.  After that she helps her husband in his work.

Akadashi 's husband tills their own plot of land.  He has been mainly farming vegetables like potatoes, beans, eggplants, gourds etc.  He has been in this agricultural activity for the last six years. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream to expand his business and secure the future of the family.  

With the increasing expenses of his family, he needs to increase his income by cultivating some other crop.  They have chosen paddy rice to cultivate, as it is the staple food for not only the people of their region but for the people throughout West Bengal.  So they hope it will be a lucrative business.

Akadashi is energetic, enthusiastic and determined to make a future through hard work and cooperation.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase necessary things such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so that they can start the cultivation as early as possible. She hopes the loan will help her to raise her standard of living and to purchase more agricultural land to expand their agribusiness.

She is thankful to the generous investors (BJS and Kiva) who stand for her.
