loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with two children. For the past two years, she has operated a business where she sells hair products and other cosmetics. Pamela’s business in located in a semi-urban area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes herself to be future-oriented. Pamela’s greatest business challenge is low stock. 

Pamela is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of hair products and cosmetics. This will be her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.	Pamela’s business goal is to have a salon and a boutique within five years and she hopes that, in the future, her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy hair products and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Thôn 4.5 - Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Thêm is 35 years old and married with three children. For the past eight years, she has worked in agriculture raising poultry. Thêm is the leader of the loan group Nhóm 12 Thôn 4.5 - Quảng Nhân Group, which consists of four members. She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2013 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid eight previous loans. Thêm’s main business hardship is the lack of capital.

Thêm is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. With her business profit, she hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, her business will do well, and her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is a 24-year-old woman from Dhupguri. She is married, a housewife and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters)  She is illiterate and did not get an opportunity to study. She can only sign her name. Her husband, Rajesh, aged 34 years, is also illiterate and can't sign his name. All their children attend school and are in secondary level. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).

Uma's husband is a cycle-van puller. (It is a kind of transport that is widely used in rural areas of India to carry goods and people.) He accumulated a good amount of money from some odd jobs he did and purchased a van for a steady income to improve his family's standard of living. He carries goods and people to the local markets or sometimes gives it on rent to the other van pullers. Unfortunately most of what is earned from his business is spent only for the food expenses of his family. Moreover, the cycle van was damaged by frequent use.  So they have decided to purchase a new cycle-van to carry on his business.

For getting financial support Uma contacted BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a business loan from them. She wants to use the loan to purchase a new cycle-van for her husband so that he can continue to do his work in order to earn for his family.

In the future, Uma aspires to purchase an auto-rickshaw with the profit and she gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband for his transportation business.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri lives in the small village Bairatiguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her two children (sons) and her husband, Bimal, who is a farmer.  Sabitri is 48 and is illiterate and can sign her name only, but her husband has a primary education. They are providing education to their children. One is in university and the other is in grade 8. They have a small kachha house (mud, wood and straw made).

Sabitri's husband, aged 58, has an agricultural farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. He is visionary and focused. He has been involved in this business for several years. He struggles hard to grow quality vegetables to satisfy his customers. His land is very fertile and productive.  His primary customers are individuals. Sabitri, though a housewife, helps her husband a lot by sowing, planting and carrying the produce to the market.  They need to expand their business in order to cope with the increasing expenses of their family, but their main challenge is lack of capital.

So Sabitri has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cultivate bitter gourd in their farmland. She wants to use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs for the cultivation.

Her goals are to strengthen their family economy, provide better education to her children and construct a better house for them to live in.

She thanks her lenders for helping her by giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for cultivating bitter gourds.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Halima prepares samosas, which she sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With this loan she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in a small house together. They have no children. 

Dilrabo has been working in a pharmacy for more than 4 years. She is a seller of medicines. At first she was a cleaning woman and then she was selected for the seller position by her boss. Now, she works well. 

Dilrabo studies in a university in the pharmacy faculty. She studies in absentia. She is going to pay for her tuition but she has not got the money. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza lives in Byurakn village of the Shirak region with her teenage daughter. Roza also has a son who currently serves in the army. Roza and her children do not have contact with Roza's husband. 

Roza has been engaged in agriculture for many years. With the help of her daughter, she runs a farm and breeds livestock. Specifically, they cultivate barley, potatoes, and also keep cattle, pigs, and hens. 

With a purpose to buy 900 bags of animal feed, Roza has applied for a loan of USD 2,700. Her hard-working family tries everything to make ends meet. Let's help them sustain their agribusiness and further grow it. They will appreciate any kind of support.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for organizing her new business

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 19 years old and married with a child. She lives in the town of Busia, in the the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Rose has been working hard to manage her business where she sells dried fish. She is the leader of a loan group comprised of three hardworking women. 

Rose is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda. She will use her portion of the group loan to stock more baskets of dried fish to sell. Her loan will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married to a farmer, and she helps her husband by working on their own farm to make a living. For many years she has had a pig raising business as well, and she earns more income from this. To improve the farm, she has taken a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she wants to see her children succeed, for her dream is to provide them with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира живет в маленьком городе под названием Турсунзаде. Она любит свой город. В этом городе много добропорядочных и гостеприимных людей. Город Турсунзаде был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя Мирзо Турсунзаде. Нодира в этом городе живет с семьей. Ей 36 лет. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Швейная машинка, на котором она работает сильно устарела и Нодира хочет приобрести новую, но не имеет достаточной суммы денег. Она просит кредит, чтобы совершить покупку.
texts.en: Nodira lives in the small town of Tursun-zoda.  She loves her town - many hospitable and respectable people live there.  Tursun-zoda was named after the great Tajik writer Mirzo Tursunzoda.  Nodira lives in the town with her family.  She is 36 years old and works sewing women's clothing.  The sewing machine she uses for work is very old; Nodira would like to buy a new one, but does not have enough money.  She is requesting a loan so that she can make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inputs for coffee production

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Shamama is a 56-year-old widow and has two daughters. Shamama is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that she is working every day without rest. She has been running her general store for 14 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables. Today, she is planning to increase her working capital to buy new products. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN. She is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy new products

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is married and lives in Audora, Zamboanga Del Sur, with her family. Her husband has a fishing business and she helps him raise fish in their own fish pond. She has been doing this for five years and earns an extra income. Marisa has taken a loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase feed. She hopes to improve and expand her business to generate more revenue for the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is divorced with seven children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). For the past 10 years, Sylivia has run a retail shop. She works seven days a week and her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and defaulters. Sylivia lives in a family house without electricity or running water and her monthly expenses include business rent and school fees. 

Sylivia is requesting a 400,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and bags of beans and rice. In the future, she aspires to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and bags of beans

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррина проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 27 лет. Она молодая, трудолюбивая и честная женщина, которая в течении трех лет занимается шитьем. Она живет вместе с мужем и двумя детьми. Дети у Заррины очень маленькие, помимо своего дела она занимается домашним хозяйством и воспитывает детей. Муж Заррины занимается строительными работами, он строитель. Он может не приходить домой днями, так как работает на нескольких проекта. Заррина вместе с мужем трудится во блага своей семьи. 
Заррина берет кредит для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки, чтобы ускорить работу и успеть сделать работу в срок.
texts.en: Zarrina lives in the region of Rudaki and is 27 years old.  She is a young, hard-working, and honest woman who, for the past three years, has been working as a seamstress.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Her children are very young, so, in addition to her work, she takes care of the home and raises her children.  Zarrina's husband works in construction as a builder.  He may not return home for many days at a time because he works on several projects at once.  Zarrina and her husband work together for the good of their family.  Zarrina is requesting a loan to purchase an additional sewing machine, which will help her speed up her work and successfully finish her work on time.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine in order to speed up her work, and to finish her work on time

loans.name: Nimwenga

texts.en:
Nimwenga is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more chicks for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, fortalecerá nuevamente su negocio por lo que opta por solicitar más capital, lo utilizara para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas e insecticidas, para continuar cultivando granos básicos, también comprara pasta de chocolate, guineos, naranjas, azúcar, bolsas, etc., son materiales con los que elabora la venta de choco bananos y charamuscas,.
Con el préstamo anterior ha progresado mucho su negocio, tiene nuevos clientes, su familia vive en  mejores circunstancias y sigue teniendo un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Rosa again strengthened her business so she is choosing to apply for another loan which she will use to buy seed, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, and insecticides to continue her cultivation of basic crops. She also will purchase chocolate paste, bananas, oranges, sugar, plastic bags, and more which are the materials she needs to make and sell chocolate-covered bananas and sweets.
With her previous loan she has seen much progress in her business. She now has good customers. Her family lives under better circumstances and she still has a good credit record.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make chocolate-covered bananas and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy uncooked clay, clay soil, ‘nacazcol’ [organic black dye], and firewood and to pay to transport the materials and the pieces.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, se siente satisfecho por el impacto positivo que tuvo la inversión del crédito anterior en su negocio, pues la cosecha fue muy abundante permitiéndole abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes, las ganancias han sido el respaldo para cancelar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Se dispone a preparar todo para la próxima siembra y necesita capital para adquirir de manera inmediata los insumos agrícolas, comprara abono, semilla, plaguicidas, insecticidas y herbicidas, con los que podrá iniciar el proceso de acondicionamiento del terreno y sembrar sin problemas de maleza.
texts.en:
Jose is very satisfied with the positive impact that his investment of a previous loan had on his business. The harvest was abundant, permiting him to supply his family and his customers. The earnings have been sufficient to pay off his debt and cover his family's basic necessities.

Jose is ready to prepare everything for the next sowing and he needs capital to acquire agricultural inputs immediately. He will purchase manure, seeds, plaguicides, insecticides, and herbicides, with which he can begin the process of conditioning the land and sowing without weed or desease problems.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds, plagicides, insecticides and herbicides for his next crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to produce carrots

loans.name: No Life Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “No Life” group from Accra-Chorkor, Ghana. They are small businesswomen who have come to ID Ghana, a partner of Kiva, in order to apply for a loan of GHS 4,300 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Lydia is the featured borrower of this group of businesswomen. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a butcher, and her children are attending school. 

Lydia has been selling cooking utensils, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish for over 15 years now. 

With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking utensils, corn and fish to prepare kenkey and sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, corn and fish

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 59 years old and is married with four sons. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing and selling corn and cabbage for 15 years. Raising seasonal vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan because there is a high demand for fresh vegetables. People attend Fatma’s grocery because the vegetables there are always fresh and tasty. She earns 150 AZN from her business.

Fatma is requesting a 1,500 AZN loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She believes her loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business. Fatma thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Peggy

texts.en: Peggy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with one child who goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Famia's Group

texts.en:
"Famia's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Famia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Famia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Famia has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more kids clothes to sell, and will help Famia to generate greater profits and increase her capital to set up a better kids shop. Famia hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her parents house. 

Famia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more kids clothes to sell,

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
This is Mwanasha. She previously accessed a loan that she used in her tailoring business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase fabric, thread and needles for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.. 

 She looks forward to this financial help with happiness and thankfulness in her heart

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and needles for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos,  sigue trabajando en la agricultura y solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas y abono, para preparar la tierra y dar un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos. Espera tener los buenos resultados del crédito anterior como lo son  mayor producción, mejores ingresos con los que pudo cancelar su deuda y ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en: Carlo is still working in agriculture and requests a new loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, and manure to prepare the land and develop his plants. He hopes to have good results he had with his previous loan, such as greater production and greater income with which he can pay off his debt and offer his family better food, clothes, and health.

loans.use: by fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, and manure.

loans.name: Tzucubal, Nahualá I Group

texts.es: Nicolás (aparece en la foto de último de izquierda a derecha con camisa de rayas, con sombrero y anteojos),  es una persona de 56 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, el crédito anterior le dejó muchos beneficios y le ayudó mucho para obtener  la alimentación de su familia, además tuvo muy buena cosecha y vendió una buena parte de ella y con el dinero de la venta lograr cubrir muchas necesidades de su familia, anteriormente a él le prestaban el dinero personas particulares el interés que paga es muy alto y además costaba mucho encontrar quién le diera el capital que necesita, Nicolás necesita un crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico y pago de jornales) para el mantenimiento de maíz, el crédito anterior le permitió tener alimentación de su familia para todo el año, el sueño de Nicolás es terminar de construir unos locales comerciales que empezó desde hace un tiempo
texts.en: Nicolás (appears in the photo on the right in the striped shirt with glasses and a hat), is 56 years old, lives in the town of Nahualá, in the county of Sololoá. The previous loan gave him many benefits and helped him greatly to obtain food for his family. Additionally, he had a very good harvest and sold a good part of it and with the money from the sale he was able to pay for many of the needs of his family. Previously, individual people loaned him money and the interest he paid was very high and it was very difficult for him to find someone to give him the capital he needed. Nicolás needs a loan to buy supplies (chemical fertilizer and payment of wages) for the maintenance of corn. The previous loan allowed him to have food for his family for the whole year. Nicolás' dream is to finish building some commercial storefronts that he began some time ago.

loans.use: by supplies for the cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 19-year-old businesswoman residing in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. She has been operating a flea market shop selling clothes for adults and children for the past year where she is assisted by family members. When she is not working at her shop she visits the elderly people and assists them with household tasks. Brenda is also busy volunteering to clean the local clinic. With the Kiva loan she will purchase high quality clothing, which will increase her sales and profits. With additional profits, Brenda hopes to own a boutique, create employment for the people in her community and meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Gladis Ester

texts.es:
Gladis, tiene necesidad de invertir nuevamente en su negocio y por la confianza que le inspira la institución, opta por solicitar un nuevo préstamo que le será de utilidad para resurtir la tienda y también hará mejoras en su vivienda, comprara aceite, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, arroz, frijoles, bebidas, dulces, etc., para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Gladis comenta que con la inversión anterior ha mantenido funcionando su negocio, mantiene ganancias estables, cancelo la deuda y que actualmente no ha tenido ningún problema con su negocio.
texts.en: Gladis needs to reinvest in her business, and because of the confidence the institution inspires in her, she chooses to request a new loan that will be of use to her in bouncing her business back and also making improvements to her home. She will buy oil, sugar, soap, detergents, rice, beans, drinks, sweets, etc., to keep her customers satisfied. Gladis says that with the previous investment she has kept her business functioning, maintained steady earnings, payed off her debt and that currently she has no problems with her business.

loans.use: buy oil, sugar, soap, detergents, beans, drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima appreciates for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting for a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus is 52 years old and he is the father of 5 daughters and 2 sons. He is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He is a talented, respected, professional man.  Elbrus is a dairy farmer. He started keeping dairy cows 25 years ago. Since then he has been able to grow his  business steadily to a point where he is able to get more than 10 liters of milk every day that he sells to his community. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to his hard work he has been able to develop and expand his business. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume.  Elbrus has already borrowed four loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for fifth loan of 500  AZN. With this money he wants to buy feed for his cows. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: buy feed to his cows

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.  She is requesting a new loan to purchase more cassava for resale.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava for resale.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been running a flea market stall for the past year selling women’s clothes and bags. When she is not working at her flea market shop she assists her local school by cleaning the toilets, since she wants students to have a sanitary learning environment where they are less likely to get sick. Sharon intends to purchase clothes with the support from a Kiva loan so as to increase sales. One day her dream is to own a boutique, create employment for the people in the community and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
Agustín, es una persona  de 61 años de edad, tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales 3 son hombres y 6 mujeres, está en unión de hecho, el vive junto a su familia en el municipio y departamento de Sololá.
El es agricultor, las actividades agrícolas que realiza son de: cebolla, papa y repollo, esta labor la realiza en su parcela ubicada en la comunidad donde vive, realiza esta actividad porque de ella obtiene aceptables ganancias, los cuales utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde muy joven y por lo mismo tiene mucha experiencia y conocimiento en ello. Don Agustín tiene el apoyo de sus hijos quienes le ayudan a transportar su cosecha hasta los lugares donde los vende.
El está solicitando un préstamo de 5,000 para la compra de semilla de cebolla.
Sueña con tener buenas cosechas y asi obtener suficientes ganancias y con ello no depender de préstamos.
texts.en:
Agustín is 61 years old.  He has nine children—three men and six women.  He is in a common-law relationship and lives, together with his family, in the Sololá municipality and department.

He is a farmer; he raises onion, potato, and cabbage.  He does his farming on his land parcel, located in the community where he lives.  He does this line of work because it is how he obtains acceptable earnings which he uses to sustain his family.  He has been in this line of work since he was very young, so he has a lot of experience and knowledge in this area.  Don Agustín has the support of his children, who help him to carry his harvest to the places where he sells it.

He is asking for a loan of 5,000 quetzales for the purchase of onion seed.

He dreams of having a good harvest and thus get enough earnings, and in that way to not depend on loans.

loans.use: to buy onion seed

loans.name: Jose Isidro

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y uno de sus hijos de 17 años; trabaja en la crianza de ganado y cerdos, trabajan todos juntos, sus labores inician muy temprano todos los días, lo práctica desde hace 25 años, son oficios que heredo de sus padres. Por el momento no representa ninguna dificultad.
Comprará concentrado y vitaminas para ganado y cerdos, al fortalecer su negocio espera poder vender a mejor precio sus animales y tener los recursos económicos para cumplir con sus compromisos y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y comprar un terreno para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
José lives with his family: his wife and one of his children, age 17.  He works raising cattle and pigs.  They all work together, beginning at a very early hour everyday.  He has done this for twenty-five years, having inherited this line of work from his parents.  For now, he is not having any difficulties.

He will buy concentrated feed and vitamins for his cattle and pigs to strengthen his business.  He hopes to be able to sell his animals at a better price and have the financial resources to take care of his commitments and improve his family’s quality of life.

His dream is to improve his house and buy a plot of land to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for cattle and pigs

loans.name: Kudzai

texts.en: Kudzai is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has  been rearing and selling broiler chickens for eighteen months with assistance from her family members. With their help, she produces batches of 100 broiler birds every six weeks. When she is not tending to her poultry business, she commits herself to cleaning a local secondary school and clinic. Kudzai  intends to increase her production of the broiler birds to a batch of 100 weekly so as to meet the customer demand and increase her sales and profits. She intends to do this with the requested Kiva loan. With additional profits she hopes to own a butchery, create employment for the people in her community and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks

loans.name: Benevolence

texts.en:
Benevolence is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children and lives in Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a grocery stall for the past six months. Benevolence also volunteers her spare time assisting girls at her local secondary school in guidance and counselling and cleaning the school toilets. 

With the requested loan, Benevolence intends to expand her business by making bulk purchases of pens, sugar, salt and soap so as to boost her sales and profit volume. With her additional profits she intends to improve the quality of life for her family and expand her business in order to create employment.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en: Emmah is an 18-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing the broiler chickens for eight months now with assistance from her husband and family members. She produces them in batches of 25 broiler birds every six weeks. Emmah also volunteers her spare time assisting girls with guidance and counselling and cleaning the school toilets. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase more birds, vaccines and feed so as to produce batches of 25 broiler birds every week and expand her business into a poultry butchery. One day she hopes to create employment in her community and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is a 24-year-old, married businesswoman. She lives in Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her family. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for six months now with assistance from her husband. She produces these in batches of 50 broiler birds every six weeks. Precious also volunteers her spare time assisting girls at the local secondary school in her community with guidance and counselling sessions. Precious also provides support by cleaning the school yard. With the requested loan, she intends to increase her production of the broiler birds to 50 birds every week so as to meet the demand and benefit from increased sales and profits. With increased profits, she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family and community.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Edwin Efrain

texts.es:
Edwin, es soltero, vive con su madre quien ya es una señora avanzada edad, él es responsable de cubrir los gastos que se generan en su hogar; su actividad económica es administrar una tienda en la que ofrece productos de la canasta básica, lo aprendió de algunos familiares.
El préstamo que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, sal, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maíz, pan, bebidas, jabón, desinfectantes, lejía, etc., podrá surtir la tienda con nuevos productos que le permitan atraer a nuevos clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
Aspira tener un negocio más amplio, cancelar su deuda y lo más importante darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre.
texts.en:
Edwin is single.  He lives with his mother, who is now at an advanced age.  He is responsible for covering the household expenses.  His line of work is running a store where he offers basic staples.  He learned this line of work from some family members.  

He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of oil, salt, sugar, rice, beans, corn, bread, drinks, soap, disinfectants, bleach, etc. so that he can stock his store with new products.  This will allow him to attract new customers and earn a better income.  He aspires to have a bigger business, cancel his debt and, most importantly, to give his mother a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, sugar, rice, beans, corn, bread, drinks, soap, disinfectants, bleach, etc.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred owns a retail shop in Hoima, Uganda. He works all through the week. He started his business in 2012 so as to improve on his standard of living. As a married and hard-working man, Fred hopes to expand his business with a mattress shop separate from a clothing shop. However, competition hinders his business and high rental costs are a problem for him.
 
He is accessing credit to buy mattresses and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
This is Maimuna. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She has been in this business for years now and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan, to buy extra stocks of ingredients such as potatoes, cooking oil and wheat flour for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy extra stocks of ingredients such as potatoes, cooking oil and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Crusade Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of Crusade Group and they are beginning its sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. It is made up of two members who are into the sale of charcoal, rice and cooking oil. The loan that they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Yaa. Yaa says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling charcoal, which she has done for the past 18 years. 

The loan Yaa will take out now is to increase capital by buying more bags of charcoal at wholesale and sell to customers at retail. This work allows her to generate resources for her family, since she is married and has one dependable child. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Yaa says she likes the training, the savings and the health programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal at wholesale and sell to customers at retail.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a 21-year-old mother of one, who lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her family. She has been into poultry production for the past six months, in which she works with her husband. Every week she produces these birds in batches of 25. Roselyn also volunteers her spare time assisting girls at the local secondary school in her community with guidance and counselling and cleaning the school toilets. With the requested loan from Kiva, she intends to increase the production of broiler chicks to batches of 25 every week in order to meet the demand and benefit from increased sales and profits. With her increased profits she hopes to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Dora Celina

texts.es:
Dora, es propietaria de una carpintería desde hace cinco años, ella es casada y vive con su esposo;  en sus inicios solamente tenía conocimiento sobre como  enjuncar muebles posteriormente conoció a su esposo, quien tiene más experincia sobre la carpintería, juntos lograron tener un fondo para establecer mejor el negocio, lo atiende junto a su esposo y dos sobrinos, en un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de madera de cedro, aceituno, roble y pino, para cumplir con el pedido de muebles para una comercial, lo que representa estabilidad económica y oportunidades de crecimiento para su negocio.
Su visión es seguir trabajando para lograr tener su propio local y tener mejores ingresos para cumplir responsablemente con sus compromisos económicos y familiares.
texts.en:
Dora has been the proprietor of a carpentry shop for five years.  She is married and lives with her husband.  Initially, she only knew how to put together furniture.  Later, she met her husband, who had more carpentry experience.  Together they had a foundation to better establish their business.  Together with her husband and two nephews, she takes care of the business, working a schedule from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon.

She will use the capital she is requesting to buy cedar, olive, oak, and pine wood in order to finish a furniture order for a commercial establishment.  This represents financial stability and growth opportunities for her business.

Her vision is to keep working in order to have her own shop and to have a better income in order to take care of her financial and family commitments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy wood: cedar, olive tree, oak, and pine

loans.name: Fatoumata Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Créé  en janvier 1998 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupement est l’un des plus anciens du programme et la majorité des membres jouissent d’une forte connaissance du système. Elles sont restées très dynamiques avec une solidarité renforcée de jour en jour car vivant dans le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout  à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Malgré son célibat sans enfant, elle ne reste pas moins une femme battante et très ambitieuse. Elle est âgée de 32 ans et s’active dans la vente de produits du terroir (huile de palme, mil, pâte d’arachide), qu’elle achète au grand marché hebdomadaire international et auprès de producteurs des villages proches de la commune.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 bidons d’huile de palme de 20 litres, 02 seaux de pâte d’arachide et 03 bidons de miel de 20 litres pour la revente.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge ses propres besoins et d’apporter son appui à ses parents au besoin.
texts.en:
Created in January 1998 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois", this group is one of the oldest in the program and most of its members have a deep understanding of the system. They have always been very dynamic, their solidarity reinforced from day to day, since they live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale commerce. 

Madame Fatoumata (standing on the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower from this group. Despite the fact that she is unmarried and has no children, she is a woman who works hard and is very ambitious. She is 32 and works at selling local products such as palm oil, millet, and peanut butter, which she buys at the big weekly international market and from producers in nearby villages. 

With her new loan, she intends to buy five jerrycans holding 20 liters each of palm oil, two buckets of peanut butter, and three jerrycans of 20 liters of honey, all for resale. 

Her profit will allow her to cover her own expenses and help her parents out if necessary.

loans.use: to buy 5 jerrycans holding 20 liters each of palm oil, two buckets of peanut butter, and three jerrycans of 20 liters of honey for resale.

loans.name: Tzucubal, Nahualá Ii Group

texts.es: Diego (aparece en la foto de tercero de izquierda a derecha de playera blanca, pants rojo y sandalias),  es una persona de 31 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, el crédito anterior lo utilizó para cultivo de maíz y le dejo muy buenos resultados y cumplió su objetivo que era tener la alimentación de su familia, vendió una buena parte de su cosecha y con el dinero de la venta lograr cubrir muchas necesidades de su familia, con la asesoría que recibe del manejo y mantenimiento de maíz logra tener buena cosecha, Diego necesita un crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico y pago de jornales) para el mantenimiento de maíz, con las ganancias que obtiene ha ido mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, el sueño de Diego es comprar maquinaria para sastrería.
texts.en:
Diego is the third person from the left in the picture, wearing a white t-shirt, red pants, and sandals. He is 31 years old and lives in the town of Nahualá, in the department of Sololá. He used his previous loan to grow corn and it gave him very good results. He achieved his goal, which was to have enough food to feed his family, and he sold a good portion of his harvest. The money from that sale allowed him to be able to cover many of his family's needs. The advice he is getting about managing and maintaining corn are enabling him to obtain good harvests.

Diego needs a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and to pay for laborers to maintain his corn crops. He has used the profit he makes to gradually improve his family's living conditions. Diego's dream is to buy machinery for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Coumbel's Group

texts.fr:
Créé  en janvier 1998 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupement est l’un des plus anciens du programme et la majorité des membres jouissent d’une forte connaissance du système. Elles sont restées très dynamiques avec une solidarité renforcée de jour en jour car vivant dans le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Debout  à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée, madame Coumbel est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Célibataire de son état, elle est âgée de 35 ans et prend en charge ses trois garçons. Elle gère une boutique de cosmétique et produits de beauté. Elle achète sa marchandise le plus souvent à la capitale dans les grands marchés auprès de grossistes pour la revente dans sa boutique. Elle une très grande connaissance des différents produits en vogue pour la clientèle.

Avec son  nouveau prêt  elle va  s’approvisionner en mèche (cheveux artificiels) pour une dizaine cartons et des douzaines de lait de beauté et parfum de chambre utilisé fréquemment durant l’hivernage.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir ses garçons dans leur scolarité et améliorer de sur quoi le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Created in January 1998 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois", this group is one of the oldest in the program and the majority of its members have a deep understanding of the system. They have always been very dynamic, their solidarity reinforced every day since they live in the same neighborhood. Their primary activity is small-scale commerce. 

Standing on the far right with her left hand raised, Madame Coumbel is the featured borrower of the group. Single, she is 35 years old and is raising her three sons. She runs a shop selling cosmetics and beauty products. She buys her merchandise mostly in the capital in big markets from wholesalers and resells it in her shop. She is quite familiar with all the different products that are in vogue with her clientele. 

With her new loan she is going to stock up on 12 boxes of extensions (artificial hair) and several dozen bottles of beauty cream and cologne, which is frequently used during the summer season. 

With the profit she will make from her activity, she intends to support her sons' schooling and improve the living standard of the family a bit.

loans.use: to stock up on 12 cartons of hair extensions (artificial hair) and several dozen jars of beauty cream and bottles of cologne.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, ice, jams, cups, and spoons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, rice, beans, vegetables, disposable items (cups, bags, plates, spoons, etc.), beverages and propane among other materials

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Gracias al primer préstamo que recibió pudo obtener una buena cosecha; antes del primer crédito tenía mucho desconocimiento de cómo adquirir apoyo de los bancos o instituciones como ADICLA y KIVA. Gracias al préstamo y la buena cosecha pudo ayudar a su familia con sus gastos y el pago de las cuotas. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semilla para la mejora de su cosecha.  Su sueño más importante a futuro es ampliar su siembra y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Thanks to the first loan that he received, Carlos was able to get a good harvest.  Before getting that first loan, he knew little about how to give help from banks or institutions like ADICLA and KIVA.  With the help of the loan and the good harvest,  Carlos was able to help his family with their expenses and with making payments.  He will invest the new loan in buying seed to improve his harvest.  His most important dream for the future is to increase his planting and thus get a better return.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy religious articles for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and married to Viginia, and they are blessed with five children who are in primary school. Joseph has been running a restaurant and butcher's shop for the last seven years and earns an income of 15,500 KES.
	 
He has applied for a second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use this loan of 40,500 KES to buy goats for slaughter and also to buy chairs for the restaurant. He paid his previous loan successfully.                                                                                             

The profit he earns will be used to educate his children. He hopes to grow his business and buy a piece of land to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughtering and to buy chairs for the restaurant

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: This is Patricia, a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She still sells household items in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more household items for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household items for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Eulises

texts.es:
Oscar, invirtió el préstamo anterior en materiales para su taller de estructuras metálicas y alimento para la granja de gallinas ponedoras, su situación económica es más favorable, en su vida personal algunas cosas han cambiado ya está casado pero aún no tienen hijos.
Con el nuevo préstamo que está solicitando comprara hierro, tubos, láminas, electrodos, pintura y concentrado para las aves de corral, de esta manera seguirá teniendo a su alcance todo lo necesario para trabajar y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Oscar invested his previous loan in materials for his metal shop and in feed for his egg-laying chickens. His financial situation has improved and a few things have changed in his personal life. He is now married, but doesn't have any children yet.

He will use the new loan he is requesting to buy iron, pipes, sheet metal, electrodes, paint, and feed for his chicken farm. This will allow him to continue having at hand everything that he needs in order to keep working and prospering.

loans.use: to buy iron, pipes, sheet metal, electrodes, paint, and feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Summi's Group

texts.en:
Sumini's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Sumini is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Sumini has been working hard to manage her small business, through which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sumini has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more adult clothes to sell, and will help Sumini to generate greater profits and pay for her parents' medication. Sumini hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a savings account. 

Sumini is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more adult clothes to sell

loans.name: Ngosha Group

texts.en:
Chema is a mother of two girls who live with her and attend school. She is in her late 30s and divorced. She supports herself and her children by running small businesses. Chema cooks and sells chapati and other types of snacks. She also sells clothes door-to-door after finishing her food business. She has been selling clothes for two years now. She works from morning to evening and is able to realize a very small profit each month. 

This will be her first loan via Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Chema will use her loan to buy clothes to sell and ingredients for making snacks. Her desire is to grow her businesses more. She will share this loan with her loan group "Ngosha," which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa de 58 años de edad, realizo 2º grado de estudio en el centro escolar de la misma comunidad, ella está casada tiene 43 años de matrimonio tuvieron 9 hijos todos mayores de edad y todos estan acompañados,  tiene un hijo que vive en la  misma vivienda con ella,  está la nuera, el hijo y una nieta. 

Ella tiene engorde de cerdos y eso lo ha desempeñado toda una vida desde que estaba con los papás de ella,  luego se casó y siguió con esta dinámica de generadora de ingresos, ella tiene 4 hijos en estados unidos, tiene remesas de ellos también el esposo se involucra en el negocio él cuida las vacas y a la vez le ayuda a la esposa con la alimentación de estos animales y para ir a comprar los alimentos de los cerdos  se traslada en un bus que conduce del cantón a la ciudad y recorre una hora de camino en bus. 

Con el crédito pagara lo que debe por la compra de una vaca parida y quiere vender la leche para tener otro ingreso.

La cliente planea para el futuro, estar cerca de Dios y asegurarse una alimentación adecuada y así esperar los días que Dios le desee regalar más de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years-old and she completed the second grade in the community’s school. She has been married for 43 years and she has had 9 children, all of them over the legal age and who have partner. She has a son that lives with her in the same household, as well as the daughter-in-law, their son and a grandchild. 

She is responsible for fattening pigs and has done this all of her life, since she was with her parents and after she married she continued with this revenue-generating dynamic. She has four children in the United States and obtains remittances from them. Her husband is also involved in the business; he takes care of the cows and helps his wife by feeding them. In order to purchase the pigs feed, her husband travels in a bus from the county to the city and the voyage takes an hour. 

With this loan she will pay what she owes for the purchase of a calved cow and she wishes to sell the milk to have another source of revenue. 

The client’s plan for the future involves being closer to God and to ensure an adequate nutrition and await the days that God wishes to add to her life.

loans.use: to pay what she owes for the purchase of a calved cow and to sell the milk to have another source of revenue.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

Jennifer operates a retail shop at the market. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for 10 years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Jennifer has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, beans, peas, sugar, rice and salt. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a deep freezer to start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, peas, salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wire, light bulbs, refrigerant gas, screws, screwdrivers, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven de admirar desde sus 13 años comenzó con sus cultivos de café y hoy a sus 23 años tiene unos excelente cultivos y distribuye café en bultos a diferentes lugares, es un joven muy emprendedor y luchador de la vida por eso cada día quiere mejorar para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para preparar la tierra como abonos, fertilizantes pues son insumos muy costosos que en ocasiones no están al alcance del agricultor. 
Su gran sueño es poder mantener a su esposa tener familia y ser dueño de unos grandes y extensos cultivos.
texts.en:
Victor is a young man who must be admired, at the age of 13 he started cultivating coffee and today, at the age of 23, he has excellent crops and distributes coffee in bulk to different places. 

He is a very entrepreneurial young man and a fighter in life, which is why he wishes to improve and to do that he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies for land preparation, such as manure and fertilizer. These supplies are costly and at times they are beyond the reach of the farmer.

His big dream is to take care of his wife, to have a family and to be the owner of some vast and extensive crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, irrigation and fertilizer.

loans.name: Al- Wes Group

texts.en:
This group is called  Al-Wes and it consists of five women who are all hard-working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan YER 100,000. 

Khadija is 44 years old and a married woman with eight children. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very active and dynamic. She has a strong determination to improve the standards of her living. 

She started her business with a small food stall, selling potatoes and some kinds of sandwiches for the children in the schools. Step by step, she increased her business through selling makeup and accessories. She sees this business as a profitable for her, but her capital is still very small. 

For this reason, Khadija requested a loan of YER 20,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase more of accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

Khadija expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through the sales of more accessories, makeup, and ready-made women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more of accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Marcos Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcos es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Tiene dos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor y una excelente educación.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura, su principal cultivo es el cacao y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, innovador, tiene amplios conocimientos sobre sus cultivos y siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Marcos está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar fertilizantes para poder abonar sus cultivos, pago por el mantenimiento hasta la cosecha, con esto obtendrá mayores ingresos y seguirá esforzándose para convertirse en el principal productor y distribuidor de cacao de la zona y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is an enterprising man. He is 53 years old, married, and lives with his family in San Martin.

Marcos has two children who are his greatest source of pride. For this reason, he works tirelessly to provide them an excellent education and a better future.

Marcos has been farming for several years. The main crop that he cultivates is cacao. He is doing very well because he is a responsible, hardworking, and innovative individual who has extensive knowledge about his crops and always offers quality products.

Marcos is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have offered. He will be able to buy fertilizers for his crops and pay for maintenance costs through the harvest season. As a result, he will be able to generate more income. Marcos continues to strive to become the main producer and distributor of cacao in the area. This will help to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for maintenance costs for his crops.

loans.name: La Golondrina Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por res socias laboriosas, y coordinado por la señora Lucila de 59 años de edad y soltera se dedica a la comercialización de calzado y artesanías en los departamentos de país, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sandalias altas, sandalias bajas, zapatos para damas y caballeros, este negocio lo impulso hace cinco años y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Las otras integrantes son las señoras Mirna de 32 años de edad quien tiene una venta de abarrotes en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace ocho años, y Juana de 53 años de edad quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio desde hace nueve años.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hard-working members and is coordinated by Lucila who is 59 years old and single. She sells footwear and handicrafts in the different departments of the country. 

She is asking for the loan in order to buy high-heeled sandals, flat sandals and shoes for ladies and gentlemen. She started up this business five years ago and has help from her eldest daughter. 

The other members are Mirna, aged 32, who has had a grocery stall in the town market for eight years and Juana, aged 53, who has been making and selling tortillas from her home for nine years.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
From the village of Velistsikhe, 56-year-old Makvala lives with her pensioner husband; both cultivate a family-owned vineyard and sell their harvested grapes at a local market. 

Because this income is seasonal and limited, Makvala requested a loan and was approved under the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program which gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. With the requested money she plans to build a traditional Georgian bakery in her home territory, baking and selling bread in her village.

Makvala and her husband will bake the breads themselves and will generate a stable income for their welfare. They rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate Kiva lenders' help.

loans.use: To build a traditional Georgian bakery

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en: Mesalim is married and has seven children. One is in school and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a coconut selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald, a married father of three children, describes himself as future-oriented. He operates a posho mill where he grinds maize to produce maize flour for sale. Located in an urban area, Gerald has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Gerald will use this Kes 10,000 loan to buy more maize stock. His business goal is to have a cereals shop within five years. This will be his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy maize stock

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita, 33, a mother of two sons lives at West Magurmari, a small village in the Jalpaiguri district.  She is a housewife and married to Tapan, a 38-year- old farmer.  Both are uneducated and can only sign their names.  One of their sons attends school and is in grade 7. The other son is too young for school. They have a small kachha house (made of straw, wood and mud).

Kabita's husband works as a farmer in the village to earn an income for the family's household.  He has cultivable paddy land where he grows paddy. He has been engaged in these activities for many years.  Although Kabita is a homemaker, she helps her husband's work.  They sell the produce in the local market.  The major part of their locality is covered with agricultural land and paddy is cultivated widely in the region. So, they have to face competitors in the market. The income generated from this cultivation is insufficient to support the family.

Kabita wants to increase their productivity.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  She will use the loan to buy better quality seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for a good quality product.  She hopes the loan will enable her to earn additional income to provide a better lifestyle to her family and build a better and decent house for them.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and other necessary things to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Ann Bauti Shg Group

texts.en:
Ann Bauti Self Help Group was formed with 13 members in 2013 in a small village in Odisha. The members all came together to help each other, solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. 

Sabitri, who is a widow, is an active member of this group. The lady standing with her raised hand is Sabitri. Sabitri is a 48-year-old woman living with her 24-year-old son. For the past 12 years, Sabitri has been working as a farmer and earning 3,000 INR per month but it is not sufficient to manage the small family. Sabitri's son is helping his mother by working with her and being involved in the milk business. Sabitri's son is a very hardworking boy; he is always ready to help his mother. Sabitri has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can support her family’s income. Sabitri says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her son to a good college. Through that, she can provide a better education to her son.

Sabitri is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder and to build a cow shed.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida, married with five children, all of whom go to school, lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

Hamida has been selling milk for 10 years, working at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and thieves. She generates additional income from rental rooms. 

Hamida has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from  MCDT-SACCO to buy more cans of milk and loaves of bread. Her goal is to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy jerricans of milk and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is a self-employed woman from the Sariar village of the Shirak region. She lives there with her parents and two children (one son and one daughter). Anahit's other son and her husband have moved to the Russian Federation to earn money and support their family. Anahit has been engaged in animal husbandry and farming for many years. With the help of her family members, she breeds cattle and hens, and cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. Anahit now wants to expand her family's agribusiness a little bit and has applied for a loan of USD 3,000. This amount will be used to purchase 300 liters of fuel, 4 pigs, 20 bags of animal feed and 20 bags of fertilizers. This large family is in a quite hard financial situation. That's why they really hope for the lenders' help and goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase fuel (300 liters), livestock (4 pigs), animal feed (20 bags) and fertilizers (20 bags)

loans.name: Amani Suka Group

texts.en:
Tatu is a businesswoman who is currently running a middle-class food business, Mamalishe. She has been in this business for ten years. It is open from 6:00 a.m. to midnight. She is married and has two grown children. Tatu is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to replenish her food store with new stocks. She dreams of building a nice hotel. Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "Amani Suka," which consists of eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her food store with new stocks.

loans.name: Ldyia

texts.en:
Ldyia is married with two children and ones goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and school fees.

Ldyia has a retail shop and has been in this business for 4 years. She works in her shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and defaulters. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, bags of beans, and rice. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease her transportation.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and rice

loans.name: Siboniso

texts.en: Siboniso is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chicks for six months now producing 50 broiler birds every six weeks. Siboniso volunteers her spare time assisting girls at her local secondary school in her community with guidance and counselling sessions. With the requested loan, she intends to expand her business to produce 50 broiler birds every week and expand into a poultry butchery to increase her sales and get more profits.  From this, she could improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is a 37-year-old married man, and he has 3 kids. Ramil is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. He buys and sells cattle and this helps him to earn a living. He buys calves and bullocks and sells them for profit after fattening them. This is his main source of income. His wife, who works at the market as a saleswoman, helps him with the business. Ramil wants to get a loan of 600 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and expand his business.

loans.name: Singngat Group

texts.en:
Niangboi, 45, the featured member of the group Singngat C with her hand raised, is a very hardworking woman and a mother of four. She hails from a remote village in Churachandpur district in Manipur, in the Northeastern region of India where there is less access to electricity and transportation. Being a single mother, Niangboi struggles a lot to sustain her family needs. She runs a small variety shop near her house in the village to gain some profits. She also sends her four children to school without the help of others. Since she is the only earning member in the family, she has to work double the working hours of the other mothers. She stays until late in the evening to run her shop while her children have to study their lessons from school. The shortage of power in the area affects the normal lives of the families.  The solar home lighting system will bring a better environment in the house and the shop after sunset. With the solar loan, she wants to buy a 45-watt solar home lighting system that she can install wherever it is convenient. While the children study their lessons under the solar light, their mother can run the shop with comfort under the solar light after sunset. Longer period of study after sunset by the children will add colors to their academic performances and their mother will earn more profit by extending her business hours after sunset.

The group Singngat C was formed by women with common interests to get the solar loan. The other members of the group are engaged in different professions like farming, vegetable vending, manual labor, weaving, etc.

loans.use: To buy a mini solar system for home lighting

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be future-oriented and committed. He operates a retail business where he sells rice, sugar, drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use his KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks, rice, sugar and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, aged 38, is a religious leader in Hoima, Uganda. He is a maize and banana farmer. He started the farming business so as to have a source of income alongside doing religious work. He desires to acquire another plot of land for agricultural expansion. Fluctuations in weather affect the growth of his crops. 

He will use the money to plough, plant, weed and harvest his maize and banana plantations.

loans.use: to plough, plant, weed and harvest his maize and banana plantations.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 28, lives with her long-term partner and two children. She sells charcoal to help support her family.

Christine took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Yehu. She is now applying for a 100,000 KES loan to buy more charcoal. Her customers are increasing, and she would like to meet their demands.

To provide a good education for her two children so they will realize a prosperous future is Christine’s greatest desire.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Vernashen village with her husband and 28-year-old son. The family has been engaged in beekeeping for 18 years already. They already have 20 colonies. They also keep hens. In order to expand her family's agricultural business and make it  more profitable, Gohar now wants to buy 13 more colonies, as well as 150 hives. For these expenses a loan of USD 3000 is needed. 

Gohar has previously taken over 20 loans and has a very good credit history with no overdue days. Now she really hopes to receive support from the lenders. This is her family's only revenue source. That is why they will appreciate any kind of support.

loans.use: to purchase 13 bee colonies and 150 beehives

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for this season's coffee plants

loans.name: Las Sonrientes Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Tanya una mujer exitosa de 25 años de edad y soltera se dedica a la venta de cosméticos AVON y ropa de segunda, este negocio lo impulso hace cinco años por medio de un préstamo que le hizo a su mamá con el fin de impulsar su negocio, para seguir creciendo en el ámbito de negocios solicita el crédito para la compra de pacas de calidad, así mismo invertirá en vanidades, cremas corporales, cremas para el cabello, body corporales, perfumes, pinturas labiales, etc., la socia con créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar su negocio. Otra de las socias es la señora Betty de 24 años de edad comerciante de bisuterías desde hace dos años en su comunidad, la señora Xiomara de 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace diecisiete años en su domicilio y en los al rededores de su comunidad, y la señora Nohelia de 23 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos, bisuterías y ropa en los al rededores de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace más de un año.
texts.en:
This dedicated group is made up of four hardworking members coordinated by Sra. Tanya. She is 25 years old, successful, and single. She earns her living selling Avon cosmetics and secondhand clothing, a business she started five years ago with a loan from her mother. Now she wishes to continue growing the business so she is seeking a loan to buy bundles of quality clothing, and other items such as hair cream, body lotion, perfume, lipstick etc. With her previous loan María managed to increase sales.

24-year old Betty is another member of the group. She has been selling costume jewelry for two years in the community. 42-year old Xiomara has been selling cosmetics for seventeen years from her home and in nearby neighborhoods. 23-year old Nohelia also sells cosmetics, jewelry, and clothing around her community, a business she started more than a year ago.

loans.use: Buy bundles of quality clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and do general repairs on his taxi.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and one goes to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells second-hand clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis. She moves door to door to sell her clothes and works six days a week. She has been in this business for two years. 

She has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO (Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO) to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge is transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to own her own store selling both used and new clothes. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулизор родилась в 1979 году. Она не замужем и живет вместе с сестрой. Гулизор имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе учительницей младших классов уже более 11 лет. Гулизор очень любит свою профессию и старается, чтобы молодое поколение росло образованным и делает для этого все возможное. Гулизор последнее время серьёзно болеет. Ей срочно необходимо лечится. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulizor was born in 1979. She is not married and lives with her sister. She has a degree in teaching and has taught the junior grades of high school for over 11 years. Gulizor loves teaching and does everything that she can to make sure the young generation grows up to be educated. Gulizor is seriously ill and she urgently needs treatment. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy medicine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Holymisdas

texts.en:
Holymisdas, aged 66 years, is a hard working married Ugandan man with seven children aged between 20 and 40 years, with only the youngest still in school.  He is a man operating in the transportation business.  He also earns additional income from a number of activities including, operating a milling machine, selling bananas locally (called matooke), and from the local government where he earns a monthly salary as a Local Chairperson at level III (LC III).  

His major aim of being involved in a variety of activities is to have a satisfactory retirement since he is aging.  The loan, if given to him, will be used to repair his lorry (truck) which has had a faulty engine system for a long time.  He faces a challenge of poor roads due to the ever changing weather.

loans.use: to repair his lorry (truck).

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school and one who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. With the loan, she wants to purchase rice, cooking oil, and beans for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Selevano

texts.en:
