Selvano is a 64-year-old Ugandan man with nine children, but only two attending school.  He operates a butcher shop that is open 7 days a week.  This is all he has to generate income to earn a living.  

He needs a loan to buy more cows for slaughtering, which will help him to increase his income and profit levels.  Selvano hopes to construct a residential house to fulfill his dream.  Limited capital is his major challenge.

loans.use: to buy more cows for slaughtering.

loans.name: Norah Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Norah Al- Hodeidah is a group of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are applying for a loan of 80,000 YER through AMB to be apportioned among themselves.

Aisha is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. She is uneducated, but she is very motivated to lift her family out of what is described as “miserable conditions.” She started selling women and children's clothes door to door a few months ago with a small bit of capital. She now earns a modest profit from her humble business.

In order to increase business, Aisha will use her 20,000 YER loan portion to buy more stylish ready-to-wear for women and children to sell to her customers. Her ambition is to open a large shop where she will sell all kinds of stylish clothes.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear to sell door to door

loans.name: Thandeka

texts.en:
Thandeka is a 27-year-old businesswoman and mother two children.  She lives with her family in the Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe.  She has been successfully operating butchery for 8 months now and employs one person to assist her with the business.  Thandeka volunteers her spare time advising children on the importance of schooling as well as helping supply the local clinic with water and cleaning its premises.  

Thandeka will use the requested loan for goat fattening and sell the goat meat in her butchery, introducing variety to appeal to more customers.  With the additional profits, Thandeka would like to further her education and study as a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to expand her butcher business.

loans.name: Nomathemba

texts.en:
Nomathemba, 26, is a single lady with one child and lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a flea market stall for six months now where she sells ladies’ clothes and shoes.

As a Cama Learner Guide Nomathemba volunteers several hours a week assisting girls with guidance and counseling. She also cleans the school’s toilets so that students can have a clean learning environment. Her volunteer work is a way she repays the interest on her loan. (See an explanation of these loans below.)

With her 500 USD loan through Camfed, Nomathemba intends to buy clothes and shoes in bulk from wholesalers at lower costs. She will then be able to sell these items at favorable prices and become competitive. She hopes to expand her business with the increased profits, create employment and improve the quality of life for herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Brenda's Group

texts.en:
Brenda's group is comprised of 3 hard working women.  Brenda is 23 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  For the past 2 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry fish. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to stock more baskets of dry fish for sale, which will help Brenda to generate greater profits, and to buy basic needs for her family.  Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more baskets of dry fish for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 22 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year she has been working hard selling gasoline.

Fatuma is applying for a loan of 400,000 UGX through BRAC Uganda to be used to buy more gas to sell. This loan will help her to generate greater profits and so pay for school fees for her siblings. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more gas to sell.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Si Podemos Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras y coordinado por la señora Ana Rosa de 35 años de edad y acompañada se dedica a comprar cosechas para luego comercializarlas en el mercado de la municipalidad, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años con la ayuda financiera de su esposo y por medio de los créditos la socia ha logrado aumentar los productos ofrecidos por lo que ha obtenido mayores ganancias permitiéndole aportar a los gastos familiares, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de  mamón. Las otras socias son la señora Fátima de 25 años de edad dedicada a la venta de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace tres años, y la señora Rosa Isabel de 36 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas desde hace siete años en el mercado de la municipalidad.
texts.en: This solidarity group is made up of three enterprising women and it is coordinated by Ana Rosa, who is 35 years old and in a relationship.  She buys crops to sell in the municipal market.  She started this business two years ago with her husband's financial help and with the help of these loans.  She has managed to increase the produce she sells, which is why she has generated more earnings, allowing her to contribute to the household expenses.  She is requesting this loan to buy a crop of rambutan.  The other group members are Fátima, who is 25 years old and has sold fruit in the municipal market for three years, and Rosa Isabel, who is 36 years old and who has worked buying and selling crops in the municipal market for seven years.

loans.use: to buy a rambutan crop

loans.name: Nichalika

texts.en: Nichalika appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standard and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man who deals in hardware and also is in transport and construction businesses in Hoima, Uganda. Patrick is challenged by bad debtors and high fuel costs plus transportation costs. He has hopes of becoming the best supplier of hardware around town after increasing on his stock.
Patrick is acquiring a loan to buy more hardware to sell.

loans.use: to buy more hardware to sell.

loans.name: Above All Group

texts.en:
Gifty, a business mother who is married and has school-aged children, is in her late 30s. For three years now, she has had a business selling second hand clothing. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her seventh loan request from ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy a bale of second hand clothing to resell. She will share this loan with her loan group member, Diana. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Her ambition is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a single, hardworking lady charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children, between 4 to 6 years old, both of whom attend school. She has a bar, a business she started in order to get money to educate her children. She desires to grow her business into a well-stocked bar, offering snacks to attract more customers and increase her income. Her challenges are inadequate capital and lack of security since many of her customers tend to come late. 

Oliver is acquiring a loan to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Tumenyane Group

texts.fr:
Paris  fait partie du groupe Tumenyane  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 30  ans et est mariée à Bernadette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3  âgés de 2 à 7 ans dont 1  étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  matériaux de construction (fer à béton, clous, tôles,…)  depuis  1 an. 

Il est à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 2 sacs de clous (100 kg) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, il  voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Paris belongs to the Tumenyane group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 30 years old and married to Bernadette, who is a farmer. Together they have 3 children ages 2 to 7, with one in school.

He has been selling construction materials (rebar, nails, plates...) for one year and is on his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy 2 bags of nails (100 kg) to resell, so that she can earn more money. 

In the coming years she would like to buy a plot of land and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy two bags of nails (100 kg) to resell in order to earn more money

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Juliet has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more adult clothes for sale and will help Juliet to generate greater profits so she could pay house rent. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to open another business that sells clothes. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more adult clothes for sale,

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children who both go to school. She takes care of an additional family member. She sells fish at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week .She has been in this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more fish to sell. Her major challenges include seasonality and perishability of fish. She would like to buy a cooler in the future to store fish. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food .

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Deogratius

texts.en:
41-year-old Deogratius is a livestock farmer in Hoima, Uganda.  He is married with four children, three of which attend school.  He earns additional income from motorcycle transportation (bodaboda).  

He hopes to have educated children and diversified sources of income.  Limited capital coupled with weather changes hinder his business.
Deogratius has asked for credit to buy more cows for fattening and selling.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with one child and she attends school.  She has no additional family members. She sells local brew in a shop that she rents.  For 3 years she has operated her business on a retail basis, working 7 days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerry cans (containers) of local brew and spirits.  Her major challenge includes price fluctuations of local brew and seasonality.  Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked bar shop selling different kinds of alcohol.  She lives in a rented house with her family, without access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy jerry cans (containers) of local brew and spirits.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standard. She is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Manuel es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el manejo del campo. Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poner cualquier cultivo a producir exitosamente.
El tiene un cultivo bastante grande principalmente de yuca y otros cultivos los cuales asiste todos los días para obtener muy buenos productos y posteriormente venderlos en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Puerto Escondido.
Gracias a sus 30 años de experiencia en este oficio, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas.
El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y de esta manera inyectar capital a su actividad, dándole el impulso que necesita para progresar.
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias.
texts.en:
Manuel is a veteran with a lot of experience working in the fields.  He is humble and modest; he is very good with people and has enough energy to make any crop produce successfully.  

He has a fairly large crop that is mainly yucca and other crops that he tends to every day so he will get good produce to later sell in the market square of the municipality of Puerto Escondido. 

Thanks to his 30 years of experience in this profession, he is very capable of working and consulting in these areas.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and thereby inject capital into his business, which will give it the boost it needs to progress.

He has a great deal of faith in his business and great hope in supportive people.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Sacinta

texts.en:
Sacinta is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Simangele

texts.en: Simangele is 25 years old and lives in the Umguza District of Zimbabwe with her three children. She has been successfully raising broilers in batches of 25 birds every six weeks for nine months now.  She is also a Learner Guide who volunteers in taking students through the Better World sessions and teaching them life skills. She is planning to increase the number of broiler birds that she produces per batch using the loan that she is requesting from Kiva. This would help increase her sales and profits. With increased profits, she intends to pay fees for her children and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To buy more broilers for her poultry business.

loans.name: Sibongile

texts.en: Sibongile is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a flea market stall for six months now, where she sells men's and women’s clothes. Sibongile volunteers her spare time doing philanthropic activities such as helping the elderly and the sick with food and assisting them with household chores. With the requested loan from Kiva, she intends to purchase high quality clothes in bulk to boost profits and become competitive in her business. This will help her improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Talent

texts.en:
Talent is 21 years old, and has been running a poultry project for six months now, producing batches of 25 birds every six weeks.  She also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide teaching life skills education to students.  

She is requesting a loan to increase the number of broiler chickens she can raise from 25 birds every six weeks to 25 birds every week.  This will enable her to increase sales and profits.  With the additional profits, she would like to invest in her education and to help meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase the number of broiler chickens per batch.

loans.name: Pretty

texts.en: Pretty is a 24-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her family. She has been successfully operating a flea market stand selling clothes, children’s sandals, hair chemicals, and bags for 6 months now. Pretty volunteers her spare time fetching water for the nearby secondary school. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase quality clothes in bulk to boost her profits. With additional profits she intends to provide her family with basic necessities so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hlanjiwe

texts.en: Hlanjiwe is 24 years old. She is single and is the mother of two boys. She lives in the Umguza district of Zimbabwe with her parents and children. She also looks after an orphan who is in grade three.  Hlanjiwe has been selling kitchenware for six months now. She sells pots, pans, plates, and cups. She also volunteers by disseminating health information to the people of her community.  With the requested loan from Kiva, Hlanjiwe would like to purchase better-quality kitchenware, in bulk, at lower costs from wholesalers. This would enable her to sell at more favorable prices, attract more customers, and increase her sales and profits. With additional profits, she plans to look after more vulnerable children in her community and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase better-quality kitchenware in bulk

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a 48-year-old, single mother of four children, between the ages of 21 and 28. One of her children attends school. For the last 12 years, Beatrace has been operating a restaurant in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hard-working lady who desires to build a personal house. However, she faces challenges due to price fluctuations of food products and high license fees.

She is acquiring a loan to buy food like rice and bananas (matooke) to prepare for her customers.

loans.use: to buy food like rice and bananas (matooke) to prepare for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her cosmetics store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Lilian has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells a local drink called malwa. 

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet that will help her in making the local drink, and will help Lilian to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for her family. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land . 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet that will help her in making the local drink called malwa

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used in her business.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking oil for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Lozi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lozi has operated a food cooking business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other fish sellers in her business.
 
With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, vegetables, and cooking oil for her business for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, vegetables, and cooking oil for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Tabeth

texts.en: Tabeth is a 20-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and resides in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her family. She has been successfully buying and selling cattle for two years now with assistance from her husband. Tabeth also assists girls at her local secondary school with guidance and counseling sessions. She also cleans the school premises. With the requested loan, she intends to supply the butchery where she sells the cattle with two cattle per week to meet the demand of meat and increase her sales and profit levels. With the additional profits, Tabeth would like to open her own butchery and also to remain financially independent.

loans.use: To expand her cattle business

loans.name: Jose Albeiro

texts.es:
José ha trabajado como comerciante y administrador de diferentes negocios desde hace 25 años, teniendo la oportunidad de adquirir gran experiencia en este campo. El ha tenido negocios como bares, estaderos, discotecas, cafeterías y restaurante; todos sacados adelante gracias a su buena capacidad de trabajo y empuje.
Hoy en día tiene un bar bien posicionado en el municipio de Itagüí desde donde presta sus servicios desde las 8:00 am hasta las 11:00 pm.
Genera empleo a 6 personas y en ocasiones su esposa le ayuda en el negocio (Ver Foto).
Tiene el deseo de mejorar la presentación de su local y hacerlo mucho más llamativo para sus clientes, así podrá mejorar sus ventas y servicio, es por esto que solicita un crédito, para realizar la compra de pintura y pagar la mano de obra.
Con este préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio y con este podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo (Ver Foto).
texts.en:
Jose has worked as a trader and as an administrator for different businesses for 25 years; this has allowed him to acquire a lot of experience in this field. He has owned businesses such as bars, inns, discotheques, cafeterias and a restaurant. They have all moved forward thanks to his good work capacity and perseverance. 

Nowadays, he owns a bar that is well positioned in the municipality of Itagüí where he provides his services from 8:00 am to 11:00 PM. He generates employment for six people and in certain occasions his wife helps him at the store (see photo). 

He wishes to improve the presentation of his store and to make it more appealing for his customers, that way he will improve his sales and his services; this is why he is requesting a loan; to purchase paint and to pay the workers. 

This loan will allow him to improve his business and to offer a better quality of life for his son (see photo).

loans.use: to purchase paint and to pay workers to improve his store.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a manicurist and works in a beauty salon in Yerevan. She lives there with her daughter. Svetlana also has a son who has moved to the Russian Federation to earn money and support his family financially. Svetlana is an experienced professional who has been engaged in this business for many years. As her number of her clients grows, she needs sometimes to go to her clients herself. This really helps avoid queues and save a lot of time. That is why Svetlana has decided to buy a car (Nissan March) that will allow her to move more freely and much faster from one place to another. Svetlana has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.​

loans.use: to purchase a Nissan March car

loans.name: Lorraine

texts.en:
Lorraine is a 22-year-old business woman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe.  She has been successfully practicing horticulture for the past year now.  She was given this piece of land by her parents and decided to grow leaf vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and butternuts so that she can become financially independent.  When she is not working in the garden, Lorraine volunteers as a cook during sport days at her nearest school and fetches water for old and disabled people.  

With the requested loan she intends to buy more seeds, fertilizers, and chemicals to improve the quality of the crops and quantity of produce so that she can have additional sales and profits.  With additional profits she hopes to assist her siblings with fees.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kwanele

texts.en:
Kwanele is a 20-year-old from the Umguza District of Zimbabwe.  She is a single mother of one child.  She runs a stall at the local flea market selling clothing and accessories.  She started this business when she finished her secondary school classes two years ago.  Kwanele is also a volunteer in her community who disseminates health information in her local schools and the community. 

Kwanele plans to use the loan to purchase more clothing stock so that she could improve sales and profits.  She loves her business and has a dream of expanding it.  She intends to use the profits to pay the school fees for her dependents.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing stock to improve sales and profits.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en: Sebastian is a 30-year-old married man with one child, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in ultra sound services in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from his government salary from a hospital where he works as a radiographer. He started his business to help his people from his village that needed scan services and medical services as they are far from the main hospital. He is faced with a lack of capital to make complete payment on his ultrasound machine. He is requesting a loan to pay off the ultrasound machine.

loans.use: to pay off the ultrasound machine.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah deals in a produce business in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking woman charged with a responsibility of taking care of three children between the ages of 20 and 25 years old, alongside three dependents. She started the business so as to educate her children. She earns side income from rentals and dreams of expanding her business into new market areas. However, seasonal changes and high transport costs affect her profits.
Sarah will use the money to buy more beans, nuts, and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans, nuts, and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Baye Modou

texts.fr:
Baye Modou, est un jeune de 19 ans qui s’active dans l’agriculture depuis 2 ans. Il vient pour la première fois, solliciter un crédit pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais et pouvoir cultiver et nourrir sa famille car il est marié et père d’un enfant. Baye Modou habite chez ses parents et la dépense est partagé entre lui et ses frères qui vivent aussi dans la maison. Avec les revenus de son activité, il peut gérer les besoins familiaux et offrir tant soit peu à sa famille de bonnes conditions de vie.
Néanmoins Baye Modou aspire à avoir un toit, un jour et à maximiser son profit, en faisant autre chose que l’agriculture par exemple l’élevage bovine et ovine. Il aimerait aussi ouvrir un magasin de ventes de céréales.
texts.en:
Baye Modou is a 19-year old man who has been working as a farmer for two years.  This is the first time that he is seeking a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers to be able to grow crops and support his family since he is married and has one child. Baye Modou lives with his parents and together with his brothers, who live in the same house, provides for household expenses. Thanks to the revenues from his business, he will be able to provide for household needs and improve his family's life conditions at least to some extent.

However, Baye Modou aspires to have a roof one day and to maximize his profits doing something other than agriculture, such as cattle and sheep breeding. He would also like to open a store that sells grains.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He practices agriculture, growing beans, cassava, and maize to obtain food and income.  To diversify his income, he started buying and selling maize to earn income to improve the livelihood of his family.  His hardship is that the business is seasonal.  Farmers have two planting and harvesting seasons during the year depending on rainfall patterns for production.  

His vision is to start transporting produce to urban centers where prices are attractive.  Benard needs the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a poultry project selling broiler chickens to feed her community. She has been trained as a Camfed Learner Guide, and volunteers weekly at the local school, helping children with their studies. She also trains other younger women in her community on business skills. 

With a Kiva loan, Blessing intends to make bulk purchases of chicks as well as the feed and supplies needed to raise and sell them. This will help to boost her profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand to a larger business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chick feed in bulk

loans.name: Tapiwa

texts.en:
Tapiwa is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for a year now, producing batches of 50 broiler birds every six weeks.  Tapiwa is also a Learner Guide at the nearest secondary school in her community where she teaches students life skills.  

With the requested loan, she intends to increase her production capacity to 50 batches of broiler birds every week to meet demand and increase sales and profits.  She hopes to further expand her business to poultry butchery with the increased profits, and create employment for her community.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of chickens.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which sells chicken birds. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more birds and feeds for the poultry business and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and increase her capital and her savings. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more birds and feeds for the poultry business

loans.name: Lovisa

texts.en:
Lovisa is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Lovisa has been working hard to manage her small clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Lovisa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale, and will help Lovisa to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Lovisa hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her parents house. 

Lovisa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, as well as a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Goretti's group is comprised of hard-working women. Goretti is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has 2 children, 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Goretti has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells a local drink called malwa. 

To help expand her business, Goretti has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet that will help her in making the local drink, and will help Goretti generate greater profits and improve more on her business as well as her family's standards of living. Goretti hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Goretti is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities as well as a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more millet that will help her in making the local drink

loans.name: Felisters

texts.en:
Felisters has operated a tailoring business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.  Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a tailoring school in future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Nuska

texts.ru: Нуска, 29 лет, замужем, есть 2 малолетних детей. У Нуски среднее образование, она работает в местной школе техничкой, однако заработная плата небольшая и приходится искать дополнительный заработок, так в 2007 году Нуска стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нуски на сегодняшний день у нее есть 1 бычок и 1 лошадь, а также 1,50 ГА земли, где Нуска выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуска обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Нуска считает, что покупка дойной коровы позволит получать дополнительный доход от реализации молока, что улучшит благосостояние семьи и позволит накопить средства на завершение строительства жилого дома семьи Нуски.
texts.en: Nuska is 29 years old and married, with two underage children. Nuska has received secondary education. She works as a janitor at the local school, but her salary is low, and she is forced to seek a supplementary source of income. Since 2007, Nuska has been raising livestock and growing farm produce, having started with a sum of 15,000 KGS. Thanks to Nuska's hard work, at present she owns one calf and one horse as well as 1.5 ha [3 acres] of land, where she grows potatoes, grains and sainfoin [a forage plant]. In order to develop her business further, Nuska has aplied to the Bai Tushum & Parnters microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy a cow. Nuska believes that buying a cow will allow her to receive more revenue from selling milk.  In this way, she will improve her familys life conditions and save up for completing the construction work on a house for Nuska and her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children, one in school and one underage.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years she has operated a business of selling lesos (women's wrap) cloth.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase pieces of lesos cloth (women's wrap) for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of lesos cloth (women's wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Dagoberto Antonio

texts.es:
Al hablar de Dagoberto se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma, siempre buscando sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una buena educación con los recursos que dispone.
El vive en una humilde finca en el municipio de Valencia, Córdoba donde convive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, de los cuales dos ya son mayores de edad, son ellos por los cuales ha luchado incansablemente durante toda su vida.
El se gana la vida trabajando en un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual atiende todos los días ya que es una actividad que demanda mucho tiempo.
Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agropecuarios, adicional a esto requiere capitalizar su actividad para garantizar su permanencia.
El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario que se interesan en este tipo de actividades.
texts.en:
When speaking of Dagoberto, it is evident that he is a very hardworking and helpful man and that everything he does is for the good of his family and their well-being, always trying to help his children get ahead and offer them a good education with the resources at his disposal.
He lives on a humble property in the municipality of Valencia, Cordoba, where he resides with his wife and three children. Two of them are already of the age of majority and for them he has struggled without rest his whole life.
He makes a living working in the cultivation of bananas and yuca which he attends to every day since it is an activity that demands a lot of time.
He is a hardworking and steadfast individual who is very loving with his children.
He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and in addition he needs to capitalize his activity to insure his tenure.
He has the hope of being able to find help from people with solidary hearts who are interested in this type of activity.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise and mobile phone recharge cards for the grocery store

loans.name: Tzucubal, Nahualá Iii Group

texts.es: Juan (aparece en la foto de último de izquierda a derecha de suéter negro),  es una persona de 50 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, Juan quiere cultivar nuevamente maíz para la alimentación de su familia y lo que le queda lo sacará al mercado y obtener algún ingreso para cubrir necesidades vitales de su familia, cuando no tenía el crédito para el mantenimiento de maíz no podía dedicarse a otras actividades porque ocupan mucho tiempo para conseguir el capital y no podía aspirar a otras metas por la falta de capital, Juan necesita un crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico y pago de jornales) anteriormente por la falta de asesoría las cosechas era muy bajas, ahora ha aumentado la cantidad de cosecha por la asesoría que reciben, el sueño de Juan es comprar dos ganados vacunos para engordar.
texts.en: Juan (who is the last one looking from left to right and wearing a black sweater in the photo), is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Nahualá in the department of Sololá.  Juan wants to grow corn again to feed his family and take whatever's left to the market to generate some income to cover his family's vital necessities.  When he did not have the loan to tend to the corn he was not able to do other work because they require a lot of time to earn money and he could not set other goals because of a lack of money.  Juan needs a loan to buy supplies (chemical fertilizer and money to pay for labor).  Previously, because of a lack of advice, his harvests were very small, but now he has increased his harvests because of the advice he has received.  Juan's dream is to by cattle to fatten.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his corn crop

loans.name: Dinamicas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario las dinámicas lo integran cuatro socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Eveling de 26 años de edad y casada, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos AVON y ropa desde hace seis años impulso este negocio con la liquidación que obtuvo en la empresa donde laboró, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cremas corporales, body, pinturas labiales,  pantalón kalúa, pantalón jean, camisetas, ropa interior, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Francis de 31 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en las calles de su comunidad, la señora Ruth de 30 años de edad quien se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio y la señora Milagros de 20 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace dos años.
texts.en: The Las Dinámicas Solidarity Group is made up of four hardworking members and it is coordinated by Eveling, who is 26 years old and married.  She has sold AVON Cosmetics and clothing for six years.  She started this business with the severance she received from the business where she worked.  She is requesting this loan to buy body creams, lipsticks, Kalúa brand pants, jeans, tops, underwear, etc.  The other group members are Francis, who is 31 years old and sells new clothing on foot in her community; Ruth, who is 30 years old and butchers pork in her home; and Milagros, who is 20 and has been buying and selling produce at the municipal market for two years.

loans.use: to buy body creams, lipsticks, Kalúa brand pants, jeans, tops, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alassane, est chauffeur de profession, il est célibataire sans enfant et a une bonne connaissance dans son domaine d’activité, car cela fait plus de 5 ans qu’il exerce ce métier. Il conduit son propre véhicule et vient solliciter pour la 3ème fois, un crédit qui va lui permettre d’effectuer des travaux de réfection sur son véhicule.
Alassane n’a pas de charges qui le fatiguent, sinon qu’il envoie chaque fin du mois, une somme à ses parents au village.
Il désire avoir un autre véhicule pour augmenter son revenu.
texts.en: Mr. Alassane works as a driver. He is single, childless, and has a good knowledge of his business because he has been doing his job for over five years.  He drives his own vehicle and is asking for his third loan, one that will enable him to repair his vehicle. Alassane does not have expenses that strain him, otherwise he sends, at the end of each month, money to his parents in the village. He wishes to have another vehicle to increase his income.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Trinidad Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Cándida de 53 años de edad y casada, quien es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace veinte años y solicita el crédito para la compra de pan dulce, pan simple, queso, aceite, arroz, caramelos, frijoles, leche centrolac, etc., de esta manera la socia asegura mejorara sus ingresos. Otra de las socias es la señora Karla de 20 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su domicilio desde hace diez años por lo que la mayor parte de su clientela es fija y la señora Maribel de 52 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The communal bank is comprised of three hard-working members.  Cándida, age 53, is the coordinator.  She is married, and she has a grocery store at her house.  She has been running this business for 20 years.

She is requesting the loan to buy sweet bread, bread, cheese, cooking oil, rice, sweets, beans, and milk, etc.  This way she assures improvement of her income.

Karla, age 20, is another member.  She has been selling clothes at her house for ten years.  Therefore, most of her customers are fixed.

Maribel, age 52, has a grocery store at her house.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sopiko

texts.en:
Sopiko is a 22-year-old young woman, from the village Kvenatkotsa. She has a six-member family and only two of them are employed. In particular, Sopiko's husband works as a private worker and generates insignificant income, and her father-in-law is a worker at a sugar factory. In order to improve her family's living conditions and be involved in her own business, Sopiko has planned to start a clothing business. She requested a loan to MFO Credo, which finances start-up businesses. Sopiko was approved for a loan of 1,500 GEL and will purchase clothing at wholesale prices to sell in her community. Sopiko will be able to have her own income and satisfy a few needs of her family herself. 

She will be grateful for Kiva lenders' help and will do her best to develop her business. Sopiko awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start a clothing business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother of four children, two of whom are adopted. She runs a cereals business and owns rental houses in the expansive Mukuru informal settlements. She has had challenges in providing reliable sanitation for her tenants in the past which lead her to look for alternatives that will effectively counter the issue. 

While at it, she learned about Fresh Life toilets and got interested in putting up the toilets for her tenants. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet. The facility will help her tenants live comfortably as well as increase the demand for the houses. She hopes to put up more facilities as soon as she's done repaying her loan.

loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius deals in produce -- mostly maize, beans and rice -- in Hoima, Uganda. He works six days a week and earns additional income from a drugstore. He started his business in 2010 so as to have several sources of income. He is married with two children aged between one and four years, one of whom attends school. Pius desires to expand his business and build his own house despite the challenge of inadequate capital. He will use the loan money to buy rice, beans and maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is a 24-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children and lives in Kwekwe District, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for 8 months now, producing batches of 25 broiler birds every six weeks with the assistance of her husband. Rachael volunteers her spare time assisting girls at the local secondary school in her community with guidance and counseling. With the requested loan, she intends to increase her production of broilers to batches of 25 birds every week to meet the demand of the take-aways and supermarkets as well as individuals to whom she sells the chickens. She will also be able to provide enough for the family with the increased profits that she will be getting.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chickens

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in the Nyanga district of Zimbabwe. She successfully runs a poultry business. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at the local school to assist students with their studies.

With the requested Kiva loan she plans to purchase more chicks and chick feed. This will help her expand her inventory and increase her profit margins. She hopes to expand her business by increasing her capacity so that she can improve her lifestyle and become financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts in bulk and buy a peanut butter machine

loans.name: Luz Benigna

texts.es: La señora Luz Benigna es una mujer laboriosa de 49 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 14 años de edad, quien ha sido el motivo de su superación, es  propietaria de una pulpería desde hace siete años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos,  cajas de jabón, etc., con este crédito la socia lograra aumentar los productos que ofrece en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Benigna, age 49, is a hard-working woman.  She is the single mother of her 14-year-old son.  He has been her motivation to excel.  She has had a grocery store for seven years.

She is requesting the loan to buy 100-pound containers of rice, beans, and sugar.  She will also buy dairy products and cartons of soap, etc.  With this loan she will manage to increase the products that she sells in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical care.

loans.name: Blanca Nube Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora María de Jesús de 49 años de edad  acompañado se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el departamento de león desde hace cinco años, este negocio lo impulso con un préstamo que le realizo a su hermano; el crédito lo solicita para la compra de canasto de mango de rosa, cosecha de mamón y mango sazón, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas debido a que estos son los productos más demandados. Otra de las socias es la señora Mario de Jesús de 47 años de edad comerciante de frutas en uno de los mercados de la capital, y la señora Ivania de 28 años de edad quien se dedica a la comercialización de futas en el mercado de León desde hace tres años.
texts.en: This is a solidary group consisting of three hardworking partners and coordinated by Maria de Jesus, 49 years old and in a relationship.  For five years, she has been making a living marketing fruit in the Department of Leon.  She started this business with a loan from her brother.  She is requesting this loan to buy a crate of pink mango and a harvest of papaya and ripe mango with the object of increasing her sales given that these products are the most in demand.  The other partners are Mario de Jesus, 47, who is a fruit merchant in one of the markets in the capital, and Ivania, 28, who has been making a living marketing fruit in the Leon market for three years.

loans.use: to buy a crate of pink mango and a harvest of papaya and ripe mango.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase more household items such as plates, cups, basins, and buckets for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more household items such as plates, cups, basins, and buckets for her business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is a 23-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chicks for six months now and she keeps them in batches of 25, every six weeks. When she is not working in her business, she helps elderly people with household chores. With the loan requested from Kiva, she intends to increase her production of the broilers to 50 birds per week. This will enable her to earn additional profits. With additional profits she intends to help her family to pay school fees.

loans.use: to increase the number of broiler chickens to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia trabaja en dos centro asistenciales a la vez que está estudiando, es casada vive con su marido, donde ambos trabajan y se ayudan.
Actualmente asiste a seminarios y está preparando su tesis porque su objetivo es tener su título Universitario para poder mejorar sus ingresos y también poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Lidia es una persona muy sacrificada que viene luchando por su meta que es la de ser una profesional útil a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar los gastos de su tesis, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por cumplir su meta. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Lidia works at two help centers, and she is going to school at the same time.  She is married, and she lives with her husband.  They both work and help each other.

She is currently attending seminars, and she is preparing her thesis because her objective is to have a university degree.  She wants this in order to be able to improve her income and to also help her family and loved ones.

Lidia is a very selfless person.  She is fighting for her goal, which is to be a professional who is useful to other people.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her thesis expenses.  This way she will be able to continue studying and struggling to reach her goal.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, and it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
This is Binti. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her vegetable stall business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase green vegetables for resale. She appreciates Kiva for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ricardina tiene 53 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura y ganaderia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ricardina is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusi Ccoyllor” which is located in the District of Vilcabamba in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. Ricardina divides her time between her daily activities and her farming and ranching duties. She has been in business for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Ricardina wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy compost and seeds. She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 25-year-old woman who lives in the District of Nyanga, Zimbabwe. She is happily married with a one-year-old child. Florence runs a small business, buying and selling clothing and also raising and selling broiler chickens to help feed her community. She has also volunteered to serve as a community health trainer since 2005.

With the requested loan, Florence intends to make bulk purchases of clothes for children and adults and also plans to expand her poultry project which will help to boost her business and supply more people in the community with food. More income will help her support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk and more chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Bahati has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market providing services to passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to pay school fees and add stock to her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees and add stock to her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Tafara

texts.en:
Tafara is 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married with 2 children. She lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She successfully runs a small business, farming potatoes. She also volunteers each week as a Learner Guide at her local school assisting students with their studies. 
With a Kiva loan, Tafara intends to purchase farming equipment and supplies like fertilizers and chemicals to help boost her crops and raise her profits. She hopes to expand into a larger operation to better provide for her family and create more employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Ottilia

texts.en: Ottilia is a 26-year-old businesswoman who is married with one child and lives in Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her family. She has been successfully operating a flea market for 3 years now. She sells babies’ clothes. However, due to limited funds, she hasn’t had the capacity to employ anyone to assist her in the business. Therefore, her family members help her with the business. When she is not working at her flea market, Ottilia offers guidance and counselling sessions to students at the nearby secondary school. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase more quality clothes from wholesalers so as to reduce costs and be able to sell at reasonable prices. With additional profits, she hopes to own a boutique and create employment for the people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the 25,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Sikhanyisiwe C

texts.en: Sikhanyisiwe C is 22 years old. She lives in the Umguza District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings since she is not yet married. She has been in the poultry business for two years now, producing a batch of 50 broiler birds every six weeks. With the requested loan from Kiva, she would like to increase production to 100 chicks every six weeks. In addition to being a businesswoman, Sikhanyisiwe C is also a volunteer who assists the needy families in her community with food. She is planning to help more when she gets additional profits from her business.

loans.use: to increase production to 100 chicks every six weeks.

loans.name: Thembelihle

texts.en: Thembelihle is a 22-year-old member of Cama (Camfed’s alumnae association) and a businesswoman. She is a married mother of one, living in the Umguza District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a stall at the local flea market for four months now. She sells clothes for men, women, and children. Apart from her business, she also volunteers as a community health activist who disseminates health information to the people of her community. Thembelihle would like to use the loan that she is requesting from Kiva to purchase more clothes to sell and expand the business through the increased profits that she would be getting. By this, she would also be creating employment for the people of her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell and expand the business through the increased profits that she would be getting.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 1 year, Jesca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Jesca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business and will help Jesca to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jesca hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Jesca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is divorced and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Maria cooks food to sell at the market and she sells to town-dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. Maria decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Milly has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food for sale and will help Milly to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and some basic needs. Milly hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a widowed woman with eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, comenta que siempre ha trabajado con sus padres en la producción y venta de leche y queso para solventar los gastos de estudio que tiene, estudia la carrera de docente, ya que está estudiando la carrera de profesor en educación física.
Él se está esforzando y luchando por poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Edgar is from the city of Paraguarí. He says that he has always worked with his parents in their job of producing and selling milk and cheese in order to pay for his educational expenses. Edgar is studying to become a teacher, so he is earning his teaching degree in Physical Education.

He is striving and struggling to become someone in life so that he can help his family through his work. Edgar is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his university fees. This will enable him to continue his studies in the same manner as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Veronica Liseth

texts.es: Verónica de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy tenaz que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos por la  mañana en un lugar y en las tardes plancha ajeno, su esposo apoya con la economía del hogar gracias a su trabajo de albañil. Verónica desea cambiar el techo del patio ya que este se encuentra muy dañado, también desea reparar el servicio sanitario y comprar ventanas por lo que solicita un Crédito a FUSAI para comprar láminas y polines para cambiar el techo, cemento, arena y ladrillo para reparar el servicio sanitario, y también comprará ventanas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 32 years old and lives with her husband and eight-year-old child. She is a tenacious woman who earns her living by providing housekeeping services in the mornings at one place and at another place in the afternoons. Her husband contributes to the household finances thanks to his job as a bricklayer.

Verónica wants to replace the roof over her patio since it is severely damaged. She also wants to repair the septic system and buy windows. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can buy corrugated sheets and wooden beams in order to replace the roof. She will also acquire cement, sand, and bricks in order to repair the septic system, as well as windows.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to replace the roof and repair the septic system, as well as purchase windows.

loans.name: Amina Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Amina Al- Hodeidah. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Zahra is a hardworking woman. She is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, and she lives with them in a poor area in Hodeidah. She is the leader of the group. 

In order to help her husband with the expenses of the family, Zahra decided to work in the dressmaking business. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Her business lacks many of the materials required for sewing, and her capital still is low. For this reason, Zahra applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and buttons, in order to improve her business.

Zahra looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a small store for dressmaking and by buying many sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, and buttons, in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Cristo Rey, con 17 mujeres que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo unido. Son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando y sacrificándose, se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Maria, quien es una gran artesana en madera.
Ella hace todo tipo de artesanías y es por medio de su trabajo que está saliendo adelante. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que se destaca por su esfuerzo y su sacrificio. 
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de madera y utensilios varios para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías. Ellas están contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey group is made up of 17 women who joined together to help their families by means of their united work. They are mothers and heads of their families who work and make sacrifices. 

One of the members of this group is Maria, a great artisan craftswoman who makes all types of wooden crafts. Through this work, she is able to move forward. She is a very hardworking woman who is characterized by her effort and sacrifice.

Maria is applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of wood and various supplies to continue making her artisan crafts. They are happy to have this opportunity to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

loans.use: to buy wood and supplies to make artisan crafts.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is a 20-year-old businesswoman, who lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. With assistance from other members of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, she started operating a flea market, where she has been selling clothes, bed covers and children’s sandals. 

Edina volunteers as a Learner Guide at the nearest secondary school in her community, taking students through the sessions on guidance and counselling, wellbeing and life skills. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase quality clothes in bulk. With more profits, she plans to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 22 years old, and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her farm business, which sells fresh food and fresh milk. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food and cow feed, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her business and her family's standard of living. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a cattle farm that will supply milk to0 the whole town. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for lifeskills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more fresh food and cow feed.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina optó por la carrera de Radiología por la poca cantidad de profesionales en ese ámbito de salud que carece su ciudad ya que con esto podrá ayudar a las demás personas.
Romina se está esforzando por ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a sus familias y sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios.
Ella pide este préstamo para que por medio de el pueda pagar las cuotas de su estudio y seguir luchando por medio de esto como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Romina decided to study a degree in Radiology due to the low number of professionals in this healthcare field in her city. With this degree, she will be able to help others.

Romina is working hard to become someone in life and to help her family and loved ones through her studies. She is applying for a loan to pay for her tuition fees and continue fighting.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa tiene 46 años, es casada vive con su marido y con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son mayores y 1 es aun pequeño.
Comenta que de joven habían viajado al exterior y que allí se hizo de un poco de ahorros que luego trajo para poder montar la pequeña olería que tiene.
Ella pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una carpa y para la construcción de un galpón, ya que con ello podrá seguir con la producción de ladrillos que hace y que con él dan a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que no pasen necesidades.
texts.en:
Teresa, 46, is married and lives with her husband, with whom she has three children. Two of her children are already older and one is still young. When she was younger, Teresa traveled abroad and saved some money, which she brought home to open a small brickmaking workshop. 

She is applying for a loan to buy a tarp and build a storehouse so that she can continue making bricks and give her family everything they need, so that they do not lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy a tarp and build a storehouse to make bricks.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
El Sra. Mirian es una joven madre que vive en Carapeguá, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y servicial, trabaja como empleada doméstica y los fines de semanas es macatera (vendedora ambulante) cuenta con clientela formada de años de actividad en el rubro. Gracias a su trabajo puede mantener y educar a sus 6 hijos.
Ella quiere que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan ser alguien en la vida y sean profesionales útiles a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para la venta ambulante, como ser calzados, prendas y demás.
texts.en:
Mirian is a young mother who lives in Carapeguá. She is a very hardworking, service-oriented person. She works as a domestic employee. On the weekends, she works as a traveling saleswoman. She has a fixed clientele due to her years of experience in this field. Thanks to her work, she is able to sustain and educate her six children.

She wants her children to be someone in life and become professionals who are useful to society. 

She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of various items for her traveling sales, such as footwear, clothing, and more.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 23-year-old businesswoman. She is divorced with one child, and lives in the Nyanga district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a duel tailoring shop and hair salon at her local business center. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at the local school to provide support to schoolchildren.

With a Kiva loan, Patience intends to purchase fabric in bulk, a sewing machine, hair treatments, and other supplies to boost her sales volume and profits. She hopes to expand into a larger retail operation.  Higher income will help her provide better for her and her child, and will also help create more employment in her community.

loans.use: to buy fabric, a sewing machine and hair products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de empresa, está cursando el 4to. año, su meta es terminar sus estudios y ayudar a su familia y cumplir todos sus sueños.
 Le inspira su mama que es una señora que quedó viuda desde que Maria era pequeña y lucho mucho por salir adelante y quiere retribuirle todo lo que ella lucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, de manera a seguir con su esfuerzo y lucha de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Maria is a fourth-year Business Administration student. Her goal is to finish her studies, help her family, and make all of her dreams come true.

She is inspired by her mother, who became a widow when Maria was young and who fought hard to move ahead. Maria wants to pay back everything her mother fought for.

She is applying for a loan to pay her university tuition fees so that she can continue working and fighting to become a professional.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Neymet

texts.en: Neymet is 36 years old. He has been married for 14 years and has two children. One is a 10-year-old son who is in fourth grade, and the other is a 9-year-old daughter who is in third grade. His wife is a housewife. Neymet has a “chayxana”, which in English is a teahouse. In it Neymet serves tea and different desserts to customers. Today Neymet needs a loan of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to buy a gas stove, pots and pans, and other necessary things for his business. He says great thanks for the support from Kiva and its lenders. In the future he wants to repair his “chayxana” and to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove, pots and pans, and other necessary things

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramon trabaja hace años en esta actividad con la venta de Medicamentos no controlados , bolsas de polietilenos en las ciudades aledañas a San Lorenzo.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su venta ambulante está saliendo adelante y por medio de esto tiene los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Quiere seguir creciendo y trabajando, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar medicamentos no controlados, bolsas de todo uso, etc. Y así seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramon has been selling over-the-counter medicines and polythene bags in the cities in the vicinity of San Lorenzo for several years.
He is a very hard working person and thanks to his traveling street vending he is progressing and therefore has the necessary means that allow him to help his family.
He wants to continue growing and working, this is why he is requesting this loan, to be able to purchase over the counter medicines, all purpose bags, etc. and in this way be able to continue his sales.

loans.use: purchase over-the-counter medicines and bags for sale

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian anteriormente vivía con sus padres pero al culminar su colegio se mudó a la ciudad de Asunción.
Cristhian está estudiando para ser Técnico en refrigeración de la modalidad de Formación Profesional, tiene como meta culminar sus estudios y a un tiempo no muy lejano abrir sus propia empresa con todas las herramientas que obtendrá gracias a sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de estudios, como materiales, libros y demás.
texts.en: Cristhian previously lived with his parents, but upon finishing school he moved to the city of Asuncion. Cristhian is studying to be a professionally trained refrigeration technician. His goal is to finish his studies and not long there after open his own company with all the tools he will obtain thanks to his studies. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his education costs, such as utensils, books and more.

loans.use: pay for education expenses such as utensils, books and more

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new stocks of baby clothes to resell for the coming Id Mubaraka.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in the Umguza District of Zimbabwe. She is single and has one child. She has been running a poultry project for eight months now and she produces batches of 25 broiler birds every six weeks.
