Noreen also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide, leading weekly sessions on well-being and life skills to students at her local school. With the loan, she would like to purchase more feed, feed troughs, vaccines, as well as more chicks, so that she can increase the capacity of her business and raise 100 broiler birds every six weeks. This will help in meeting the demand for chickens in her community and improve the sales and profit levels. With more profits, she would like to provide her family with their basic needs, as well as assist the other needy children in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more feed, feed troughs, vaccines, and chicks

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a divorced woman with seven children, four of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mwanamisi prepares sweet dumplings and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 28 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, trabaja como ayudante en una Peluquería desde hace 9 años, se puede decir que ya tiene bastante experiencia, le gusta lo que hace por ello pensó en estudiar esa profesión para hacerlo de una manera profesional.
Quiere poder montar algún día su propia peluquería para trabajar en su casa propia; la persona con quien trabaja le impulsa a que estudie, también su marido que es mecánico le ayuda en esta meta que se propuso.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos en la profesión de peluquera que está estudiando, como ser cuotas y materiales.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, she is married and has two small children. She has been working as an assistant at a hair salon for the past 9 years, it could be said that she has a lot of experience. She likes what she does and therefore decided to study this profession in order to do it in a professional manner.
She wants to, some day, start her own hair salon and work in her own home. The person who she works with drives and motivates her to study, her husband, who is a mechanic, also helps her with this goal she has set for herself.
She is requesting this loan in order to pay for expenses related to the hair dresser career she is pursuing, such as fees and materials.

loans.use: pay fees and materials

loans.name: For Christ Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of 'For Christ Group' and they are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of six members and they are into the sale of fish, porridge, foodstuffs, provisions, cooked rice, and stew. 

The loan that they will take will benefit the small businesswomen, including Thoedora. She says that she joined ID Ghana two years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She has a business, selling fish for 21 years now. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying more fish from the fishermen and selling them to customers, at retail. This work allows her to generate resources for her family since she is married and has four dependent children. 

When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, Thoedora said she likes the training, the savings, and the health programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy more fish from the fishermen, to sell to customers, at retail.

loans.name: Alh. Mohammed

texts.en:
Alh. Mohammed is a 38-year-old farmer from Gwanki.  As a Babban Gona member,  Alh. Mohammed is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Mohammed can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh. Mohammed is ambitious and aims to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. He is confident that he can achieve this as a result of the improved seeds and fertilizers that he will obtain with this loan. When asked about the future, Alh.Mohammed said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, and in five years time, I want to be the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Alh. Mohammed is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Hofladé

texts.fr:
Agée de 51ans, célibataire sans enfant résidant à Tokoin, Hofladè vend des biscuits, huile et des œufs à la devanture de sa maison. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de Gbossimé deux fois par mois.
Hofladè sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices et augmenter son épargne.

Avec son épargne, Hofladé compte payer les charges de location.
texts.en: Hofladé is 51 years old, single with no children, and lives in Tokoin. She sells cookies, oil, and eggs in front of her home. She gets her supplies at the market in Gbossimé two times per month. Hofladé is seeking a loan to expand her business in order to make a greater profit to increase her savings. With her savings, Hofladé will pay her rent.

loans.use: To purchase two containers of vegetable oil and 11 trays of eggs to increase her savings to pay for rent

loans.name: Trinité

texts.fr:
Mère de 2 enfants et âgée de 42 ans, Trinité habite le quartier Tokoin où elle a commencé en 1997 le commerce d’igname dans un marché local appelé Gbossimé. L’accueil et le respect de la clientèle sont les qualités dont elle dispose.Trinité vend de lundi à vendredi, 5 jours sur 7 mais est obligée de s’approvisionner sur le marché de Bassar, une ville au nord du Togo deux fois par mois, pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. 
Pour diminuer sa fréquence d’approvisionnement, ainsi diminuer le coût du transport, Trinité sollicite un crédit pour acheter 120 tubercules d’igname.
texts.en: Trinité is the mother of two children and is 42 years old. She lives in the Tokoin neighborhood, where in 1997 she started selling yams in the local Gbossimé market. Trinité is welcoming and respectful of her customers. She sells [yams] from Monday to Friday, five days out of seven, but is obliged to get her supplies from the Bassar market, in northern Togo, two times per month, in order to meet customer demand. In order to reduce how frequently she has to seek supplies, as well as to reduce the cost of travel, Trinité is seeking a loan to purchase 120 yams.

loans.use: To purchase 120 yams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animals, to start the butcher business, and in addition to invest a portion of the money in the cultivation of basic grains.

loans.name: Faby

texts.en: Faby uses his motorcycle to pick up his stock and go through the village to sell it easily. This helps him to get his stock moving faster. After receiving a full payment on his last one, he's coming back to us now to take out a new loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Selnys

texts.en: Selnys used the "door to door" marketing in his community to help him. He sold out  his last stocks so fast, and acquired more customers, which pushed him to increase his stock. Now he is coming back to us for a fifth loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Dúo Hombres De Valor Group

texts.es:
Dúo Hombres de valor
El señor Maycon Jordan es originario de Patzicia, el  se dedica a la elaboración  de cajas de madera para empacar diferentes tipos de verduras como lechuga, papa, rabanos y apio, hasta el momento le ha ido bien pero tienen muy pocas ganancias, y tienen que sacar adelante a su familia. viendo la necesidad,El tomo la desicion de abrir  una tienda y así poder ayudarse  con sus gastos, pero como el tiempo está muy difícil  el no cuenta con más capital para poder surtir la tienda por esta esta solicitando a FAPE KIVA su préstamo y poder invertir su sueños es tener su tienda mas grande.
texts.en:
Dúo Hombres de Valor
Mr Maycon Jordan is originally from Patzicia. He makes wooden cases for a living, which are used to pack different types of vegetables, such as lettuce, potatoes, radishes and celery. Up until now he has been successful, although he does not earn very much, and he needs to support his family. Seeing the need, he decided to open a shop in order to help with expenses. However given that times are hard, he does not have any more capital to stock the shop; this is why he is asking FAPE KIVA for a loan, to be able to invest in his dream of having a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy edible products to sell in their shop

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Oaxaca, la población depende en gran parte del ingenio azucarero La Margarita, ya que este produce en promedio 102,712 toneladas de azúcar por zafra, y para dicha producción participan poco más de 2,400 personas de la región. La parroquia San Vicente de Paul celebra a su santo patrono el 16 de julio cuando se celebran las primeras comuniones y el 19 de julio las confirmaciones y misa en honor del santo patrón, hay bailables, canto, banda de viento y juegos pirotécnicos.

En esta comunidad se formó un grupo solidario llamado “El Amanecer” las integrantes comentan que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron pues el amanecer es hermoso en su comunidad. Cada una de ellas se dedica a una actividad diferente: Luz-Servicio De Internet, Daniela- Venta De Ropa, Anayeli-Venta De Pollo, Kenia- Venta De Articulos Para El Hogar Por Catalogo, Laura- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo y Arcenia- salón de belleza.

Arcenia estudio para estilista y logró establecer una estética unisex desde hace ya 11 años al principio pagaba renta ahora ha logrado uno de sus sueños y con las ganancias obtenidas durante todo este tiempo juntó el dinero suficiente para la construcción de su propio local. De la misma manera, pagó los estudios de sus hijos con ayuda de su esposo, es por eso que ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de material para continuar prestando sus servicios como estilista(Tintes, Planchas, Talcos ,Tijeras Para La Venta, Capas, Guantes, Cera),comenta que sus hijos y sus padres son la mejor motivación para salir adelante. Da gracias a Kiva y a VisionFund México por el apoyo que recibirá.
texts.en:
In a community of Oaxaca, the population is largely dependent on the sugar mill La Margarita, as this produces an average of 102,712 tons of sugar per harvest, and this production involves just over 2,400 people in the region. The St. Vincent de Paul parish celebrates its patron saint on July 16 when first communions take place, and on July 19 confirmations and Mass in honor of the patron saint are celebrated; there is dancing, singing, brass bands, and fireworks.

In this community, a solidarity group called “El Amanecer” [The Sunrise] was formed. The members say that the name of the group was chosen because the sunrise is beautiful in their region. Each member is dedicated to a different activity: Luz-internet service; Daniela-clothing sales; Anayeli-chicken sales; Kenia-sales of home items by catalog; Laura-sales of shoes by catalog; and Arcenia-beauty salon.

Arcenia studied to be a stylist and succeeded in establishing a unisex salon 11 years ago. At first she paid rent; now she has achieved one of her dreams and with the earnings that she has made during this time she saved enough money to build her own salon. Similarly, she paid for her children's education with the help of her husband. That's why she has applied for a loan to invest in the purchase of material to continue offering her services as a stylist (dyes, straightening irons, powders, scissors to sell , capes, gloves, hair wax). She says that her children and parents are her greatest motivation to succeed. She thanks Kiva and VisionFund Mexico for the support that she will receive.

loans.use: to buy dyes, straightening irons, powders, scissors to sell , capes, gloves, hair wax.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Don Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura siembra tomate, maíz, frijol y café. Ya ha tenido varios créditos y ha sido bien responsable en sus pagos el sueño de él es tener algún día su invernadero y por ello es que lucha. Sus pagos los ha hecho puntuales y solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono químico y orgánico.
texts.en: Oswaldo works in agriculture growing tomatoes, corn, beans and coffee. He has had a number of loans already and has been responsible in his payments. He dreams of having his own greenhouse some day and this is what he strives for. He has paid punctually and is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, organic and chemical manure.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, chemical and organic manure,

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Química, ella comenta que a la vez que trabaja también estudia, y de esa forma lucha por poder cubrir sus necesidades.
Ella quiere ser alguien en la vida, que pueda crecer y salir adelante por medio de sus estudios y su talento.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa manera podrá aligerar ese pago que necesita hacer.
texts.en:
Luz is studying a Chemical Engineering degree. She says that she works and studies at the same time, fighting to cover her needs.

She wants to be someone in life who can grow and move ahead by means of her studies and talent.

She is applying for a loan to pay fees associated with her graduation, which will lessen the burden of this payment which she needs to make.

loans.use: to pay fees associated with her graduation.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
DÚO MUJERES COMERCIANTES
La señora Silvia Leticia de 32 años de edad, soltera se dedica a la venta de ropa típica nueva y usada, desde hace 2 años, le están pidiendo algunos estilos de güipiles, entonces por eso necesita el capital  porque también tiene que comprar algunos delantales y cortes sanjuaneros, ella espera algún día su negocio sea realmente sostenible porque aun le falta capital para invertir, con su trabajo ella ayuda a su mama y a una su hermana que aun está estudiando porque ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres Comerciantes (Businesswomen Duo)

32 year old Señora Silvia Leticia is single and she has worked selling new and used traditional clothing for two years. She is seeking capital to buy some traditional blouses, as well as some bags and "cortes sanjuaneros" (traditional skirts). She hopes some day that her business will be truly sustainable, because as yet she lacks capital to invest. With her work she helps her mother and her sister who is still in school, because she did not have the opportunity to study herself. She hopes you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es empleado y comenta que está cursando el tercer año   de la carrera de ingeniería Agronómica.
Jorge comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, y que quiere ayudar a sus familias y sus seres queridos por medio de su profesión.
Jorge pide este préstamo para pagos de unos exámenes y unos aranceles para sus estudios. Para así poder culminar sus estudios y llegar a la meta de ser un Profesional y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his parents in the city of Curuguaty.  He goes to school and works at the same time.  He is employed, and he says that he is in the third year of his agricultural engineering studies.  Jorge states that he is getting ahead through much sacrifice and effort.  He wants to help his family and his loved ones through his profession.

Jorge is requesting this loan to pay for some exams and to make some school payments.  This way he will be able to finish his education and reach his goal of being a professional.  He will be able to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for some exams and to make some school payments.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's Group is comprised of two hard working women. Grace is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Grace has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plates, saucepans, and dishes that will help in the business. It will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve more on her business and her family's standards of living. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her plot of land and build rental houses. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more plates, saucepans, and dishes that will help in their business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, gravel, metal sheets and beams, and to pay for labor, in order to repair two walls and replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Dúo Irma De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Irma de San Pedro, La encargada de este grupo es la señora Irma Consuelo quien tiene una estética desde hace 12 años, el negocio está ubicado en la calle principal del pueblo y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y la ayuda de su hijo de 12 años la cual ya le esta inculcando la habilidad de hacer cortes para caballeros.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo cada día y llegar a tener una gran estética con varios empleados.  Tiene muchos clientes pero le hacen falta varios tintes en diferentes colores, calidad y marcas, líquidos especiales para cabello, tratamientos faciales, y necesita comprarlos. Por tal motivo solicita otro crédito para poder comprar lo que le falta y no quedarle mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Irma de San Pedro” Group

This group is led by Sra. Irma Consuelo.  She has worked as an aesthetician for 12 years.  Her business is located on the main street of her town.  She has the unconditional support of her husband and her 12-year-old son helps out since he has the ability to offer men’s haircuts.  Her dream is to continue growing each day so that she can have a successful aesthetics salon with several employees.  Irma has many customers, but she lacks a variety of hair dyes that differ in color, quality, and brand.  She also needs special liquids for men and facial treatments, so she will buy those items as well.  This is why Irma is requesting another loan to buy the things she is lacking.  She does not want to disappoint her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of hair dye and products for her salon

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: La señora Ayde de 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, con mucho esfuerzo alcanzo a estudiar hasta el bachillerato en humanidades, vive actualmente en casa de sus padres y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a su cargo, la actividad económica de Ayde es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son papa, haba, cebada y avena en su terreno propio de 3 hectáreas, dicho terreno agrícola lo compro de su padre, el mismo está ubicado en el Municipio de Tiraque. La señora demuestra ser una persona responsable y trabajadora que quiere superarse e incrementar su productividad, para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que a corto plazo le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicos que van a mejorar sus condiciones  de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Ayde is 21 years old and single. With great effort, she was able to complete her high school education in humanities. She currently lives at her parents' house and has no financial dependents. Ayde engages in farming and the products she cultivates include potatoes, beans, barley, and oats. She owns land that measure three hectares, which she purchased from her father. The land is located in the town of Tiraque.

Sra. Ayde has demonstrated that she is a responsible and hardworking person who wants to excel and increase her productivity. For this reason, she needs to request a loan in order to buy farming supplies for the short term. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jayam Shg-Thiyagarajapuram Group

texts.en:
Jayam Self Help Group consists of six members. It is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. 

Krishnaveni is the leader of the group. She is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her children and husband, Muthalagan, in the village of Thiyagarajapuram. Her husband is a farmer.
 
Krishnaveni wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which has significantly lower toxic emissions during the time of cooking than the traditional stove. With a traditional stove, there is a high risk of having lung diseases caused by the smoke that is emitted.

Along with Krishnaveni, the other members of the group are requesting a loan to purchase smokeless stoves and to have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Edwin Elvis

texts.es: El señor Edwin de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona norte de la cuidad, en un lugar no urbanizado, no está casado pero tiene su conyugue que es la señora Gisela, viven en la casa de su madre, ya que no tienen ningún patrimonio a su nombre porque ambos son jóvenes pero tienen muchas ganas de superarse, Edwin tiene un  grado de instrucción de nivel bachillerato y no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos.  Su principal actividad es el servicio de ayudante de carpintería en un taller donde elaboran muebles de melanina y por las noches asiste a unos cursos nocturnos para mejorar su nivel académico, tiene experiencia de 8 años en el rubro pero en el taller esta dos años, el presente crédito es para comprar una computadora la cual le servirá de mucho en sus estudios y así podrá seguir mejorando.
texts.en: Edwin is 26 years old and lives in the northern part of the city of Cochabamba, in an undeveloped area. He isn't married but lives with his partner, Gisela. They live in his mother's house and don't have any property of their own because they are both young, but they have a great desire to do better for themselves. Edwin has a high school degree and does not have any children who depend on him. His main source of income is working as a production assistant in a workshop where they make melamine (particle board) furniture. He has 8 years of experience in this field and has worked in this workshop for 2 years. In the evenings he attends night school in order to improve his level of education. With this loan he plans to buy a computer, which will help him with his studies, so that he can continue to better himself.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Señor Edgar vive y trabaja en Colomi; con 34 años de edad, de estado civil casado, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura hace 14 años. Siembra en terreno propio de 2 hectáreas, en el mismo lugar produce papa, haba y oca, tiene experiencia en manejo de estos cultivos, empezando desde la siembra y labores culturales. Cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde, 1 lechera y 1 ternero. Actualmente requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico(gallinaza), semillas agrícolas para la siembra y productos agroquímicos ya que quiere proveerse de estos insumos agrícolas para comenzar la siembra, ademas quiere mejorar su producción agrícola, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos económicos y por tanto mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar lives and works in Colomi. He is 34 years old, married, and financially independent. Edgar has been farming for 14 years. He plants on his own land that measures two hectares. Edgar produces potatoes, beans, and “oca” (a tuber that is grown in the Andes). He has experience in managing these crops, which includes planting and the cultivation work. Edgar owns three heads of cattle for fattening, one dairy cow, and one calf.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure), seeds for planting, and agro-chemical products. By acquiring these supplies, he can begin planting. In addition, Edgar wants to improve his farming production so that he can increase his earnings and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, seeds for planting, and agro-chemical products.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, Tabu has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is a self-employed woman from Masis. She lives there with her husband and two teenage daughters. Jointly with her husband, Lusine has been engaged in wholesale trade for many years. In particular, they are specialized in selling children's clothing. The family is now planning to expand its business a little bit to improve its financial situation. With a loan of 3,000 USD, Lusine wants to purchase working capital. As this is Lusine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase working capital.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a 32-year-old businesswoman. She is married and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a farming project growing potatoes for sale. She has been trained as a community health volunteer. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at her local school assisting students every week with their studies.

With the requested Kiva loan, Jesca intends to make bulk purchases of farming supplies including fertilizers, seeds, and chemicals to boost her volume and profits. She hopes to expand into a larger operation to provide for her family, raise her standard of living, and provide employment opportunities for others in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of farming supplies.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully farming potatoes and has employed ten workers to assist her. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at her local school assisting students with their studies. 
With a Kiva loan, Agnes intends to purchase farming equipment and supplies like fertilizers and pesticides to help boost her crops and raise her profits. She hopes to expand into a larger operation to better provide for her family and create more employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian se ve trabajando en unos años en su profesión, está estudiando la carrera de radiología, por medio de la cual quiere poder realizarse como persona y como profesional.
Ve un gran futuro con su carrera y es por eso que también ha optado por ella. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Fabian sees himself working within a few years in his profession. He is studying for a radiology career, by which he will be able to reach personal and professional fulfillment. 

He sees a great future with his degree and that is why he has picked it. He asks for the loan to pay his tuition fees and that way continue studying as he has been doing.

loans.use: pay college tuition.

loans.name: Malligai Shg - Poosanthannur Group

texts.en:
Vijaya is the leader of the Malligai Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Poosanthannur village in the Tanjore district. Vijaya is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her children and husband, Subramanian. Her husband is small marginal farmer. 

Vijaya is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than the traditional mud stove. As the latter emits a lot of smoke, it is also called a kitchen killer as it consumes more time and money. A smokeless stove is affordable, designed for daily use and is much better than traditional stove.

Along with Vijaya, the other members are requesting a loan for the same purpose and are hoping for a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove
